description:
Wound up here as we passed it by on the way to our hotel after some fun in North Beach. The Gang of Four song that was playing made us stop and look up (always on the lookout for a bar playing good music), and it looked inviting inside so - how about a nightcap? 

Bartender (white or maybe Latino male, a little stocky) was really sweet and made us kick-ass drinks. 

The music (deep cuts vintage new wave and punk) continued to be fabulous. Loved this place. 

The only weird thing, that really has nothing to do with this bar, was that the next night it was more crowded as we passed by, some of their clientele was standing out on the sidewalk, and one young white guy loudly yelled "guten tag, motherf***ers!" at little ol' Irish and Italian-American us. Gee, I would have worn my lederhosen if I'd anticipated that one.
author: Haltone H.

description:
I think I may have found my favorite bar. That is a lot to say for someone who doesn't drink occasionally. I honestly feel like this place is an awesome place to gather some friends and have a good ol time. 

It's fairly spacious, lots of seating areas, a pool table towards the back, and bathrooms are actually pretty clean. Very intimate environment as far as lighting. Oh and how could I forget the music choice! I was dancing all night (in a chill vibe kinda way). They have a unique menu of cocktails which I was willingly to try (again I am not an avid drinker). The bartenders are fast and attentive. They were even handing out menus to the people waiting behind me. There's a huge menu on the wall so even if you didn't get a menu, it's not hard to find your drink of choice.
author: Trix P.

description:
I love this bar! The dim setting, swanky atmosphere with a neighborhood feel to it, makes this cocktail bar a great one. The paintings are unique, dark, but enticing. I love the large menu posted against the wall for everyone to see instead of fighting for a menu. They have a pool table and good music for others to dance & vibe to!

Their tables are cobble-stone which makes their interior decor super unique. I have to say, my favorite cocktail in SF right now is located in this bar and it's the Cold Brew Cocktail which is Verve's cold brew and a shot of bourbon I think? With a lemon peel mixed inside. It's definitely a unique cocktail with a strong punch. This cocktail is so far my favorite in the SF area!
author: Allister D.

description:
Cute and trendy. A friend and I went for happy hour on a Tuesday at 6:00pm and there were a comfortable amount of people.

My favorite aspect is the environment of the bar. The wooden bent sculpture decor on the walls, newspaper print modge podged on to the walls makes for a sophisticated and cool place.  I love that there is a billiards table to help with the overall vibe of the bar. 
There was plenty of seating but if you can nab it, the window seat right next to the front is the best seat in the house.

There were plenty of interesting drinks to choose from and I am excited to come to drink more. The bartenders were friendly and poured a strong tasty drink.

Definitely will come and bring more friends.
author: Stephen P.

description: This place is very good. Excellent drinks by talented mixologists   The drinks may change from time to time though. Very nice bar to relax nice atmosphere.
author: Tony C.

description:
Solid bar off Market Street in a super convenient location in the middle of the city.

Service was very very good!

Had one drink, and it was well made, but not as unique as drinks I've had at other bars.

There is a bar with seating and then tables down the other side of the bar. Plenty of room for standing, and the overall atmosphere was comfortable albeit a bit dark.
author: Michelle B.

description:
Came here for one of my first nights out in the SF and it was great! 

Given it was one of my first times out in San Francisco, I wanted to make sure I had a great night out...and this place was a great starting point. 

We were already drinking beers before going out and wanted some old fashions, and the ones here were pretty good. The bartenders were also super helpful in helping us figure out what were wanted besides those. For a Friday night of course it was packed, but we still had comfortable space around use. 

We played a few rounds of pool which was super fun and you can find the table in the back of the bar. 

If you want to access this place, it is close to both MUNI and BART. Will be back.
author: Chris O.

description: Come here for slamming cocktails! The list is really great and it's a fun spot for SF nightlife. Really fun and the place picks up energy as the night goes on. Dark, rustic vibe that it's easy to cozy up to someone sexy and just get lost in the night. Definitely come here for a night in SF to remember.
author: Alicia C.

description:
I have to say I had a great time at Blackbird. On a recent trip to San Francisco I've asked the hotel concierge where she would go for some nice cocktails on a Sunday and without hesitation, she recommended Blackbird. 

I went there with a friend around 10pm and it was fairly packed for a Sunday. The first 2 minutes we had to figure out if we had to sit ourselves, order to the bar or at a table (go to the bar and sit yourself). Once we figured it out, we picked a nice table close to the bar and the pool table in the back. 

The bartenders were nice and were more than happy to suggest us some of their favorite drinks on the menu. They were extremely knowledgeable.

It is interesting to know that all the bartenders are making the menu together and try to pull something cohesive. It changes every season. 

 The several drinks I've tried were tasteful and well balanced. A tad bit on the small size but still worth every penny.
author: Bruno G.

description: Blackbird is one of my favorite bars....they have a great selection of cocktails and it's always a unique experience
author: John H.

description:
I first read about this place in a list of best date places in Duboce/Castro area. While I wasn't here on a date I can see how this would be a good first (or any) date. It's unpretentious, not too loud and has a very comfortable/cozy vibe. Plus service was really accommodating. There is also a pool table in the back if the conversation isn't flowing. 

I was here with a friend on a Sunday afternoon. We were here maybe an hour and in that time it went from four people in the whole room to a fully packed bar and a few people at tables. So you can tell this place is popular for good reason. While the decor and room are rather dark, being here in the middle of the day there was the perfect amount of light spilling in that I didn't feel bad about drinking at 4 on a Sunday (but let's be real I've never felt guilty about drinking on a Sunday). 

I ordered a beer on tap. My friend ordered the Pimm's which is pre-made and poured from a tap. We both felt it was a little overwhelming with the ginger flavor (couldn't taste much of the other flavors) so my friend asked for a little more Pimm's. The bartender let us know that since it was pre-made he wasn't sure if there was any Pimm's left. He went to check but they were out so he suggested soda water (this definitely made the difference). My friend then ordered Grand Marnier on the rocks. Despite the bar having many unique bottles of liquor, this was not a popular one so again he had to go in the back to search for the bottle. He could have easily said they were out but it was nice for him to go get it. Behind the bar is a cooler solely filled with oversized ice cubes. I really appreciate bars with giant ice cubes so your drink is never diluted. This alone would make me come back for cocktails. Plus I just really liked the names of some of the cocktails. 

I'm disappointed after living in the area for so long that this was my first visit. I'll definitely need to make up for lost time!
author: Tarah P.

description: A big thanks to everyone at Blackbird for helping me pull off a surprise party for my boyfriend. On such short notice, they were able to reserve a space for my party of 20. Any question I had they responded within the hour. The space was perfect with a pool table and photo booth. Good music. Awesome service. I could go on...My boyfriend forgot a gift and was worried it was gone. I told him that I bet if we went back they would have it...Sure enough, I popped in the next day and they had his gift! This place is a true definition of a friendly neighborhood bar. Thanks again!
author: Grace V.

description: I think the best bar on Market street !!! My sister came for her vacation and I knew which place we should visit at first )).  I like the atmosphere here. Nice music. A big selection of drinks ))). Friendly and talkative barmen. They can advice you good drinks )). At 6 p.m this bar has happy hours. If you haven't yet visited this bar, you should do this.
author: Margo B.

description: Great place to stop by for cocktails and friendly staff. A little dark which makes it hard to see the menu but I recommend the Pimms Cup.  One bathroom stall which can make it a bit rough. Drink accordingly.
author: Veronica R.

description:
This is one of my favorite bars in SF.  Stiff drinks, knowledgable and responsive bar tenders, diverse and cool crowd, and nice layout.. Also the wall had Twin Peaks (the show) references - how cool is that?

If I ever drink again, I will be back here probably.
author: Andrew P.

description: Nice bar right next to the Church Muni exit. Drinks were good and stiff. Ambiance is nice, with plenty of space to stretch out and relax. The bartenders are very nice and professional. Wish they had more food options. Would return.
author: J. W.

description: Rudest bartenders ever!!! Bartender kept skipping over us then got all pissy when we didn't tell him our order fast enough then he forgot what I ordered anyway. Then he took a crazy long time to make our drinks.
author: Santiago S.

description:
A friend wanted to drop by for a quick drink before heading to dinner. We met up on Saturday, March 5th around 4:15pm. It was pouring rain that day, so we easily found a table.

He ended up getting the Cool as ice: white whiskey, amaro nonino, vanilla, aveze ($10) and I got a Manhattan. I liked my manhattan as it wasn't too sweet. (I think they used rye? Sometimes I find bourbon a little too sweet.) Their specialty cocktail Cool as ice was different. Due to the vanilla, it reminded of ice cream. Granted, alcoholic ice cream, but my friend seemed to like it. Another friend showed up later and ordered an Old fashioned.

The space is nice. There's a long bar to your right when you walk in and tables along the wall to your left. I also saw a pool table in the back. The tables are kind of rustic. I think they were pieces of cut tree trunks, so I found placing my drink on the table a little scary. It's not a flat surface, so you've gotta be careful. I did love the look and concept of it though.

Nice bar with a cool laid back atmosphere. Saw a couple people just hanging out, working on their laptops. Me? I had fun with my drink and some good company.
author: Elena N.

description: Came here for a low key weeknight concert after party. Cool aesthetic with reasonably priced drinks and a well-managed atmosphere. A friend of mine had rave reviewed of this place from last year and I'd defiantly be down to go back and try a few more cocktails.
author: Quinn Li O.

description: Very disappointed in a terrible customer service experience we had here. I've been to blackbird many times and generally enjoy the cocktails. I brought out of town friends here. We ordered two cocktails and a ginger beer (non alcoholic because one could not drink for health reasons). The "ginger beer" seemed to have alcohol in it. Brought the drink back to the bar and inquired about it. Bartender tastes it, has another bartender taste it, and then says "Yeah there is alcohol in there. We don't serve ginger beer in that glass." No apology, no acknowledgement or concern when we explained that we ordered a non alcoholic drink for a specific reason, no refund (or even giving us the cost difference btwn the drinks), and wtf does it matter that you wouldn't serve ginger beer in that glass (other than trying to imply it was our mistake instead of yours). They were rude, gave us a ginger beer and then moved on to the next customer.
author: Will H.

description: Great vibe, Atmosphere and design. Rusty and hip without being hipster. A Happy hour 4-8pm! With $8 well old fashioners (Evan Williams). Many other happy hour options, beer/wine/well drinks. Lots of seating for groups of friends in this deep bar. Congenial barkeeps and a generally great location. I was planning on going to another bar nearby, but it was closed when they'd listed (on Yelp) they'd be open. So I popped open the Yelp and found this nearby. So much better than the place I originally planned to go to.
author: David A R.

description:
Great place to drop in for drinks. No food, so don't come hungry 

Kind of dark inside, boyfriend wasn't too sure when we first arrived. Got better fast. Bartenders are super nice and laid back. Just order at the bar. Do ask for the crackers and hummus if you're hungry!

Fun place for just hanging out and having beer or a well crafted cocktail. Enjoy the atmosphere. 

Boyfriend likes it now.
author: Christine N.

description: New York classic style feel, with limited bar seating but smaller tables throughtout. Happy hour till 8! The bartenders craft some of the best and strongest Old Fashions I've ever had.  For $8 a piece, two can have you feeling like a champ.
author: Tanner C.

description:
A group of my friends and I came here fairly late into the night (which is probably around 1100 for us. Hahah) and the bar wasn't too busy. The ambience is almost romantic. The lights are dimmed and there are candles on each table.

The drinks were pretty good! No complaints there. And the service was great.

If you're coming here for pool, be aware that there's only 1 table and that you have to have dollar bills to play. It's also quite crowded so if the two booths at each end is full, you're more than likely to hit someone on the head. 

In conclusion, good drinks, not enough seating areas for big groups, and only 1 pool table.
author: Trina V.

description:
Lively scene on a Friday night, mix of different types of people or all ages, but a younger crowd in general.

Guy at the door checking ids was nice.

Happy Hour runs till 8pm!!

There is a list of different happy hour selections on the wall, beer, wine, cocktails, I think all were offered in one way or another.

There is a pool table in the back and there is plenty of seating.

The bar tender that made our drinks was a pro.  He had a great command on who was waiting at the bar and who was next etc.  He took orders for the next round of drinks as he was making the previous order.  He was a professional and took time and pride in the drinks he was making while also being efficient.  He was also polite and courteous and was not full of himself.  He left a very positive impression on me and it reflected well towards the venue in general (He was tall and had longish hair).

My old fashion was perfect.  Next time I'm in the area, I'll definitely stop by again.  I found the place on yelp and hopefully my yelp review will help guide others to visit.
author: Ty C.

description: Sweet stop in the Castro if you like great drinks cool atmosphere + great tunes.. Don't miss Happy Hour with high quality bartending. Convenient to muni and street parking, walk to great restaurants just a few blocks in every direction.
author: Lisa S.

description:
Came here on a Friday night around 8pm. There was a birthday party going on, but the crowd hadn't moved in yet. Even though it was pouring outside, by 9pm the whole place was packed and people were trying to reach the bar. The bartender was doing a great job of remembering the order in which people showed up though - no one was left out for too long. 

It's very dimly lit and decorated with candles and has a rustic sf style decor inside. The area in front of the bar is very narrow, but once you walk to the back of the bar there's a bigger space with a pool table. 

Their cocktail drinks are strong and unique, and they have a pretty good beer selection as well. My friend was thoroughly excited that they had a canadian tripel beer that he's been searching for. chill vibess. it was a good bar to just catch up with my friend but not have to be super classy about it.
author: Grace P.

description:
What a lot of bars lack in quality they make up in charm or kitsch--and vice versa. Blackbird hits a home run in every area you can think of.

With a Twin Peaks-inspired cocktail menu that will make any David Lynch fan reel with delight, an atmosphere that is the perfect balance of classy and cozy, wonderful service and talented bartenders, and a POOL TABLE...it's really all just a recipe for success.

They have a killer happy hour, putting most places with an even remotely similar vibe and decor to shame. $1 off draughts and $6-$8 for select happy hour cocktails, all excellently hand-crafted.

Blackbird is a great date spot, place for getting a drink alone, or meeting up with friends to chat or shoot pool. You can really dress the experience up or down, depending on your mood. Blackbird will abide.
author: Megan D.

description:
Place is cozy, staff is friendly, drinks are tasty. 

Great for a date or to hang with friends when you're in a low key mood. 

I always order the Lil' Sour Face, which has a bunch of things in it that I don't like and somehow is delicious anyway.
author: Marta F.

description: One of my favorite bars in the neighborhood. Bartenders always kill it with cocktails even when super busy. Great for small groups especially if you want to play some pool.
author: Cody L.

description: Great bar but only one bartender on service and no running water in the bathroom. I asked to fix in the men's bathroom and the employee said he just got on duty and didn't know what to do. Music is ok could use some updating!
author: Art R.

description: A friend recommended this place. Simone made some really good off menu drinks for us using cynar and rye. She also gave us some great recommendations to check out in the area. It's a nice spot with a gorgeous array of boozes like whiskeys, gins, and amaro.
author: Janine A.

description: Blackbird is absolutely one of my favorite bars in the city. It's got such a great vibe and the ambience is truly exceptional. Great beers, great decor - Blackbird is all around wonderful.
author: Meesh L.

description:
Whatever ginger ale/beer they use in their ginger drinks is freaking amazing. It was so amazing that I've been trying to get my boyfriend to come back with me just to try. 

It doesn't hurt that this this is a fun spot for happy hour drinks with coworkers/friends. I joined a friend at her work happy hour and had a great time hanging out and playing some pool.
author: Estelle C.

description: Excellent selection of whiskey/whisky. The bartenders make fantastic cocktails. The crowd is eclectic and makes for great people watching.  Ask for their variations on the old fashioned. You will not be disappointed.
author: Zardu H.

description:
This is a good place to start the night; drinks before dinner, just relaxing before going home, a bar crawl, dates, you name it. Whenever possible friends and I stop by here first, albeit this spot is never our last stop of a night. Go figure.

Anyway, drinks are good and on the strong side. You will notice the alcohol or its effect later on. Luckily, the top-shelf quality alcohol they use prevents drunkeness or bad hangovers, at least from my experiences.

The place is dim with wood accents, and has a pool table, so it feels like a dive bar at first. Once you get used to the lighting and decor, then it feels like a lounge that will fit in with many FiDi or NOSOMA spots. Like those neighborhoods, the drinks prices are also up there. It's nice that there's a HH here.
author: Peter L.

description: This was a nice cocktail lounge place with good happy hour drinks (and happy hour runs 5pm-8pm, which is longer than some other places) - I had a whiskey sour. It was nothing special, but it was still good :) Blackbird has a dark-ish atmosphere, which means it would probably be a good place for a date or something intimate, though it did get quite loud at times so it was sometimes difficult to hear what my friend was saying. The bar area was sort of busy when I went, so it was equally sort of difficult to get the attention of the bartenders. Overall, it was nice, but didn't really vibe with me to become one of me go-to places.
author: Bianca C.

description: An intimate setting with cool ambiance but drinks were just average.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
Dimly lit and kinda loud, Blackbird has a cool ambience but can get crowded on weekends. There is a pool table in the back and seating along the wall. It isn't divey but also isn't as dressy as the cocktail lounges in Soma.

They change their specialty cocktail menu every so often, but, while the cocktails are all unique and interesting, I get the impression that they're trying too hard. Some of them are just a tiny bit too out there to be appealing to me. If you choose correctly though, the hand-crafted drinks can be well-made and strong!
author: Tiffany P.

description:
Came here with friends to get a drink before dinner. Location is prime and the setup inside is pretty nice.  Service was friendly albeit slow.  We ordered some drinks off their menu which were good - but honestly they each seemed to be one ingredient too complex.

The Martinez has a very flowery gin that made the drink taste "perfumy" - we ordered it again with a different gin and it was very good.

The Mash was ok. Solid Rye drink but the added mint gave it a weird flavor.

Lastly I got their specialty oak-aged Manhattan with some sort of dry cocoa liqueur. Again, it was good, but the flavors did not really mesh well together. The oak and cocoa were battling to give it it's ultimate flavor.

I wouldn't seek this place out, but I also wouldn't object if we were to go again. It's probably a four-star spot once you know what drinks there you like. My first experience was just a bit off.
author: Ross H.

description:
Talk about an incredible specialty cocktail. 

The drinks at Blackbrid are uniquely handcrafted, fun and unusual. All of the cocktails listed (or you order) have a little something "extra" added to them. Blackbird puts their own twist on each beverage to put it over the top. 

They have a rotating specialty cocktail list that is based off of pop culture, which I think is a really neat idea. 

PS this bar is no longer cash only, so come on down because they'll take plastic.
author: Kendal Ann M.

description:
I like the space, and the staff is friendly and nice. The cocktail menu is imaginative and fun. 

BUT

1) It is important to keep the ingredients for the flagship cocktails on hand. If the bar runs out, Safeway is like half a block away. It shouldn't take a guest three tries to order a cocktail.

2) If a customer makes an order that can't be fulfilled, it's important to hunt them down and tell them, rather than making them wait for ten minutes and return to the bar to find out they aren't ever going to get what they ordered.

3) If the bartender doesn't know the proportions for a classic cocktail, they should look them up (on, say, their phone, or in the cocktail book that should be under every bar) rather than winging it.

So, this place is promising, but the bar staff (while nice) kinda need to get it together.
author: Chris P.

description: Blackbird, I could get behind your happy hour, but everything else is just adequate. They have standards beer on tap and a host of house cocktails. None of them really live up to their names - I'm thinking of Audrey's cherry coke in particular because it has no cherry or coke flavor. It's a rum and coke that just tastes like carbonated dark liquor. Bartenders are expedient and friendly, so nothing on them, but this place is just a little too tight and a little too pricey and in a neighborhood with no parking. Pass for next time. Ambiance and music are cool though. You know what crowd you're going to get. At your own risk.
author: Danny C.

description: Great bar! The bar tender was friendly and offeres to make me a hot toddy for my sniffles
author: Sagar J.

description:
If you want a quaint little sit down bar with crafty cocktails, an extensive beer list, plush seating and friendly crowd, this is the place for you. 

Their happy hour is quite decent with house wines, cocktails and a few beers (and free snacks if memory serves me right). 

I love coming here on Sunday nights to sit in one of the booths and catch up with friends over a few drinks. It's got a chill atmosphere and its decorated well so the ambience is friendly. And if you want to pick up a game of pool, they even have a pool table in the back!
author: Jay P.

description: This is a great bar. Why?! You can grab some very good drinks here for the classy and the beer drinkers. If you shoot pool, you'll more than likely to be able to get on. If you want a booth or two for a B-Day party you can reserve one and have plenty of room to socialize or drink. Great bar overall!
author: Trey R.

description:
Love this place!  Cozy, charming interiors, excellent drink selection and awesome bartenders...
I had a mojito but they did offer a cool Winter Selection drink lost in anticipation of the Game of Thrones season release next week...
author: Cay A.

description:
Bartender was incredibly rude. The crowd was full of basics. Good interior design though. If you're basic and just want a place to drink, check it out.

I will never visit again.
author: Marcus W.

description:
What are the requisites for a great bar?

Thoughtfully prepared cocktail list?
Plush, comfortable seating?
Innovative creations?

Blackbird has all of these things.  
And Blackbird is a great bar.

The space is tres cool. 
The bartenders are knowledgeable to hell & back.

You can just tell the bartender what you usually like...clear or dark, brand preferences, etc, & they will artfully & masterfully hook you up.  

They make their own fireball.  That deserves a nod.

I certainly wasn't expecting to find such a chic spot in the duboce triangle.  But this spot charmed & impressed me.  

Is it a gay bar?!  I had no idea!  Even better.  Every girl should have a gay boyfriend/best friend.  You know you really can't take your actual boyfriend w you to the Nordstrom beauty department & have him help you pick your new season lipstick, right?  At least not if you want legit help.

Blackbird is a pleasure.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
Did you know Blackbird has been around for 5 years?!? I didn't either until last weekend, when I received a special invite to attend a private anniversary party here. Have walked by numerous times, wondering what it was like inside, this was the perfect excuse to find out!

Barrel-aged cocktails were the focus last Sunday eve. Some were so special, they had been aged for years instead of months! Boy does that add some extra flavor to your drink. Not sure if I am a mature enough drinker to handle the oak and medicine-like flavors, but it's fun learning to appreciate. If you are a Negroni or Fernet fan, Blackbird's versions will hit the spot!

Not quite ready to dive into fancy cocktails that are a bit younger (like, straight from the tap), the Pilsner is quite good. And it's served in a giant mug. Can't go wrong with giant mugs ;) 

A little chickadee (not a Blackbird but something like it), told me that these guys are going to make some updates to the joint later this year, perhaps incorporating bar bites into the menu... That would be fab! After a few good drinks, food must follow. Sing me a song when it's ready!
author: Abby S.

description:
I'm absolutely in love with this bar. Everything from the décor to the drinks, and especially the pool table in the back... great lowkey place to hang out. I'm not always in the mood for more social bars or clubs in the Castro District where I live. Black Bird has that perfect Sunday afternoon ambiance.

It was quite empty when my boyfriend and I visited. We were immediately served at the bar. I had a Bloody Mary, and he had a Pimm's Cup. Both were fantastic drinks, and the rest of the drink menu looked tasy. We made our way to the back of the bar where the pool table resided. It was only one dollar per game, and there was no one else waiting, so we took our sweet time. 

When another group came to play, there were plenty of half booths for them to hang out at. The rest of the time, we were just admiring the décor... the space above the pool table is covered in partial wooden planks, and every piece of furniture seems so well thought out. Definitely coming back here again, now that it has been added to my list of favorite bars!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
One of my favorite happy hour/cocktail spots in the upper Market area!

Blackbird serves classy cocktails + craft beers in a divey-chic setting. I came in here the other evening for a quick pop. I only had $10 in my wallet, and I knew that the bar was cash-only. Fortunately, they offer happy hour from 5pm - 8pm on weekdays. And much to my delight, one of their discounted drinks was an Old Fashioned (one of my personal favorites) for just $6. That's a steal!

There was only one bartender working the crowded room. But this guy was working his butt off. I saw him mixing two (maybe three) different cocktails at a time. With one hand he was stirring a drink, and with the other he was shaking a martini shaker. It was really quite a sight to behold - almost the equivalent of patting your head and rubbing your belly at the same time. In any event, I got my cocktail in a timely manner. It was very stiff and served with one of them trendy, overly-large ice cubes. It definitely hit the spot after a long day at the office.

The bar attracts an eclectic clientele. It's a nice mix of gay, straight, hipster, and neighborhood bar flies. There's nothing pretentious about the place. It's just a straight-up good bar.

My only complaint was that my $6 happy hour drink wound up costing me $10 because the bartender was too busy to give me change. But at the end of the day, the busy guy made me a damn fine cocktail, and it was worth every cent. 

Long story short - I will definitely be returning here the next time I'm in the hood.
author: Kevin B.

description: Drinks are great, nice atmosphere and perfect spot for a weekday night out! Happy hour from 5 to 8! Too busy on weekends and on big holidays.
author: Serena P.

description:
Great cocktails, decent music, friendly bouncers. Highly recommend you try the Rye cocktail - forgetting the name - but the flavor profile is shockingly rich for so few ingredients.

Incredibly cozy / intimate ambiance. Great date spot.
author: Spencer H.

description:
Really nice little bar with a lot of ambiance. My boyfriend and I stopped in for a drink on a Saturday afternoon around 3:00, so it was calm and quiet. We are both fans of bourbon and rye whiskey, and the bartender was nice enough to let us sample a few.  Everything behind the bar was immaculate and their selection was great. 

We'll definitely be back.
author: Christine S.

description:
This place is FUN.

No, it's not the alcohol speaking. Go there for yourself, you'll know what I'm talking 'bout.

Blackbird has the perfect lounge setup: a long venue with dim lighting and plenty of tables, chairs, and sofas along the wall. It's crowded but nowhere near suffocating, and if you migrate to the back, you can actually hold a decent conversation without making yourself hoarse. In the back is a pool table for those who like to pass the time hitting balls with sticks, as well as a photobooth ($5) for those who want to take selfies but don't want to be publicly judged for it.

The only downside is that it's CASH ONLY.

At the bar, you'll find paper menus that contain most of their drink options. However, for the real deal, they have a full menu on the wall to the left side of the bar.

(GET THE) $9 NEW ORLEANS COFFEE, offered on draught, which is made with bourbon, Joyride cold brew coffee, chicory tincture (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/blackbird-san-francisco?select=VwPKpBRCT74aM6FVGoBDtg#KKWWlEea3KFrmC1iiU7uOQ). Superbly smooth with woodiness from the chicory.

(GET THE) $10 POACHED PEAR, served up, which is made with pear-infused gin with honey, lemon, and Lambrusco. It tastes like grape juice (thank the Lambrusco, a red grape wine) or a dessert wine, though I would prefer it over a moscato any day ahaha.

Menu: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/blackbird-san-francisco?select=VwPKpBRCT74aM6FVGoBDtg#PI8N4J73a1Kc35LouVMHdw
and
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/blackbird-san-francisco?select=VwPKpBRCT74aM6FVGoBDtg#VwPKpBRCT74aM6FVGoBDtg
and
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/blackbird-san-francisco?select=VwPKpBRCT74aM6FVGoBDtg#EQGFmrZIDfEKDhUa6cl5hQ

Blackbird also runs a happy hour, Monday to Friday 5-8 PM. $1-2 off draught beers, $2 Bud/Bud Light/PBR, $5 house White, $6 house Red, $4 well drinks (1 liquor + 1 mixer), and $5 sours.

See? Fun! :)
author: Adele F.

description: Wow! This place is awesome. Each drink on the menu is unique and has its own flair, and not over priced for a craft cocktail bar. I'll definitely be going back.
author: Rob M.

description:
Quality cocktail bar with knowledgeable bartenders, friendly bouncers, and a dynamic crowd full of professionals from diverse backgrounds. Although it's a relatively small, narrow joint that isn't terribly crowded during the day, it can get quite packed at night, but there's usually enough room to squeeze in, whether with parties large or small.

Dependable drinks at not-unreasonable prices, all in a lively environment - what's not to like?
author: Vincent L.

description: Really great place for specialty cocktails from bartenders who know how to mix.  Prices are reasonable.  A great space for meeting friends (or a date) after work, or in the early evening.
author: Jason C.

description:
Quality cocktails by true mixologists.

You'll find this place on "best of" lists. It's a well-deserved placement. Some will call it a gay bar, and I disagree. It's a bar. A great cocktail bar, and it attracts a wide clientele. This is San Francisco, and quite near the Castro at that, so if you're a squeamish bigot, I'm sure you'll find something to make you uncomfortable. If you're out for a quality cocktail, the place will do you no wrong. You'll probably have some good conversation and might even find a new person for companionship regardless of your preferences.
author: Miles L.

description: This place is really nice place they have great drinks and atmosphere but can get a little crowded so if you're looking to have a drink in a quiet place this wouldn't be it but good music and ambience this place nails it.
author: Sabrina H.

description: Nice cocktail lounge! Happy hour runs 5pm-8pm. The bar is very intimate, good place for a date. Bartenders could get busy but still they were able to discuss the drinks outside of the menu.
author: Jack R.

description: What a great bar!!! Drinks were unique and reasonably priced- definitely will go back
author: Kristin S.

description: Awesome cocktail bar by my house! Very cool interior. Will definitely be coming back! Great bourbon drinks! Ventura is awesome!
author: Rodney D.

description:
Cool spot in Castro. 

Good luck finding a seat if you like to sit.
author: Shereen A.

description:
Went to this bar for the second time last night and it was just as good as the first time!

Highlight: creative yet tasty cocktails (yeah sadly often times these two don't go together), price is very reasonable for SF, not too crowded even for a Saturday night, and there is a pool table!

There was this cocktail I really loved last time but I can't recall what it was called and it's not on their menu anymore... Will report back if I can recall it. Maybe the friendly bartender would be willing to make something that's not on their current menu...
author: Joseph L.

description: Poor service.  Closed early and they are a mark! Pressured us to finish our pool game.
author: Geo A.

description:
Ok, so I haven't been Yelpful in a very long time-- but I just want to say that after coming here on a whim last Friday, I was so so SOOO ecstatic with my overall experience at Blackbird, I had to write this review. Let's start off with the preface that I love Game of Thrones, and Blackbird has an entire menu of drinks named after this show. Can someone stab me already? Am I dreaming? 

There were 3 drinks that my party of 3 ordered: Castle Black , Mother of Dragons, and a Cucumber Gimlet (yes, I don't think my friend who ordered that was a Game of Thrones fan).  But all three drinks were great, and for all the pyros out there, you should definitely order the Mother of Dragons :) 

This bar gets packed really fast and the interior is dimly lit. Overall, I would definitely come back for more. Also I would have preferred to stay longer but no one really wants to start off and end the night at the same place, especially on a Friday night!
author: Denise L.

description:
Caveat - The guy that made my drinks might've been new, first time here.


Some of the worst drinks I've ever had! Made me write my first Yelp review ever.
author: Madhan P.

description: Best Moscow mule that I've ever had. A bit on the pricey side, but I'd go back for one in a heartbeat.
author: Ryan J.

description:
Nice to come back after so long away from Blackbird! Since I first came by in January, it's definitely gotten more crowded (though you can still push your way through the crowd and if you're paying attention, snag a table even at 10pm on a Saturday).

The crowd is an interesting mixture of Mission/hipster and Castro. 

Still love the dark setting, old fashioned lightbulbs hanging by the wire over the bar, dark wood paneling, artistically cut/broken up wood board partial ceiling, and I really really like the tables that are essentially slabs of concrete that someone went to town at with a sledgehammer.

The bartender was definitely a little abrupt - I said "I like something light and refreshi-" and he immediately said "Early Bird." I asked if they take card and he just said "Cash only" and stared at me. No chit chat, no smiles. In the end I really did like my drink, but he could've been a little friendlier.

Shout-out to the cool dude checking IDs at the front - very chill, friendly, and I loved these awesome tattoos he had on his knees: one was the face of a lion/tiger, the other a dragon. Really unique and quite bad-ass.

Cocktail menu: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/blackbird-san-francisco?select=31G3NnrZiU2rwDbUFW1oqA#31G3NnrZiU2rwDbUFW1oqA

* The Sumo Wrestler - 3.5 stars
(Evan Williams Bourbon, Nigori Sake, Yuzu. $9)
I watched the bartender make this and he adds  some sort of jam/marmalade to it! Really interesting. The flavor was very good, but bourbon always comes out too strong to me as a base. But for a bourbon drink this was quite good.

* Early Bird - 4 stars
(Vodka, St. Germain, Lemon, Soda. $8)
Light and refreshing, nice tart taste, just what I asked for. Nice!
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Hidden bar on the street and you can't really see it if you're not looking for it. It doesn't say "Blackbird" on the outside, but look for the sign outside with a blackbird with a top hat on it!

Came here on an evening and it was pretty dim inside. There's a long high top table right when you enter to the left. The bar is to your right. The menu is written on a chalkboard at the end of the bar (kind of hard to read in the dark).

There is booth seating available across from the bar with stone tables. In the back, there is a pool table as well as a photo booth. The wall is lined with newspaper decor.

Takes a little while to get drinks ordered at the bar if there's a lot of people. Will need to come back and try this place again since everyone talks about how great the cocktails are!
author: Wing L.

description:
I really wanted to like this place, I had been excited to try it for months and even turned down watching niners vs raiders at tacolicious for a boring meal here. The servers were pushy it felt like and not friendly. I ordered a salad and was very disappointed! My boyfriend got the hotpot and was not impressed. 

Im surprised the menu is similar to kitchen story bc I loved the food there (service was prob the same there also).

We didn't have a great time here, dont think id be back!
author: Hetal P.

description: Love it! The lighting was chill but you could still everything. I got the mint julep which had this huge sprig of mint for decoration. I felt a little bad about it because it was so much mint that could have been put to good use so I nibbled on it a little bit. I went there for drinks with someone and it was an intimate enough spot. Be careful though because I completely walked past it. There's a sign that says "BAR" with a Mr. Penguin type character. Walking past I thought, "that can't be it. A Penguin is not a blackbird."
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
Three times in three days?

Yep.  That's how much I adore Blackbird.  This bar can do no wrong.  In fact, it's *everything* that makes for a perfect cocktail lounge in my book.  If I lived in San Francisco, I'd be here every day of the week.  Maybe rent a cot in the back.

Located right above the Church & Market Muni stop, Blackbird is a study in contradictions.  The cocktails are swanky, but the crowd is unpretentious.  The ingredients are top-notch, but the prices are eye-poppingly low.  The music is fantastic, but there's never ever a cover.  The ambiance is beautiful, but it's also comfortable and relaxed.

So, how does Blackbird pull it off?

Simple -- by offering a top-quality product.  The bar offers all the standard craft beers, wines, and well drinks, which are very cheap at happy hour.  However, I stick to their sublime craft cocktails ($8-$10; cash only).  Here are the ones I've tasted:

** Silk Road (brandy, St. Germain, apple... my absolute favorite)
** Grape Drink (tequila, muddled grapes, champagne)
** Poached Pear (gin, pear, honey, lemon)
** Root of all Evil (scotch, root beer liquor)

The staff is incredibly friendly.  The customer always comes first here.  If you don't know what kind of cocktail you want, they'll happily make suggestions or custom cocktails.

If Blackbird ever decides to open a second location in San Diego, I'll be the first customer waiting in line on opening day.  No joke.

Blackbird... You complete me.
author: David G.

description:
I really loved this bar. Super hip feel, great drinks. and the happy hour was great! Specific beers, house wine, margarita, whiskey sour, and a couple others were on the happy hour menu for 5-6$!

My boyfriend and I got a couple drinks here before moving to our dinner reservation. The happy hour lasts till later as well! We got great seats that were really comfortable and also there is a pool table in the back as well.
A great vibe from this place!
author: Bori B.

description: You don't often find incredibly friendly customer service at swanky cocktail bars, so I was delighted by the exceptional service I got at Blackbird. The bartender worked SO quickly yet still found time to chat and check in with our large group. The cocktails were insanely good and very affordable considering the quality of ingredients. I could tell that the bartenders cared a lot and had such attention to the little details. I will absolutely be back.
author: Joni W.

description:
How can I not have written up Blackbird after all these years? The drinks here are among the best in the country. Period. Blackbird constantly finds new ways to play with, reinvent, surprise and delight with their cocktails. I've had countless wonderful nights of conversation and reunions on my SF visits, not one of which has gone by without a stop here pretty much since they opened. 

Now, when you're at the top of your class, you know it. Especially when it's super crowded, certain bartenders have been complete dicks. You can cut them some slack via artist's temperament, but, I just don't think any unprovoked situation warrants assholery, and I'd suggest they restrict entry better if there are too many people for them to handle. Obviously that doesn't dent my feelings about their booze, but I've seen the behavior enough to confirm it happens and I don't like it either. 

No need to specify recommendations, since they change anyway - just try everything, or at least stick with your liquor and you won't be disappointed.
author: John M.

description: Like this place. The only downside is it gets too loud and crowded. The decor of vintage feel is outstanding and drinks are great. The bartender that helped us wqs very knowledgeable and helpful.  The Edison pendant lighting is just a great bonus to have this place looks like a real gem. :)
author: True R.

description: After many year of being a standard, now it's just like any other beany-headed hipster bar. And bartender is pretty bad - doesn't deserve to bartender here. SKIP IT.
author: Steven W.

description:
Blackbird is a nice bar/lounge in the Castro area to get deliciously strong drinks. They have a fully stocked bar with many specialty cocktails on the menu that will please a variety of palates--from sweeter citrusy drinks to more spirited cocktails. I ordered a drink with tequila in it and definitely got me in a nice, happy state veryyy quickly. Cheers for sure~

I came here for a friend's birthday and we managed to squeeze our group of 10+ people along the small tables in the back, despite not having a reservation. Even though the interior echoed really loudly, my friends and I enjoyed the atmosphere and would come back again for drinks in the area. I need to try the photobooth and/or play a game of pool next time!

In addition, the bathrooms are single rooms and actually kept pretty clean. This is always worth noting in bars. ;)
author: Bonnie Z.

description:
Blackbird singing in the dead of niiiiight, take these broken wings and learn to fly....

Oh my dear Paul, if you would come and have one Old Fashioned with me at Blackbird, maybe throw in a little serenation, life would be but a dream. And I will dream on, while I sip my drinky. 

It was a busy night for a Wednesday so I sheepishly asked the bartender if he would mind making me an Old Fashioned, and he kindly obliged. It was strong as an ox, the presentation was lovely with a giant ice cube and an orange peel. I slurped it down happily as I chatted with my pals. Clean and nicely decorated bar, sweet area, all around a great experience.
author: Crystal C.

description: Music too loud for conversation between more than two persons. Bartender was incredibly rude.
author: Jade P.

description:
I can see why this place is a hit or miss.   It's all self-served and open seating, so your night here can be a good one or a bad one depending if you even find a place to sit and relax.  
We got lucky and managed to get a table a few minutes after entering.
It's absolutely beautiful inside.  
They have a whole wall of drinks to choose from.  Given that I'm not an alcohol connoisseur, it was overwhelming and I was at lost at to what to drink.  
It's all self-serve, so you have to order at the bar and bring the drinks back.  Our group just took turns.  The bloody mary had lots of veggies and was basically a meal in a cup!  Barley wine was interesting.  Lots of the other drinks my friends got were too.  Not your typical drink to say the least.  Just have an open mind when trying their drinks here.  
I was worried that I wouldn't be able to get a group photo to commemorate the night but I lucked out again with spotting a waiter cleaning up a table next to us.
author: David W.

description:
The mixologists here are good! They have unique craft cocktails with ingredients such as rosemary and basil. Really delicious drinks!  They also serve beer and wine and have a pool table in the back.  

Fun place!
author: Jaching H.

description:
You know those people who are perfectly happy with themselves and can have fun without alcohol? 

I am NOT one of those people. 

I'm not ashamed to admit it, I mean, looking at it from a practical point of view. Life is short and my single years? even shorter.  I'm not going to waste a day off doing chores and relaxing at home when I can go out and have cocktails with friends!

Blackbird is not one of those bars where you get your usual drink. The brave and savvy will order off the the butcher style paper menu hanging on the wall. This cocktail menu changes every few months and last month, they even offered barrel aged gin!  * LOVE *  You'll be wowed by the use of fresh ingredients, different bitters and premium liquor. 

Start with the Early Bird, made with St. Germain elderflower liquer, lemon juice and vodka. I drank it fast because it tasted like lemonade! Can you say dangerous?!?

I followed that up with a Tourniquet, I had 2 because it was so good! It almost has the profile taste of an Aviation, a little floral but more subtle. The hefty Beefeater gin balanced by Lillet blanc and finished with a spray of Laphroaig (Blackbird bar concentrated the Whiskey Laphroaig and turned it into a spray as an added dimension to the drink) This was garnished with a brandied cherry. 

I appreciated the casual chic atmosphere with the red leather booths and rustic wood cut tables. There is a pool table and a photo booth towards the back for more added fun! But obviously, the stars of the show are the bartenders (shout out to Tori) who are knowledgeable and intuitive about their drink suggestions. Needless to say, Blackbird has a customer for life!
author: Janice C.

description:
As I've stated in a few other reviews, I don't generally comment on bars unless there is something really special about them. Blackbird definitely has a special touch which made it both great and memorable. Namely, the game of thrones theme that it sports in both title and menu. 

Dimly lit and full but not overly crowded, this was a preliminary stop on a night out in Duboce to meet up with a larger group at the newly opened Brewcade down the street. (Side note, that place was underwhelming.) What made Blackbird great was that their specialty cocktail menu, which seemed to be what you were intended to order, is entirely game of thrones themed with each drink having a specific reference and style. We tried about half of the drinks on the list and just about every single one was excellent. I specifically recall the Red Wedding and Three Eyed Raven being delicious.

Overall, the nerd in me loved everything about this place and I would definitely go back again. I'm not sure if there are any other game of thrones themed bars but until I find another I'm going to say that this is "as good as it gets."
author: Mark O.

description: This place used to be cool and friendly. Then they redesigned the inside to be trendy and modern. The clientele is still nice enough, but the bartenders! Wow! If you so much as *look* at them the wrong way, they will be rude and refuse to make eye contact with you. If they don't like how you approach the bar, they will do you the honor of telling you how they feel. SF can be a snotty town, but the two behind the counter are in a league of their own. So sad to let this place go.
author: John B.

description:
Pretty cool/chill lounge.

I like their selection of beers and i was able to find parking easily.
They also have a great cocktail menu. If i lived closer, this would def be one of my local chill spots to grab a drink!
author: Frank L.

description:
After a tough day at the office, sometimes you just need a stuff cocktail with a buddy to take the edge off.  I pinged a pal and we decided to meet up at Blackbird's by his apartment for some happy hour.

They've got a bunch of specialty cocktails that are definitely on the pricier side, but instead I looked toward the happy hour well specials.  I ordered a whiskey sour which our bartender made with fresh juice, which was very welcomed.  The cocktail was nice and refreshing and had the perfect combination of flavors to provide some relief.

I like the scene at this bar and the mixed style of seating from front to back.  Our bartender was friendly and quick, but was easily distracted while talking to some of the other guys at the bar.  I like that its right next to the train station though so it's easy to get home after a few drinks.  I'll be back for more happy hour soon!

Food: n/a

Service: 8/10

Price: $$

Atmosphere: 8/10
author: Joe M.

description:
This place is magical. No idea why I haven't been coming here more! It's steps away from my apartment.. It's crazy the places you'll discover in San Francisco by just going out with friends!

I came here for an old friends birthday. The place was packed, but by the grace of god we ended up located a cute little table by the window that fit us all. Slightly cramped, but adorable so. 

I ordered the spicy margarita. Well, I ordered 3 of them. They were delicious. The perfect amount of spice. They were strong to (which I love). 

On top of that, the whole group took a shot of Tequila in honor of our friends 24th. The bartender gave us those shots for free. That was nice of him! 

Perhaps a little less than perfect because the place was a little too packed for me But, hey, you get what you get. The crowdedness of the bar didn't take away from the experience I had.
author: Alex G.

description: solid but not great. the drinks are good. the staff can be a bit unfriendly. and the place fills up quickly on week-ends. a good local option but not somewhere id travel to.
author: Ruben K.

description:
Good drinks, but a distracted bartender who kept servicing other customers before us despite waiting right in her line of vision.  

This basically sums up my experience here.  Nice atmosphere and everything, but I really disliked my bartender, paid us no attention at all.  It wouldn't be that bad, except that drinks orders take up to 15mins per customer.  Ended up waiting here 30 mins before she even started taking our orders.  I only got to try one drink as the service here really discourages me from coming back for more.
author: Bryson L.

description:
This place would get an extra star if they took credit cards -- it would not be bad if the drinks were inexpensive but at $10 and up a drink it's hard to buy a round for your friends. 

Otherwise it's a cool atmosphere nice mixed crowd but not too many locals. 

The cocktails are solid -- great beer selection and nice toons playing.
author: G R.

description:
A friend and I were bar hopping and when we passed by this bar, I insisted we go in.

The place is still as chill as I remember. Awesome atmosphere and a good crowd. Downside to this is that there was a lack of seating...and they actually have a lot of seating in this place.

The menu changed since the last time I was there. They had some of the same drinks (old classics and favorites I assume) but they had a lot of new cocktails. I ordered the Silly Rabbit (vodka "Trix" syrup, grapefruit luxardo, licorice, soda) and my friend got the Shakedown (bourbon, pineapple, kahlua, orgeat, vanilla-orange bitters). Both were $8. Cash only.

Place was busy so the bartender was busy but he did a pretty good job at paying attention to his customers considering the rush.

My Silly Rabbit DID taste like Trix but it was strong enough for me to know it was alcohol. I enjoyed this cocktail A LOT. My friend liked hers too, but she told me it was a little too strong. It took her a while to finish it. I like that they make their drinks strong though!

This is becoming one of my favorite bars to go to.
author: Sofia R.

description:
All this time living practically next door and I just hit this place for the first time?  Blasphemy!

If you're hungry go across the street, grab a burrito and bring it back.  They only have jars of tasty pastes made of things like cheese, olives, onions or hummus they serve with crackers.  It's good, but not enough volume to shut down a serious grumble.

The bartenders are super rad.  Adam and Marcus served my friend and I on a lovely Tuesday happy hour afternoon.  They made it very happy.  Two city bartenders that were not dismissive, actually sort of laughed at my jokes, and they weren't even trying to perv on us.  Thank you for that.  

They have a photo booth.

Cash Only.

The bathroom is not a toilet behind a curtain!  It's a newly remodeled, spacious and clean bathroom!  OUTRAGEOUSLY EXCITING!  

(Females:  Please stop playing on your phone on the toilet. # 1.  Gross. # 2 Gross.  # 3  There are still 7 females outside waiting for you, we did not disappear when you locked the door.  # 4 Stop being really gross.)  

The atmospheric design is pretty unique.  They created the illusion of levels with long wood panels that appear aged.  You would think it could make the place seem smaller, but it added some really cool dimensions.

I am a beer-over-cocktails-anyday kinda girl, but I stepped out on account of the tasty sounding combo of the Kapre-Inha.  It turned out to be the best tastebud vacation I've had in months!  Not sugary, not bitter, just perfect.

If Blackbird rocks my socks, it oughta rock yours, too.
author: Ashley W.

description:
So came here with my crew for the first time. Good vibes, there's couple people here. 

That's not a bad for a Sunday in San Fransisco compared to the other bars we checked out. 

Worth trying if you're out of options in downtown!
author: Abdulwahab J.

description: Ronnie took care of us tonight. Mixed some mean drinks...best bartender in the the city...
author: Tim C.

description:
I've been back to Blackbird several times since my initial review so I had to update. Blackbird is a great place to meet and grab a drink. You'd be lucky to grab a seat or booth and once you do, hold onto your cocktail lounge real estate. 

The location by so many restaurants, public transportation and has a beautiful list of cocktails and handsome selection of brews. While I was waiting, I watched the bartender crank out some sexy looking cocktails. 

I selected the Mai Tai for myself, large glass of water on the side. It was pretty strong with a rum floater. I hardly ever drink rum, but I wanted just one really good drink. 

I always judge a good bar by the drinks and in my opinion, Blackbird deserves 5 stars.
author: Rebekah T.

description: I love the atmosphere of Blackbird! It was packed at 5pm on a Friday with all sorts of people from students, to bankers, to the nice little lady selling tamales. I had a drink with sculpin, mezcal and a few other ingredients. Overall I enjoyed the dink and would come back!
author: Hayley H.

description: My second experience was better than the first! I appreciated the gift card, and the improved costumer service! I have been coming to Blackbird for years, and was disappointed when the service had been such a drastic change from when I last visited.
author: Aaron M.

description:
Best bartender ever, he was great and made the best drinks they are so lucky to have him in their establishment Matt is the man and needs a
Raise ! He is absolutely the best bartender ever
author: Rob B.

description:
300th!!!  What? You all want GAY storytime?  You got it...

THE BEGINNING: HOW I CAME TO F*$# CAUTION AND TEST COURAGE

Two Labor Days ago, a very nerdy gay Asian male who had never been kissed made his way up north to San Francisco with one of his best friend.  If you didn't know San Francisco has a significant gay population, you should.  And that was why they went.

He told himself he wasn't going to let anything happen.  Complete lie.  He just didn't want his expectations high and be let down.  Deep down he knew if nothing happened, he would be disappointed.  

In a quaint dive bar, between the gayborhood and the rest of San Francisco, straights and gays mingled.  This place was hot.  The people were hot.  They were social.  And most importantly, they were fun.  The place was always crowded and for good reasons.  Great staff.  Unpretentious customers.  Classic drinks at affordable prices.

In this lovely bar, his friends tried to convinced him a hot barkeep was interested in him.  The barkeep was devastatingly hot and Asian boy thought himself average.  He ignored my friends because even if the barkeep was interested, he was too shy to make any move--especially with a guy way out of his league.

It was best to think Barkeep could never be interested.

However, as they stayed longer and longer, there were subtle hints that Barkeep might have liked him.  The Barkeep was very helpful with his group.  One time as Barkeep was clearing the table,  he stole a glance and almost drop the glasses he was clearing.  After that, girl friends of Asian boy made him the "drink order-er."  "Go get me water, I'm drunk" said his best friend.  Considering Barkeep wasn't the bartender, he went to take Asian boy's drink orders no matter where he was behind the bar.

When his gay friends got jealous, they decided to move the group.

But his girl friends weren't going to let it go without one last attempt.  They tried to convince Asian boy to make a move.  But Asian boy got nervous and went outside and his girl friends followed.  One girl friend ordered her husband to chat up Barkeep and he did.

The husband reported back to Asian boy that the Barkeep said to go up and talk to him.  Asian boy wasn't convince this was the truth.

The confidence wasn't there.  One needs confidence, so nothing happened.

I know, what a let down right?  Did you expect a gay story to end...gay?

Yes, if this was an opportunity, it was missed indeed.

But if one consider themselves smart, they learn.  And what one needs to learn here is to sometimes F#$@ caution and take chances.

Courage is the watchword.  Without courage, they'll be plenty more missed opportunities.  Pride will heal, opportunities can't be reclaimed.

I hope anyone who reads this and considers going to Blackbird, will do so--and that they will go in boldly and leave just as bold.  

And with a guy.  

Or girl.

And a hot photo from the photobooth ($5 will give you two copies).

Forward two years ahead...

Harmonie T and I came to Blackbird.  Hot guy was no longer there (or at least not that night).  We did leave with a photo (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Cs5DX-6syMfiJ1rACSRDVQ?select=l1jyMs6ah6SncWCHYmvC5w )!
author: Phillip N.

description: Two Words: Amaretto Sour. That drink is dangerously delicious. It masks the taste of alcohol so well. Mmmm...and the egg white foam on top is spot on. And this is coming from someone who thinks alcohol tastes bad. That says a lot!
author: Vivian C.

description:
Good happy hour and cool decor. I liked that my pilsner urquell came in this big cool pilsner urquell mug. Not that it really matters but sometimes it's the simple things.

Sadly the cocktails aren't cheaper during happy hour so I'll have to sample them some time after 7pm.
author: Misha T.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised by Blackbird: very reasonably priced yet high-quality happy hour Old Fashioneds, a laid back crowd, a considerate bartender. When my friend who is deathly allergic to nuts questioned if there were any nuts in the freely proffered pretzels, he went to the back and took a picture of the ingredients   with his phone, then brought the picture to show my friend the ingredients and ease her mind. He did this on his own accord. It was a wise, gentle way to ease her mind.

Overall a great, comfortable, wish-this-were-in-my-neighborhood bar. I'll be back.
author: Christina W.

description: They don't accept international IDs. If you are a foreigner and you are planning to go to this bar, totally avoid it! They will treat you really bad and they will not let you in. Worst experience ever!
author: Mariana M.

description: Super classy, delicious, and creative cocktails. MUST GO! This place is so unique and bomb.
author: Jill D.

description:
The hipsters strike again. 

A great place to come for happy hour after work-inexpensive but great drinks, I got a couple whiskey sours, which were great. 

Cool vibes all around. Definitely recommend.
author: Marilyn M.

description: One of my favorite bars on market street.  Perfect for a happy hour with friends that you actually want to talk to.  Great drinks, friendly bartenders, and no TVs!
author: Nina R.

description: If you can put up with the white hipster attitude, the 'I hate that I work here, but I really want to work here and be liked' attitude, which I can for some reason, it's great. The drinks are inventive and mostly delicious. The vibe is loungy and dark which is nice for some early evening socializing, louder later. Come here to be cool and with cool people.
author: Fran B.

description: Love the vibe here. Cool, laid back atmosphere. Great music.
author: Jessica P.

description: While visiting in SF we couldn't find a bar that had a good selection of drinks and a mellow vibe. So  we where told of Blackbird and went to check it out because its drink selection would be amazing. Turns put not only was it amazing it was mind blowing good cocktails. If you want a good drink try " It's all in the technique" such rich flavors. Service is good and the mixologist are playful and funny. Drinks are well priced and the vibe is modernish and inviting. Its a bar to check out.
author: Duncan T.

description:
The staff here are very friendly. I really like tequila drinks and a few of the workers  recommended the Sangre Dulce as a popular drink.. So my friend and I both ordered that. However, it just didn't quite fit ours pallet. I didn't want to be rude, but I had to ask the bartender to make another drink. He was very nice about it. So we switched it out to the hourglass. It was still bad, but not as bad as the first drink, but I didn't want to bother switching drinks again, since that would be too excessive. 

I think I need to come back here again and try another drink. I feel like this place just doesn't make good tequila drinks, because everyone else liked their drinks. The ambiance here is good, plenty of tables and seats. Not too crowded either.
author: Lisa T.

description: Some talented artist should win an award for the design of this place. It's a breath of fresh air when you walk in--literally because of the pleasant slow spinning ceiling fans--but also because of the classy yet hip and San Franciscan vibe this place has. Refreshed not to be in just another Mission-style dive-- you know the kind I'm talkin' about. Great ambiance here, not too crowded, and tasty drinks. We only spent half an hour here, but wish I stayed longer. Great beer on tap and decent coctails. Looking forward to coming back. Please don't change (or get bulldozed for condos.)
author: Brian J.

description: Came here for happy hour one night; it was lively but not uncomfortably crowded. The bartender was nice and serviced quickly even though he was the only one behind the bar. Nice and cozy ambience overall. Would definitely come back!
author: Loretta C.

description:
The 3 words that come to mind every time I think of Blackbird: Mixology Hipster Heaven. The ambiance is chill and welcoming. The crowd is mixed (from straight to gay to hipster to workaholics) and I love it. There is plenty of space to just hang out with friends. They hang artwork from local artists to sell and change them out regularly. 

This bar gets very crowded on weekends and especially during happy hour when everyone is just getting off work. Happy hour deals are AMAZING.

Their drink menu changes every season, so come by often and try as many drinks as you can because before you know it, they're gone.  Their drinks are delicious and strong (my two favorite things when it comes to drinks lol).

They only accept CASH, so come with your pockets filled.
author: Geoffrey Blair A.

description: Nice ambiance, decent prices and decent drinks. Was quite surprised to see that the place was kinda empty on Friday night at around 10 pm. Also, we had an issue with a drunk couple that was trying to invade our table and kept bothering us so we were forced to leave. All in all, good experience but there are better cocktail bars in SF to go to.
author: R C.

description: Great chill bar with some pool in the back. Nice, chill place to go and catch up with friends in a pretty central location in SF.
author: Mel G.

description:
$5 yummy sours during happy hour (til 8pm!), I'm so down. And their actual cocktail menu is like UHHH HOW DO I CHOOSE?!?! Everything is so yummy. And strong.

The place is really nice, with lots of seating and we were even able to snag some lounge space in the back on a Wednesday night. Great chill start to the night. Yes, my weekends start on Wednesdays.
author: Vivian H.

description: Blackbird offers seasonal cocktails to satisfy! The menu changes seasonally and they offer cocktails on tap. Bartenders are always attentive even with crowds on a Friday/Saturday night.  Decor and ambiance are perfect when seeking a after work beverage,  meeting a date, a friend or a party of four or more.
author: Kimberly G.

description: A bartender can really make or break a place. And the guy was a flat out douche. Will never go here again.
author: Leon P.

description: Great crowds, delicious drinks & awesome happy hour!
author: Katie N.

description:
Another awesome cocktail bar!

I loved my drink here, and dug the vibe. The bartender was nice and was able to make amazing artisanal cocktails pretty quickly. Music was pleasant, without being too loud. I like still being able to chat.

The cocktails here seem well thought out and very creative. The different concoctions on their menu made it hard to choose.

It was really busy the night we were there, so getting good seats was impossible.

I would definitely return. Although, I  do wish they took credit cards.
author: Amanda G.

description:
Even though it's one of my favorite cocktail bars in the city, Blackbird has two personalities. During the day and happy hour, it's brightly lit, clean and open, and and quiet. It's a cocktail sanctuary where you go to sip on your favorite libation and relax. At night, the lights are dimmed and the atmosphere becomes boisterous. Dozens of people congregate around sipping their drinks, and it can feel crowded.

Nonetheless, the cocktails are consistent, inventive, and delicious. Bartenders are knowledgeable and polite. They can get busy later at night but they're very responsive in general. 

During happy hour, there are drink specials such as $6 old-fashioneds and $6 margaritas, $6 du jour cocktails (which they had a choice of two the day I came in), and $4 wells. Beers are equally cheap. 

So depending on what mood you're in, go in the early afternoon for a more chill experience or late at night for a livelier scene. There's a pool table in the back to take the edge off too. And enjoy your cocktail.
author: Lawrence H.

description: It was slow for happy hour on a Tuesday night. Consistently  good cocktails in a chill atmosphere. Walking distance to many wonderful restaurants from here.
author: Joe M.

description:
In 1968, The Beatles aspired to write a song while in Scotland regarding the high racial tension that were escalating in the United States, thus the 
distinguished by melody sparked a beautiful tune called "Blackbird"

A love for the civil rights movement...
Me in my similar fashion, well my love for alcohol lead me to a place called 
"Blackbird."

Hosted upon the infamous "duboce triangle" and setting a high standard for a bar,
we have come upon an "Impasse"

Yes, "Impasse" adj, : a predicament affording no obvious escape.

I say that because of many things.

1. Once you get parking. (either street or coyingly using the Safeway parking lot)
    You will stay and drink due to difficultly of trying to secure parking
    because of duration of time/worth or be too "tipsy" to drive.

2. The place is always packed, enough to be delightful,
     always a pretty watering hole, attracts pretty people good ambiance,
     comfortable couches if you can get one, and a pool table with a 
     lovely wooden ceiling.

3. The drink selection....
     I had something called "The Roof of All Evil" which featured "Scotch" and "Cinnamon"
     (I only got it Because I love Earnest Hemingway) the Hemingway Daiquiri. 
     which was like a more powerful twist of the "Bloody Mary"

They also feature an assortment of hard to find brews...
A favorite of mine the "Moose Drool " Brown Ale, I love a place
like this that has wine, ales, brews, and a great reason to feel at home.

I personally, don't eat too much at Bars, but hummus I SAW looked good,
Good enough to spark my vegan-curiousness, so if you go check of the food menu,
for and tell me what you think.

All and all, I LOVE this place...
and I go Bar hopping to "Churchill" right around the corner.

Pro-tip: This place has a "wine expert" which is really cool, unless he was lying...
and of course as always "Bring Cash" there is an ATM. somewhere around the
outskirts of Castro and Market areas, try to find it, but if all else fails try the "Safeway"
author: Michael R.

description:
I want to make this place my new watering hole.

Wait, that sounds weird.

I like this place. A lot. I was sold the second I saw Brother Thelonious on tap (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/blackbird-san-francisco?select=STKBveH_16A4MptMZ4_3Fg#F-1kt33r_QwJfprpuY2pIQ), but the Batida cocktail (Cachaca [sort of a Brazilian rum], coconut milk, condensed milk, topped with nutmeg) was so refreshing and tasty, it sealed the deal (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/blackbird-san-francisco?select=STKBveH_16A4MptMZ4_3Fg#gXzoDQ7JbLlJYSlVq9zqyw). 

I'm not a fan of cloying cocktails (reason #43587 why I love my Scotch neat and my whisky on the rocks), and the ones I tried here were just as described. They also cater to the non-alcoholic drinkers (weirdos) with mocktails. 

Also tasty to order:
+In-Laws (Rye, Amaro, lemon, topped with ginger beer)
+Thai Tamarindo (Tamarind-infused rum, ginger lime, mint, Thai bitters, topped with ginger beer).

Guess I like ginger beer.

For around $10 a cocktail, good company, and friendly bartenders, I'm definitely coming back.
author: Adena B.

description: Very cool cocktail bar. It had a chill vibe and you could tell that the bartenders knew what they were doing. The specialty drinks that we tried were all very good and not too expensive when benchmarked with other similar places. Definitely worth a visit if you're in the area
author: Daniel D.

description:
A gorgeous venue that is both un-pretentious and inviting.

I'm not a big drinker - so I don't really frequent bars or lounges all that often, but the times that I have visited Blackbird - I have consistently been impressed by their beautiful interior, their comfortable red leather couches - and just the whole vibe of the place. Their cocktails are sensational. Many muddled with fresh fruit and all of them made with love. They are each carefully concocted and ideal for sipping on a warm afternoon or evening - especially if you can score one of the tables by the front  - right on Market Street. Though the lighting at the back of Blackbird can be a little too dark for my liking - the place more than makes up for it - with it's friendly crowd.

If you're in the area and looking for a mellow - yet happening spot to toast a phenomenal drink - look no further thank Blackbird.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description: Excellent selection of craft beers; we were able to get some stuff we've never had before. Their cocktail list is Game of Thrones-themed, which I found exciting. The guys behind the bar didn't really know much of anything about their beers and weren't too interested in engaging us in conversation. It's not a bad thing, but it will probably keep me from coming back.
author: Julia D.

description:
I give this place a 5 star review for more than just a few reasons! Read below:
I was researching nice loungey bars where I could have my birthday gathering. I was looking for something chill enough but with that little swanky touch and came across Blackbird! I had checked out a couple of other bars but the other places didn't quite live up to what I wanted.

First of all, my initial contact with Shawn (general mgr) was great! He called me back right away and let me know that he could reserve a spot for my group and I. This place was perfect because it has a pool table and photo booth in the back which (in my book) is always a plus! The space is narrow but has a lot of seating space for several groups to enjoy their time. The drink menu is tasty and the all around vibe of the place is great! I would absolutely come back to this bar for any sort of gathering or just a night out with a few friends. 

It has a very welcoming, fun, dim lit San Francisco vibe!
author: Nina L.

description:
*CASH ONLY*

Great menu selection

Pool Table + Photo Booth + Decent Seating + Good Ambiance

Stiff drinks, well made at a fare price

Overall Thoughts

Despite being cash only, it is a great place to go grab a good craft cocktail
author: Eddie W.

description: Blackbird Cafe is a cool spot to grab a bite - atmosphere is chill and the local vibe resonates with warmth.  Service is usually superb and of course the dining is great.
author: Brad G.

description:
29-July, Sunday:
I was here yesterday for a friend-of-a-friend's farewell party, I enjoyed a Negroni Classico extra dry with Plymouth Gin, a few bitters, and a splash of Campari.. gently stirred, served straight-up in a martini glass, and garnished with a lemon-peel twist.  Heaven on my tongue!

This space can be packed to the brim sometimes, so I definitely enjoyed coming here earlier for a quick drink.. I also appreciate that is no booming music, oh and it's cash only.. but there is a Chase right around the corner and a Wellsfargo ATM close by.
author: Ty T.

description:
I'm somewhat ambivalent about my experience at Blackbird. My Yelp friends all seem to adore it, so perhaps the evening that I popped in was uncharacteristic of the true Blackibird experience.

We dropped in on a Sunday evening after having dinner at a neighboring restaurant. At the time, Blackbird wasn't very busy; only a handful of patrons were consuming libations at the bar. We took our seats and the female bartender provided us with some menus to peruse. 

Immediately, after looking at the menu, Blackbird ushered in memories of Noble Experiment in San Diego. It showcased similar types of unique cocktails that one can find at the forbidden Noble. You know, Noble Experiment, that rather ostentatious hole-in-wall (literally), at Neighborhood, that is overrated? To Blackbird's credit, I didn't sense an ostentatious ambience; rather, the only thing I sensed was a less-than-courteous demanor from the bartender. She seemed consumed with tending to her friend(s) that happened to be customers, and we, as I took it, ended up being nothing but distractions to her social life. 

Nevertheless, we each had two cocktails. In all honesty, I wasn't very impressed. I remember ordering The Shakedown, a bourbon-inspired cocktail, and wasn't wowed. I moved on to the Silly Rabbit and was also underwhelmed. I don't know, perhaps ordering these types of specialized drinks are just not my cup of tea.
