Paying upwards of $10-12 for a cocktail should be memorable in a good way. Sadly, the drinks I had at Blackbird weren't. Maybe I should just stick to those drinks that I know will do my liver right everytime:  a vodka pineapple or margarita.
author: Gary R.

description:
Located on the outskirts of the Castro, this is a top notch bar. They are serious about cocktails, unlike the other more superficial bars in the area. 

It has a lively atmosphere and doesn't get too crowded. The drink to order here is The Purple Cup, a refreshing concoction of creme de cacao and blackberry flavored paired with your choice of gin, vodka, or rum (I believe)...
author: Critic X.

description:
Love this place.
The handcrafted cocktails show thoughtfulness in their recipes and are well prepared by an excellently trained bar staff.
The diversity of the patrons is a hopeful glimpse of what the future will be like everywhere in the world: gay, straight, every ethnicity represented and people getting along.
This place makes me proud to be a San Franciscan.
author: Thomas D.

description:
Awful cocktails. (Mojito was loaded with ice and bitter)
Expensive cocktails. 
Slow service (bar was nearly empty and tender tripping over himself)
Couches are NOT comfy. They are stiff, the chairs are just as bad, the tables are rough and drinks tip...

CASH only.... no thank you.
author: C K.

description:
I have been by here a bunch of times and finally went in. The place is super cute inside and dark, which is a plus in my book. There is a happy hour 5-8 p.m. 
The drinks are delicious and strong. They have a pool table in the back and alot of seating. I will defiantly be back!
author: Tracy B.

description:
Upscale hipster bar near the Castro district. Always my favorite to go to when i'm pre-gaming before hitting the club in the Castro. 

Allows visa card - $15 min

If you love a chill vibe, with the 80's classic songs, check this place out. 

Did i mention they have pools too?
author: Cavin T.

description:
They have a lifesize scroll of delightful cocktails. What's not to love?!

***a definite must get***
-Blackbird Toddy ($8)
Rye, Earl Gray, Vanilla Bean, Molasses, Lemon, & Clove 

Other cool things:
*happy hour from 5-8pm ($3 well & sours)
*cool photo booth
*awesome pool table
*lovely red leather couches
*open, airy, and artsy feel
*ATM in the back
*clean bathrooms
*friendly bartenders

Bottom line:
Fun place to hang out with friends over delightful cocktails. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Cs5DX-6syMfiJ1rACSRDVQ?userid=Rp8hHh-2U8Nh-7FhhspVxQ#kV_qgPMCqPU4ontr6-kN4A

Tips:
***CASH ONLY***
author: Joy A.

description:
Hm, i think this is actually a 4.5 in my book. It was insanely crowded for a Tuesday night, so at first it took forever for us to get drinks - but we moved down to a different bartender, and he banged out half a dozen drinks in no time. I didn't catch his name, but it was the guy with long blonde hair. He apologized for running out of Glenlivet, and since it was going to take time to get a new bottle, he let me have the short pour on the house!

Even though it was packed, almost everyone had a seat and you didn't have to squeeze anywhere. This is definitely one of the bigger bars I've been to. I love that they have a photobooth, and a pool table. If only they had some small bites, and the drinks were more generous, this would be five stars.
author: Cat N.

description:
Color me unimpressed 
So you have every fresh herb in the world - but no Diet Coke? 
LOl - good luck with all that
author: Sam A.

description:
Never not leave a tip...the bartender threw a lemon at me after I tipped his fellow bartender and not him. After asking why he threw a lemon at me he told me I was immature and to grow up. I personally just wanted to clear the air...he then took my beer and ID, claimed I was underage and had a bounce kick me out. 

The bouncer was nice so I won't hate the whole bar, but that bartender was immature and if that's how he treats customers, I'd reprimand him if I was the owner.
author: Jon S.

description:
A really great new spot to see and be seen. If you go during the day it is very chill, but if you go on the weekend nights be prepared for a crowd, a very well dressed good looking crowd. The specialty drink menu is awesome there are some really yummy and posh little drinks on the menu. I LOVE the way they have all the garnishes fresh and actually zest the lemon or the twist right when they make the drink. It is a higher level for sure and makes a difference..  someone said it takes too long, but I appreciate the level of service even if you have to wait a little longer. 

It is not a dance club ... more of a meet spot before the dance club..  

If you want something extra special - make sure to look for TK, she is the STAR bartender and will make you something unforgettable!

Some people classify this as a gay bar and it's location near The Castro does mean there is a predominantly gay clientèle, but it really is actually quite a mix of gay/straight looking stylish and having fun.

I think my fave drink was the 1845, i think... i forgot, but you will recognize it from the menu.. so YUM...
author: Corey Tess T.

description: Haven't been here in a while, since it seems to be consistently packed and it's impossible to get in the door. But hey, it's a great bar... Right? Wasnt going to be a secret forever, right? Tonight I finally made it all the way to the bar, but it was a disaster. This place is a far cry from what it used to be. This was always my go-to place to bring people and get a signature craft cocktail, shaken and everything! Imagine that! If the bartender tonight in the beanie and red plaid told me one more time "that cocktail just kicked the bucket, gotta pick a different one..." -while ushering me out of the way- I might have lost my mind. I guess $11 for a pre-made cocktail that they're going to run out of by the time you finish your order is all Blackbird has to offer now. We decided to leave instead of pick another drink for the 3rd time and I don't think any of us will be back.
author: Shawna Q.

description:
Great place to go for happy hour with friends!

Great vibe, fun music, delicious cocktails. The bartenders were considerate and helpful. The bar is a little on the dark side after the sun goes down, but it's all good - that's what creates that interesting vibe! 

Also it's 10 steps from the muni stop!
author: M. N.

description: Great drinks and nice ambience but the chick bartender on Tuesday happy hours is really slow at making drinks...try to get the guy bartender on Tuesdays to make your drink instead. Their $6 margaritas are great but the Game of Thrones named/inspired drinks are cheesy to say the least...in the winter though, they've got bomb hot toddies!
author: Berna V.

description: Why am I waiting so long on a Monday night at an empty bar for a drink?  And, I'm pretty cute.
author: Dirty J.

description: Delicious celery gimlets alone worth the trip. But add in the great bar snacks (tasty and gluten-free friendly, a rare find!), the chill mid-week ambiance and the friendly bartenders and I'm sold. Packing my bags and moving in! P.S. Great photo booth in the back of the bar for all of those who're fans of the classic 4-picture sheets...
author: Erin W.

description: Super cool mixology bar! The bacon infused old fashioned rocks!
author: Aman S.

description:
There is a pool table, photo booth, and a nice atmosphere.

The cocktails are strong and good, just like how I like it.

It's cash only though, which sucks just a little bit.

I'd come back here to start the night.
author: Christina L.

description:
I went in on a Friday minutes before they opened at 3p. My wife and I wanted a quick drink before our next stop. We've been here before and had a great time. But sadly, this last experience makes me wonder what happened. 

Strike 1: I ask the man, who we later learn is the bartender, propping open the front door, "Is the bar open?" He responds, "Well, we are now." [Not the best way to welcome your first guests. No smile. No eye contact.]

Strike 2: The same guy hands us a couple of menus. Based on experience at other bars, I ask another question, "Is it OK if I order drinks not on the menu?" He responds, "That's a really bizarre question. Look behind me, this is a bar. You can order whatever you want." [Again, what was with the attitude? We were the only 2 people there.]

Strike 3: He gives us a minute, which gives me a moment to talk with my wife. That's when we notice all of the fruit flies feasting on the garnishes and fruit lining the bar. [Are those yesterday's garnishes? Are they fresh? Did you not notice the fruit fly infestation prior to opening the doors? Sorry, I don't want that in my drink.]

It's ironic that the front window says, "Leave all pretensions at the door," when there was a whole bunch of it behind the bar.

TL;DR - The bartender was very rude, we were grossed out by the flies, we didn't order a drink, and we politely excused ourselves.
author: Justin D.

description:
Great local hangout, excellent craft cocktails, pool table.  More relaxed than the typical Castro bars down the street.
Cash Only!
author: Tim B.

description: I love love love this bar.  Josh is a great guy and an awesome bartender.  He always knows what I am ordering and really sets the standards high for this place.  If they aren't careful, I may try and steal him away!  Thanks Josh!
author: Shaun C.

description: This seems like a place I need to try the Happy Hour at. The cocktail menu was massive which I definitely have a weak spot for. I appreciated the fact they were doing well made cocktails but the bartenders still managed to serve up the drinks in a timely fashion. And there's a photo booth!
author: Janette W.

description:
I met up with a friend last night for post-work drinks. I have to say that the skill of the bartenders lives up to the hype.

I'll preface my review by saying that I don't like bars and I don't drink regularly (maybe a glass of wine with a special dinner or the occasional beer). This, however, is the type of bar I like--low key and not overly snooty/hipster/fratty/divey. 

I asked the bartender to make me a mocktail ($4) with ginger in it. He seemed genuinely excited that I was letting him be creative and do his thing and the end product was AMAZING! Seriously, one of the best drinks I've ever had. My second mocktail (this time with mint) was equally refreshing. I can't emphasize enough how well-mixed the drinks are here! 

One star deducted because it was a bit loud but I'll definitely be back here again.
author: Semuteh F.

description: Clever space, clever place. Having a knowledgeable bartender sure makes for a wonderful experience. Very chill late afternoon crowd, and a great way to stay out of the rain. Trust your barkeep and enjoy!
author: William M.

description:
Great ingredients don't make themselves into great cocktails.  The bartenders here don't have the level of skill that the high prices demand.  The drinks are ok but don't hold up to standards of modern mixology.

Also, the tables here have a naturally uneven surfaces... that is just silly, I want to set down my drink without it spilling all over, silly.
author: Thadd L.

description:
This place has a nice lounge/pub feel to it with trendy decor. I went with some friends and ended up leaving after one drink. We just couldn't hear each other. We had to scream like we were in a dance club. We wanted something casual and social, but it just wasn't possible here.  They are also cash only which is usually a huge negative for me (much more willing to pay a reasonable fee to the establishment than a $4-8 fee to the banks). 

So while the place isn't bad I don't think we'd ever go back.
author: Andrew D.

description:
I've been to Blackbird a few times.  But never really been impressed.  The interior is awesome and the vibe is chill.  This past Friday (3/13/15) I decided to bring a female friend in to drink and hang out.  She isn't so comfortable in the other gay bars "too sexual" she says. #duh

This was totally awesome.  They seem to have a few new staff members since I was there last.  I was happy to see this.  The guy who served us was David, I believe.  Handsome, short hair cut with a beard and he said he was from socal. San Diego(?) He chopped it up with my friend and was super patients to while she took forever to decide what she wanted to drink.  She even stopped him in the middle of making a drink and changed her mind.  I thought it might irritate him but nope.  He said no problem and made her a drink she loved.  He engaged with us and made the time enjoyable! So kickass.

This place really needs a few pinball machines.  Otherwise a great time.  My friend wants to go back again next Friday after work.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
Blackbird:
Inconsistent pricing - two different bar tenders charged us different prices for the same drinks. And no it wasn't happy hour!

Over-priced weak drinks - $10 for soda water and ice? Oh yeah there was supposed to vodka in that drink.

Long wait - two bars tenders ain't enough to handle the orders.  Good thing is people are catching on and going elsewhere so the wait time is reduced
author: Nico S.

description: Good cocktails, great space. Gets a little loud towards the peak hours of the evening. At one point the tamale lady walked in and sold tamales - kind of awesome slash hilarious. The bartenders command all here and that's perfectly fine with me.
author: Cindy H.

description:
It is really dark in here. Not spooky dark though. More like a sultry let-me-hold-your-hand-for-a-second dark, if you know what I mean. I came here on a Saturday night with a friend and it was packed. If you're one of those lucky underaged people that can walk into 21+ bars without having your ID checked, this place isn't for you. There's a bouncer that checks ID and meh, he wasn't super friendly. I like bouncers with a little spunk.

The crowd in here is a mix; the ratio of males to females is about 4-1. My favorite thing about this bar/lounge is the pool table in the back. Only $1/game! There's also a photobooth located in the back area. I didn't get a chance to try their signature cocktails (which is what this place is really known for) because I didn't stay for too long. I did, however, ordered a bottled beer. I believe most bottled beers are $5-8, depending on what you order.
author: Annie S.

description:
Really like this place and now I'm just a couple blocks away! 

Great drinks, good vibes, nice bartenders. The downside is that it often takes awhile to get drinks since they have so many ingredients. They have a small but respectable beer list when I'm not feeling the liquor and great drinks when I am. I'm a sucker for perfectly clear cubed ice and unique bitters in my bourbon.

Cash only!
author: Emily H.

description: Wonderful place. The cocktails are great and the space seems to have been designed with a lot of care and attention to detail.
author: Scott M.

description:
This place always have the best mixed drinks, that and they're original... a MUST visit bar when you're near Market and Church... 

What's keeping this from a 5 star rating? DEBIT CARDS! Hello Blackbird, welcome to 2012...
author: Nathan D.

description: This bar has a pool table and photo booth in the back, but don't let that distract from the inventive cocktail menu. They take a lot of classic drinks and put a fresh spin on them. Great place to hang out after work or after dinner during the week. Make sure to talk to the bartenders, they can put together a lot of interesting drinks beyond what's on the menu.
author: Alex P.

description:
Love this place. Went there for the first time this Saturday. We found a nice area of the bar towards the front but on the side, away from the throngs that come in to order drinks. So we got to watch the mixologists in action. And they are indeed mixologists! They mixed those drinks with such care and artistry. And the drinks we had were soo good! I tried one item from their menu, the Pimms Cup and that was so good! $9.. that's amazing value. And my favorite drink Sidecar was only $8! Usually you pay $10-14 in the city! 
Vibe of the place was very laid back, a good mix of people. Young, old, gay straight, men, women. I'm a fan!
author: Vol T.

description: I've been here twice now and haven't been totally impressed. The price of the drinks don't really compare to their quality I feel like. The second time I went, my drink was a bit watered down. It can also take a while to get a drink if you come on a busy night. However, I still would come back because I like the atmosphere of this place. It's a place that feels real comfortable. This place is a cash only though. There is an ATM inside and also a photobooth. Overall, it's an alright place and I can understand why people like it too.
author: Julie L.

description:
The Blackbird is an excellent neighborhood bar.  My buddy ordered the Nice Melon, that was an excellent drink.  I had some concoction with apple vodka, it was really good.  The place is of a good size.  It has huge bar area to the left and seating on the right.  There is a pool table with additional seating in the back.  The decor is nice and classy.  It is dark inside, and there are tiny candles at every table.  

NOTE:  I guess this place does take reservations, so I do recommend that you call them up and secure a table.  I saw people coming in and looking for a place to sit.  I thought it was weird to so many tables "reserved" but no one sitting.  Luckily for me, my buddy and I found a place to sit near the window.  

CASH ONLY.  

Cheers
author: Frank M.

description:
I love a skilled bartender.  Like seriously.  I wish there were a filter on Yelp for how skilled the bartenders are.  Then I would have found this place sooner.

They also have a reasonably large and varied specialty cocktail list with some weird stuff on there, which I love.

It lost a star simply because the last time I went everything was kind of a miss, but I think it was just somebody's off day.  

It'd be nice if they had snacks.  That is all.
author: Rachel S.

description:
Great atmosphere, awesome bartenders and deelicious cocktails!!

Secret Handshake - Germain-Robin Brandy, Averna, Orange-Pomegranate Reduction. Does the job, but still a little strong for my taste preference. 

Tiger Tail - Brugal Anejo Rum, Apricot Liqueur, Pineapple, Lime, Agave, Tiki Bitters, Ginger Beer. My favorite cocktail of the night, perfect amount of sweetness with the perfect kick of alcohol.
author: Elaine N.

description: Great place to grab a drink after work, they have a nice pool table in the back which has spacious seating for those who like to watch instead of play. They also have a long list of cocktails which sound very tasty, they have  great selection of Tequila, I asked the bartender what tequila would be closest to Hornitos and he said, well "hornitos" is a crappy tequila, why don't you try Mezal, I was down and so was my husband. We each had a tequila sunrise, they were tasty and strong! You must try this bar out, plus one block away is Brewcade so you can play some games!
author: Iliana S.

description:
Went here with a couple of friends last night.  They have an interesting list of specialty drinks.  It should be noted first and foremost that the place is cash only.  

The ambiance is relaxed and classy.  They have a pool table in the back, a long cushioned bench, short tables, chairs, and standing room.  Like most bars, it's pretty loud inside, which can make it hard to hear if you're sitting across the table from someone.  

I guess the only other thing to note is that, since it's in the Castro, it should be no surprise that it is a predominantly gay bar.  My friends said the number of girls there last night was abnormal for the place.  In any case, probably worth noting if you're looking or not looking for that kind of scene.
author: Brian B.

description:
You know you're getting old when, in writing reviews, you find yourself repeatedly stating things like "Great ambience -- when it's not crowded!" or "Be sure to visit during an off-peak time -- like 3:00 on a Monday!" (See also: "The music is so loud!") That said -- I do like Blackbird, but I'm happiest in the seated section along the wall, or at one of the (rare) window tables -- or even seated at the bar. If I go on a weekend or for happy hour, say, on a Thursday, I feel as if I need a WeedWacker to get even remotely close to the bar (but that's just me; I'm short and easily lost among hordes of revelers). The drinks are good, though ($10ish), and I love the space itself. The bartenders have always been friendly. There are also pretzels. Pretzels are good. 

Of note: Cash only! I can't tell you how many times I've forgotten this and had to run to Walgreens (a few blocks away).
author: Katie M.

description:
Young, wild, & restless. In my 20's, I made questionable decisions & bought questionable clothes (you mean half tops & hip huggers aren't appropriate for family get-togethers?) which I wore to sketchy places.

As I've gotten older, my taste in nightlife scene has grown up, too. Blackbird is proof of that. The more mature crowd ensures drama stays far, far away. And there are actual places to sit & enjoy your drank. Clientele is mostly of the fabulous gay persuasion (it is located in the Castro, afterall), but a perfectly comfortable place for sexy straights, too. 

Drinks of the night: Flor & Fauna, Rosemary's Baby, & Strawberry Cooler. All a big hit. 

I'm not saying I don't still appreciate a debaucherous-rolling-in-at-5am-slept-in-my-makeup-and-forgot-who-I-offended-last-night kinda night. I'm just saying...it's equally satisfying to imbibe in a loungey, chill joint like Blackbird.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
Possibly one of my favorite SF cocktail bars yet. Perfect for a casual night out. The ambiance is dark and moody, with sexual art and grungy walls. Absolutely obsessed with their drink menu. I can't remember the name of my drink, but I told the bartender I typically drank dry gin martinis and he stirred up something cool and refreshing, with a berry in it. Just tangy enough (I hate sweet), totally matched my taste buds. 

I want to bring all my visitors here, I think it perfectly captures the understated vibe of SF.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
Short 'n' sweet:

- Delicious drinks, and hilarious menu nomenclature
- Friendly bartenders
- Nice ambiance, without being pretentious
- Good mix of gay and straight.  Attractive males a plus.
- $9-13 for a nice cocktail -- which ain't cheap, but also isn't excessive for a well-made and well-presented drink in SF
- Great garnishes -- smoked, brandied cherries; candied coconut; and a small victory garden's worth on their bloodies
author: Elle T.

description: I love the drink menu! I told the bartender that I like vodka with citrus and he came up with a drink that I loved and have been coming back to try other cocktails!  Plus the vibe rocks!
author: Heidi L.

description:
this is a pretty swanky posh hipster-ish speakeasy type of place.  it's very trendy with its light bulbs hanging from the ceiling and its bearded bartenders carefully "handcrafting" your beverage.

wednesday night, 3 people.  hanging out for a friend's birthday.
we ordered the Prospect Park, Poached Pear and the Bodega Blossom.  all very very very delicious.  the drinks were about $12 each, which in SF, or anywhere in california, is cheap as dirt.  and when i say "handcraft", i wasn't being sarcastic.  it literally takes about 10 minutes to make a single drink. 

they also serve a large variety of hard to find beers and ales, which they pride themselves in, but it'll cost you more than the normal expensive beer in SF.  

the ambience was pretty cool and laid-back.  it was definitely a good time.  
pool table in the back.  
would definitely come back and hang out here again.
author: Jamie E.

description: Who is the genius who decided to put uneven table surfaces in a cocktail bar? I've seen multiple people spill their drinks on these ridiculous tables just this week. The crowd here is painfully mainstream and reflective of the "new San Francisco." The cocktails are delicious.
author: Mark S.

description:
Great place to get some delicious drinks and there is always a decent sized crowd. 

I came here about a month ago with my boyfriend and I have just started trying different bars in San Francisco because I just turned 21. Out of all the places I tried I must say this is definitely one of the top places so far on my list. The drinks were delicious and unique. My drink had a bit of gin and cardamom which I thought was an odd mixture but turned out to be just great. Everyone was friendly and the place had a decent sized crowd, not too many people and not too little. I will definitely be coming back to this place. My only complaint is that they only accept cash which for me is extremely annoying.
author: Jacqueline C.

description: I came in for a cocktail or two on a Tuesday night with a buddy. We got our first no problem. When it came time to order my 2nd, my buddy walked up to the bar and waited.  I'm 31, but sadly my second drink was finally made mins before my 40th birthday. I sadly died.  Alone and sober on the bench waiting.  Waiting for a cocktail that sadly would never reach my mouth.  Slowest bar ever. Like ever.
author: Andrew L.

description: It's a loud bar ( music waaaay turned up) This is not a place to have a conversation or a date. The tables are also uncomfortable to sit at because they are low and have a cool yet non functional surface that doesn't even make your drink sit properly and leaves a mark on your arm. On the flip side the drinks are fabulous. Cash only bar. Good service. Try to hang near the bar. It's less loud and easier to grab a drink.
author: Zita M.

description: I really wanted to like this place. Good happy hour, great cocktails and fun decor. Came for the first time last night for a friend's birthday where he had a couple tables reserved. I ordered a gin and tonic which took almost 10 minutes to makes since the bartender kept taking other orders, closing out tabs and pouring other drinks in between adding each ingredient to my glass. I kept my tab open and ordered a few other drinks throughout the evening. When I went to close out, I gave my name to a different bartender and he couldn't find my card. After looking through all the cards and all over the register area they finally told me that they gave my card away to someone with the same last name. Which doesn't make sense cause if they had the same last name there should have been a card that they thought was mine...so that was a lie. They gave me a blank stare when I asked what I should do next. Moral of the story, don't expect to get a simple cocktail made in a decent amount of time here and do NOT leave your tab open.
author: Kianna H.

description:
Mixed crowd, mixed drinks, not bad.

Blackbird is a happening spot on the San Francisco scene.  The bartenders are true artists making the most interesting concoctions I've ever seen.

One drink included raw egg whites, others eye droppers of spice.  You can order a regular mixed drink like a vodka/soda, gin/tonic... but the truly adventurous and those in the know will order off the chalk board menu.

Drink up, enjoy!  Expect a small wait on weekends.  Great atmosphere.
author: Juan F.

description: My favorite bar in San Francisco! 5-8 PM happy hour?! Delicious old fashioneds and margaritas for $6 during that time frame?! Sign me up! This spot is fantastic.
author: Andrea K.

description:
I went here with my roommate and a friend one evening recently. I was not really impressed. 

Firstly, I made the egregious sin of requesting a brand of liquor this bar doesn't carry. Suffice it to say I was properly chastised by the bartender in front of my friends: "We don't carry that stuff. I guess you'll have to pick something else buddy." I ordered a Jack & Coke instead. The bartender rolled his eyes at my order but made it anyway. I guess I should have ordered one of the super-duper, handcrafted, organic hipster cocktails. 

Secondly, while the ambiance in the front of the bar is pretty passable, the back of the bar is horrible. It looks cheap and hurried AND dirty. 

I probably won't return.
author: Michael E.

description:
Excellent cocktails just a little pricey (hence the 4 star review.)

Great place for socializing, getting drunk (duh), playing pool and to take pictures in the little photo booth!

I really enjoyed the look and feel of this place. The ideas for the special cocktail menu on the board were great as well. But quality is what you pay for right? Come here and support your local gay bar.
author: Jen W.

description:
Pretty much my go-to-bar when I start a night... Such a good vibe inside with high quality cocktails and always the most amazing people to talk to. 

Bar tenders all know their stuff and there is plenty of seating and great music and ambiance.
author: Isaac B.

description: This is my favorite bar in the Castro! Complex drinks that taste amazing, great staff, and friendly familiar faces. The blackbird is an awesome spot to meet friends and grab some drinks. And for those that complain that from time to time it takes a little time to get a drink... Want some cheese with that wine? I mean jeez- what do you expect the drinks are works of art and well worth the extra minute or 2 it takes to prepare them. Tighten up and stop crying; nobody likes a complainer.
author: Jason W.

description: Everyone here was a stereotypically pretentious asshole Hipster.
author: Bianca U.

description:
I suggested this as a place to meet up with a few friends, on a Monday evening, partly because I wanted to check it out, it was a central location, and the menu sounded interesting, plus they had some happy hour specials. And I scored parking right out front! But it was 6pm...on a Monday...

What I liked about it included:
- pretty cool space/interiors - mostly unique and fun
- interesting and unique "artisan" cocktail menu
- huge selection of craft beers

What I did not like:
- Cash only! I find this a dated concept, And LAME. I rarely use cash. I was lucky I even had enough on me to cover a few things. Just deal with the fees like every other business in the country. I suppose it's because they don't claim all of their sales, which I do not particularly respect. But then again, I don't really care why.

- I partly selected this place because they did have some food items. When I asked a bartender about the food, she said that normally they have food, but since they were out of crackers, and pretty much everything included crackers, that there was no food being served. For reals?? She did mention it was ok to bring in outside food, but that is ridiculous that I should have to now leave to get something.

- After a while, my friends were as hungry as I was, so one of them actually went to a store they knew of nearby, and we bought our own crackers. We then ordered the fava bean hummus/dip and the pimento cheese. The bean dip was ok - nothing special. I would say it needed some spices, but was a bit bland and did not have the flavors the menu professed. The pimento cheese was kind of gross. I don't like pimentos, but it seemed like barely a step above seriously processed cheese. The menu said it was a sharp cheddar. Didn't taste anything like sharp cheddar to me. On top of that, seeing as we supplied our own crackers, they refused to discount those items at all. I thought that was lame, pathetic, bad business and poor service. 

- Their "artisan" cocktail list is very interesting and unique, but to be honest, none actually sounded tempting. Obviously what people like, ranges, but every cocktail had at least 1, if not a few ingredients that I personally do not like. My friend did get one that was pretty good, but let's just say her second drink was a beer, so she didn't exactly love it.

- Being Monday, starting fairly early in the evening, the music was way too loud. I could barely hear my friends. The volume was very unnecessary and irritating. *note - I'm a bit old, and the crowd was, overall, a good 10-15 years younger, but I appreciate a cool place (almost) as much as the next (much younger) person... 

- The wine list is minimal.

- The tables are kind of cool - they look like they are cut from fossilized trees. But the surface is so textured, bumpy and uneven, I kept moving my glass around since it was tilting so much, in search of a more even area. It looked like something that should have been covered by a sheet of glass. The tabletop also tilted if you leaned on it, making it even more precarious.

Overall, I cannot say I'd like to return. It's not all bad, but come on - there are a lot of options in SF that do the same thing a lot better, with much better service....
author: Dana L.

description: Such a great, cozy and friendly bar. We celebrated a friend's birthday here up at the front table and the overall vibe was exactly what we all wanted: an eclectic, SF-locals crowd, bustling energy and... the bar? Such LOVELY (and talented) bartenders. All so nice and they actually make eye contact during busy times, just to give that you extra confidence knowing they'll get to you when they can (I really like bars that do that- and it is a team effort). I order the orchard here and it's just delicious. Thanks Blackbird - you're the bees knees.
author: Meredith R.

description:
On the border of castro, a small gem of a bar tucked into a corner of Market.

The bad: Can't find any criticisms- except maybe the restroom, which could be cleaner, but hey it's a bar!

The good: Dimly lit with softly trendy music, Blackbird fills up fast right after dinner as people hop over for well crafted drinks and a good time. There's a pool table and photobooth at the back- make sure you are stocked up on quarters and 1 dollar bills- and the back sofa area gets snatched up quickly so I'd get here early around 9 or 10. They have unique and well made drinks, such as the rose and crown- essentially a Greyhound with a pretty little rose petal floated at the top- and mixed whiskey or rum cocktails. 

Ambiance: mellow, great place to chill with friends. 20's to 30's crowd, a mix of hipsters, Castro residents and yuppies.

Overall: a great bar with tasty drinks and pleasant ways to pass the time. The photobooth is a nice place to commemorate the evening!
author: Jackie T.

description:
Definitely my favorite bar in the Castro since you can actually hear people talk. Now that Churchill has opened up, the Friday  night lines seems to have disappeared. Still wall-to-wall with dudes and the occasional lady, but at least tables open up and you aren't always getting belly bumped. Empties out around midnight since it's usually the first stop on a night out for most of the people.

Cocktails are a little pricey, but always tasty.

Sidewinder was ginger beer and mezcal mostly, didn't really taste the other misc. stuff. The spring of basil atop was nommy once you mash it into the ice. Initial impression is that the drink is all ice, but steep alcohol pours, so the ice kinda works out. 

The back area has cool newspaper headlines plastering the walls and the whole place has a vaguely classy feel to it.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Super chill place with a fantastic happy hour. Gets a little packed and loud with an after work crowd, but still plenty of seating and bar space. 

The best part is around 8pm they bring a "Lets Be Frank" hot dog stand inside the bar. Didn't get to try it but the smell was overpowering and incredible. Will have to indulge next time.
author: Nadine H.

description: I was looking for a chill bar to reconnect with a friend but needed one that opened early. Blackbird did that - open by 3 pm. (Oddly us early birds do not get Happy Hour specials - that starts at 5 pm.) In any event, as soon as I saddled up to the bar I got a chilly reception from the bartender. Don't know what was his problem but I did not feel welcomed. I was totally friendly; he would benefit from some training in customer service. I regret leaving a good tip because that might encourage such bad behavior. Too bad as I was hoping to find that ideal early meeting place.
author: CJ C.

description:
Good cocktails in nice glasses!
Dark and stylish interior.
Give it a try!
author: Ted S.

description:
This is a nice bar with great cocktails and a long draft beer list. 

It has a rustic decor with uneven tables, so be careful not to knock over your drink on the ridges. The back of the bar houses a pool table, photo booth and ATM. The bartenders were super friendly.

Other reviewers have complained about the noise but it didn't bother me at all.

Don't forget to bring some green since it's cash only.
author: Nick K.

description:
Blackbird is one of the best cocktail bars I've been to. If you want a carefully crafted cocktail, or you just want to get wasted, they have something for you.

Their happy hour just increased a little, but you can still get $4 well drinks and $6 old fashioned's from 5-8pm every weekday. Their happy hour goes until 8. That is awesome. Blackbird wants you to get drunk after you leave work, apparently. So, thanks Blackbird.

If you're not going for happy, I would recommend asking your bartender what you would like. This is one of those places where they'll make you something better than what you were planning on ordering. They even have cocktails on drought. Bartenders are super nice too.

They have pool tables in the back and rotate art on the walls. There's mixed style seating throughout the place for whatever type of group you're in. 

Don't forget: cash only.
Oh, SF.
author: K M.

description: Their happy hour menu is amazing! I came in on a Monday night and the crowd was decent (not big, not small) with low-key, dark ambience. I had the Early Bird drink with the pub cheese appetizer. The drink was really subtle (not too boozy at all) and the pub cheese was a good snack size.
author: Theresa D.

description:
Modern fun ambiance on the edge of the Castro with a mostly a mixed crowd. Cocktails are decent. The biggest drawback is the long line that is usually happening, which makes getting a beverage takes FOREVER, even if it's just a beer.

On the flip side, there is a happy hour, pool table and retro photo booth in the back.
author: Derwood A.

description:
This is the spot. 

I haven't found a more desirable bar in San Francisco, and I'm a little scared that this one will lose its place in my heart. I've been going here quite a bit since March, and I've never had a bad experience. 

The main element in any great business is the people. Blackbird hires some good ones! I love the bartenders and staff. Even when they're packed to capacity, the employees treat everyone with equanimity and respect. The quality of drink does not change as the head count rises; every drink is important. Blackbird attracts some good, regular customers as well. They are mainly nice, friendly, and relaxed 20-to-40-somethings. 

The ambiance of the bar is neighborhood-bar-tavern-like: wood, dim lighting, and a pool table. The signage is perfect as well, nothing flashy, just an inconspicuous black and white logo. 

The drinks are top notch. They have the best Moscow Mule I've ever had, and some cheap Drought Beer ($3) and wine starting at $4. I've never had any of the food, so I can't speak to that, but the prices are good on everything. 

Tip: CASH ONLY
author: Alex F.

description:
Loved this bar! Seems like the perfect spot to catch up with friends, meet some new interesting people (I saw a man wearing real life Google glasses here...can you tell I'm not from SF?), or sip on a few delicious cocktails. 

On a Saturday night the bar was full, but there were still plenty of tables and places to hang out. The music wasn't too loud and the bartenders were nice. All around, a great spot in the area!
author: Julie B.

description: Absolutely loved this place, came here after dinner with my fiancé and had a great time! The drinks are amazing, good vibe, nice people and awesome decor. I don't rate too many bars but this one so far has been my favorite out of all of the ones we have tried in SF.
author: Matthew M.

description: This place is great! My fiancé and I were exploring this area of SF last night for the first time and lucky came upon Blackbird. The cocktails were delicious and the ambience/ great vibes were exactly what we were looking for last night!
author: Bhavisha P.

description: LOVE this place!! this was originally going to be just one stop on our night of bar-hopping, but we loved it so much we stayed for HOURS.  also, altho the happy hour deals are amazing, we ended up getting mostly non-happy hour drinks bcz they sounded so good & so reasonably priced. they were so yummy- loved the new orleans coffee & the drink w/ the coconut-washed bourbon. can't wait to come back!
author: Amos W.

description: Relaxed, casual but romantic atmosphere. Rustic decore wth pool table (I know ironic) in the back. Great cocktails. Very friendly staff. It's general seating and you order at the bar. ~$10 a cocktail.
author: J. M.

description:
The thing is... I really want to like Blackbird.  I think they do a good job with their menu and keep their drink options "fresh."  But in SF... the whole mixologist thing is EVERYWHERE, so what makes it stand out is the "rest" of the experience... and see, this is where I am always disappointed.

The bartenders are not the best when it comes to customer service... I almost always feel like I am "bothering" them when I order a drink.  Heaven forbid that I ask for a recommendation...

And don't every ask "what do you think of..." as that will almost always give you the most useless answer of "it's good"...

It is sad when a business gets lazy with its customer service just because it has a good location that makes it easy for people...  so make the trek. Go elsewhere. Pay the same price, if not better, and feel "welcome" rather than feeling like you are reliving the "It's very expensive!" you really shouldn't be shopping here "Pretty Woman" experience.
author: Jake W.

description:
This place gets LOUD so be warned, but other than that this space is awesome.  The decor is simple and yet somehow provides some "chic-ness" to the drinkers and fashionistas surrounding.  The bartenders are trained well when it comes to making a proper drink and shaking that cocktail shaker well.  And I mean WELL.  But where have all the mustaches gone? ...you might ask  if they aren't in the Mission district located on the face of a young up-and-coming hipster they would be located on the patrons/bartenders of this trendy hot-spot.

Blackbird draws a good crowd of people and it seems as if everyone clusters here for some sort of birthday or going away celebration so you know it's near and dear to lot's of people's hearts.  The prices are reasonable and the music is good. Pull up a chair/booth seat if you can find one, and make sure to stop by the photo booth on your way out for a last minute memory-maker.

Bring cash!
author: Kevin J.

description:
Lovely venue when its empty. The last few times i tried to go here, it was way too packed to even enjoy it and had a hard time getting a drink. Came here during the day so it was empty and quiet.

I tried a mocktail and had the bartender make up something with raspberries and mint, he was super nice and just went with it. It was a great spontaneous non-alcoholic drink. The Pimms Cup was also a good drink that my friend ordered.
author: Darnell L.

description: Awesome cocktail lounge!!! Interesting drinks, friendly bartenders and nice space!  The bartender / mixologist came up with some creative cocktails, explained the mix and why they work well together and they couldn't have been better!
author: Patrick C.

description:
The cocktails are very good.  They are not the best craft cocktails I have had--very good, but for sure not the best.  The crowd is lovely, a really nice/friendly yet cool kind of vibe.  

My real complaint is that the bar tenders had bad attitudes both times that I went. Maybe it's just a San Francisco thing where it's kind of cool to be too cool for school, but I found myself annoyed at how they seemed annoyed to be working there.  I for sure did not feel like I could ask questions about the drinks or learn about what was behind the bar--that would be have just been a huge bother for them.  Every other craft cocktail bar in the country that I've been to has always had AWESOME bar tenders who are clearly passionate about what they are doing and love to educate customers about the offerings.  

We are moving to the area soon. Maybe we'll find a way to make friends.
author: WestCoastYelper W.

description:
I love that making a drink has turned into mixology.  If I'm going to pay for drinks out, I prefer going to a place that employs mixologists rather than beer slingers.  It's slower, but it's tastier.

I knew I wanted something with Pimm's but didn't' see it on the menu.  The bartender whipped me up something refreshing.  I've been here twice and the drinks are great.  As I age, I prefer these places on week nights and not so crowded.  :)
author: Kristin G.

description:
First the good... love this place and love the cocktails.  The Slurpee is an always-awesome classic.  Same goes for the Early Bird.   The new Winter menu is across-the-board great.  Place is usually a bit intense in terms of crowd on weekend nights, but that's to be expected when drinks are that good.

In terms of the bad: could really live without one particularly pretentious bartender.  Dude with the shoulder-length hair... please, please chill out!  He's always giving off vibes like he resents all his customers.  Had a friend accidentally spill a drink that he had just made (sucks but it happens!) and he not only charged for it (acceptable, but a nice bartender would just be friendly and just make another) but also acted sooo put out by it.  Made a HUGE production of cleaning up the small spill on the bar.  Look, my friend already felt bad about spilling the drink... no need to make it an even bigger deal by announcing to everyone within earshot that you were cleaning up a "huge puddle."  Problem is that this wasn't an isolated incident... every time I encounter this guy he's spazzing out and acting like we should be grateful for the honor of paying him $10 for a drink.

I love this place but I'd love it even more if the folks behind the bar were nicer.
author: Parsons M.

description:
Set in the cool neck of the woods that is Castro, Blackbird is a cool bar that harbours a hipster and trendy ambience. 

They serve great cocktails, have comfy couches and a pool table. The lighting is more than dim, quite dark actually but I like it. Blackbird is a place where you can catch up with mates or take a date for drinks although some might find the music a bit loud.

We had a good time and I'd definitely go back on my next visit to San Fran.
author: Kevin S.

description:
I'd heard about Blackbird after I moved away from the city, but wasn't quite certain whether or not I'd really enjoy it as much as my friends suggested they did. You know what I'm saying; a good bar is like a style. Some people love one, some people hate it. You never know until you try it on.

So since I was in the area, and a friend was meeting up some of his homies here to grab a cocktail, we thought we'd tag along and see for ourselves. It's an unassuming little place from the outside, as is the fashion in San Francisco... inside, they did a wonderful job. It's stylish and hip without being too intentional; doesn't do the "LA" thing and try too hard. Wood finishes and natural tones... it works.

We ordered two drinks from the specialty menu, at random, and both were delicious. Not only that, they were reasonably priced. We had a nice time, enjoyed a chill crowd, had a drink, and left to meet another friend at another venue. Truthfully, when I move back to San Francisco, this would be my new go-to place on a slow night. I'd love to shoot pool, have a drink, hang out, mellow... it's a good vibe.

I'm a believer.
author: Sean B.

description:
This is a very cool bar - very chill, nice crowd. People seemed happy! I like the decor - modern and cozy at the same time. Lively, but not to loud to chat. And the ever-changing speciality drink menu is killer. I had the blackberry cobbler drink. Didn't have any blackberry in it, but the flavor was spot on. Really yummy!

Edit: Owner corrected me. It was a blackbird cobbler, not blackberry. Whoops!
author: Andrew K.

description:
I went to Blackbird last night with a friend and we thoroughly enjoyed our cocktails. It was a Monday night so the bar wasn't busy, which was great because we were able to snag a table. It's got a great vibe and had a good mixture of people from different neighborhoods. 

The bartender was very friendly and suggested some great cocktails. I got the Sangre Dulce- delicious. My friend got the Last Word, which was also very good. I think the drinks were $9 each, so very reasonably priced for a quality craft cocktail.

Cash only!
author: Carla R.

description: Nice bartenders, chill atmosphere, and great drinks. What more can you ask for? For something fruity, try the stratosphere #2!
author: Kim D.

description:
Cash only?  Seriously?  I love how they charge $12 for a cocktail and then inconvenience their customers by not accepting credit cards.  Why would ANY "upscale" bar do that? 

Oooohhhhh, that's right.... Blackbird would rather inconvenience their customers by making us use their tacky looking ATM in the back of the bar, where they earn money from each transaction. Good for Blackbird, bad for the customers. 

Also, the service was slow, REAL slow, and the bartenders all have a crappy attitude, like they're doing me a favor just by showing up to work.
author: Ted T.

description:
I have been to Blackbird a number of times and really liked the vibe and the drinks.  Now I love my gays, but it's nice to go to a place right outside of the Castro to be around some (mostly) straights too!

I was most impressed with the hot toddy I recently had...so impressed in fact that I can honestly say it has not been beat in my experience.  Not only was there the right amount of hot water and booze, but they added a whole cinnamon stick, cloves and star anise- beautiful!!

I can't give this place 5 stars yet, but I promise to keep coming back so that I can do so :)
author: Laura P.

description:
A sign of a good bar when it's happy hour but they are at capacity at 5.45pm on a Friday. And it's not like they are giving away drinks or anything. Blackbird is just honest to goodness a great bar with a relaxed yet refined experience with mighty tasty drinks to boot! 

But back to that whole capacity thing. I had the day off and made it to the bar around 4ish but did the rest of the folks make a beeline straight from work to the Castro, knocking aside anyone who stood in their way of getting after work libations? 

I wouldn't be the surprised because the bartenders take their time to make the delicious cocktails. "My Clementine" was a delicious citrus concoction with a subtle hint of honey that masks quite a bit of clementine vodka. Beer drinkers have no fear for they have a fantastic list of brews on tap ranging from Alaskan Amber to the ever delicious Brother Thelonius. Beers during happy hour run you between $3-5. 

Much to love about Blackbird. I love the place, the people, and I definitely love the drinks. Must stop in if you're in the neighborhood. Unless of course if they are at capacity.
author: Jon L.

description: I love this place, probably one of my favorite bars in SF. It's a little pricey but  great cocktail combinations. I love the crowd, a good mix of people (urban, hipsters, professionals, gay, straight, black, white, ugly, sexy, and everything else.) I usually make this my first stop on a Friday night where I can grab a seat near the back with my friends to chat it up before being ready to hit the dance floor somewhere else.
author: Juan T. K.

description: i welcomed the warm, sunny weather with a refreshing pimms cup at blackbird yesterday, and it was perfect. that is all.
author: Archana P.

description: Blackbird is a chill place to have happy hour.  It's not super crowded, plenty of seating, and perfect for a drink, or two, or three!  Great happy hour pricing.  Draught beer is $1 off, Bud/Bud Light/PBR $2, House Red/White $5/$6, Wells Drinks $4, and Sours $5.
author: Wendy S.

description:
The drinks here are bomb!  Their specialty cocktails are some of the best drinks I've had.  The bartenders are also consistent with them which is a plus.

This is a great place to bring a date and chat it up with some good drinks.  It does get pretty crazy from what I saw the few times I've been, so expect to stand at peak hours.  If I want drinks, I usually think of this place.  Too bad I do not live in SF, but if there's a chance, I'd come here.
author: Andrew N.

description:
Had an old fashioned with an old pal.
She had a moscow mule... it was not in a copper cup -___-

We came on a Tues night and it wasn't crowded.  Just what we wanted.
Cute lighting and easy for us to catch up.

Curious to check it out on a busy night.
author: Anne-Mary P.

description:
Somewhat douchey hipster crowd. Though it's mixed (straight and gay) so that can be a plus for a bigger group. 

Drinks are OK. Biggest beef is on weekends there is nowhere and I mean NOWHERE to sit or even stand without being bumped into repeatedly. It's usually quite hot in here, too. Oh, and two stalls per bathroom means the lines are crazy.

I do like the decor. I find myself reading the vintage newspaper headlines on the walls, mostly because my face is pressed up against them due to all the people crushing past me.
author: John C.

description: Nice bar. Great selection of drinks. They have a pool table in the back but it's quite hard to play if it gets crowded.
author: Evelyn Q.

description: I have been to Blackbird a couple of times now, both on a weeknight when it wasn't very crowded and on a Friday night when it was pretty packed, and I have been very happy with my experience on both occasions. I would consider this place a nice blend between divey and classy. The drinks are great: they have the menu of specialty cocktails on a big board on the side, which is amazing considering I am almost never able to find the menu at the bar when I go to most divey places.  They aren't necessarily the cheapest, but I expected just as such from a place like this one. This is also a place that you can go not just with friends but also with a significant other for a cocktail or two. There are plenty of tables where you can sit down and have a nice conversation while still being able to hear one another. Granted it's harder on the busier nights such as on the weekend, but it's still possible. There is also a pool table in the back, which is a nice touch. Overall, a nice place to grab drinks in the Duboce area!
author: Kunal N.

description: Over priced drinks and they do not take cards. It's an upscale place that is cash only. Super lame. It took over 20 minutes to get a drink and they were not even that busy. Won't be coming back.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Blackbird has the absolute best cocktail program in the city and only a few are aware of it. This place single-handedly turned me around on mezcal, whiskeys, and bourbons by putting them in innovative drinks that flatter these liquors I would not have otherwise appreciated. There's a photobooth, pool tables, witty bartenders, barrel aged cocktails, and truly innovative market-driven drinks.

The interior reminds me of the ghost levels from Super Nintendo's Mario's World, and it's cash only.
author: Alex V.

description: Bartenders are super nice and their happy hour is great! (5-8 M-F) And for the fireball lovers they make their own fireball which was really good I might add.
author: Christa C.

description: A previous reviewer said it reminded him of a Hell's Kitchen bar but it's more Williamsburg-ey.
author: Paul K.

description:
Sometimes you just need a stiff one...

...you know, drinks...? 

Blackbird is the place to go when you just want to chill, without being surrounded by pretentious douchebags. The bartenders are cool as ish and they are true mixologists, working away behind the bar in a scientific, focused fury.

The butcher-paper menu offers intriguing specialities with ingredients you won't find in your average bar. Normally I like to stick to my same drink, but I had to experiment here.

I really liked the cucumber-infused Pimms Cup. And the light and citrusy Early Bird satisfied my newfound fondness of St. Germain. My only gripe is that my Dark & Stormy should've been a well drink at their happy hour price - but here it was $8. 

- Pool tables in the back. 
- Narrow but spacious with a good amount of seating.
- Not overly crowded, although I was here on a Monday night so I can't attest to the weekends.
- Cash only.
author: Mariela D.

description:
I'd like to tell you a little secret, but you have to promise that you won't tell anyone else okay? Promise?... Alright here it is....

I'm in love with Blackbird.

There, I said it. It's finally off my chest. I am as free as a bird and that bird happens to be black.

Whenever I want to have a relaxed happy hour or late night drink with a friend, we head to Blackbird first. The bartenders are all amazing, make some of the best cocktails in SF, and know. their. sh*t. And let's be honest, what's not to love here?

Going on a first date and need a good place to get to know someone? Blackbird.

Trying to avoid the typical haunts of the Castro for a more upscale drinking experience? Blackbird.

Need to enjoy an ever changing art collection? Blackbird.

Hungry for a little bowl of pretzels with your cocktail? BLACKBIRD, DUH.

It's rare that you come across a bar with so much character, but this place honestly gets me like no other. Enjoy your drink, but try not to tell too many people okay? I need to have my love affair in peace.

Cheers.
author: Sean R.

description: Atmosphere and service were great. The menu has very few gluten-free items; if you want gluten-free I would suggest calling ahead to see if the chef can accommodate you. I did not ask for a gluten-free menu because I thought the chicken and salad would be GF, but the salad had pre-mixed homemade croutons (menu didn't specify).
author: Tonja O.

description: Great open layout and staff are instantly welcoming if you want to share a glass with a friend or gather a large group. The happy hour drink list is standard and I only wish there was food as well.
author: Regina D.

description:
Busy, dark, but I liked it.  They have a good beer selection, excellent cocktails, and a random pool table in the back that you can fight with people over.  HAHA, well, I didn't fight, I just took.  But that's fine.

It has a great mix of gender and though very loud I could usually hear what my date was saying.  The atmosphere was fine for either a fine cocktail and witty banter, lots of drinking and loud conversation, or making out.  I might have done all of that.

Thumbs up.  I'd come back.
author: Frank W.

description:
This is one of my favorite bars in the city. It has that mix of great laid back ambiance, inventive drinks, and a mixed crowd that you strive to find everywhere in sf. 

drinks:
The have a scroll up on the wall with all their available drinks - most of them invented cocktails. I've tried silk road (decent) , batida (interesting use of coconut milk, tasty, definitely didn't taste the alcohol), and root of all evil (its scotch, so.. yeah. possibly a little weak though). I also tried their blueberry infused vodka which I'm pretty sure they make in-house - yummy with some soda water. They have these little jars with their oak-aged alcohol which they use in some of their cocktails - i want to try next time! 
The bartenders are really knowledgeable and friendly - they can make almost anything you want. Also, during happy hour (5-8PM weekdays), they have cheap well drinks! 

other:
It can get pretty crowded in there, but it's definitely got a friendly vibe. Because its located at church and market it really has that mixed crowd of people venturing away form downtown and also those coming down from castro. Theres several tables against the wall and some tables towards the back. I always think this is a great place to start your night off of drinking because you can either head to the castro or the mission to continue. 

writing this review made me want to go there tonight!
author: Tim B.

description:
Blackbird is the new darling bar of the Castro (even though it has been opened for awhile). They have a very loyal following. The atmosphere is nice and casual; the bar gets super packed on Friday and Saturday nights. Their gourmet cocktails are fantastic even though it sometimes slow down the bar because they take quite a few steps to make. The bartenders are generally friendly and quite efficient. I wouldn't recommend taking a date to the Castro but if you do, I think Blackbird would be your safest bet. Two downsides: the bathrooms need to be expanded and often boasts long lines and the bar needs to start taking credit cards. If Trigger can do it, Blackbird can step up and provide the same service.

By the way, I rang in 2010 here with my friends, and we had a great time!

~A
author: Alex C.

description: When I'm in the area and hunting for an adult drink, I come here.  Try something new and describe a flavor profile you enjoy to the bartenders and watch them perform their mixology and magic.
author: Brett D.

description: Great service.  Good selection of draft beer- local and regional, and plenty of specialty cocktails. Ambiance is perfect and it never seems to get too crowded. Only problem- no credit cards are accepted although I hear they're changing that soon.
author: J R.

description:
Blackbird is, without a doubt, one of my favorite bars in San Francisco. 

Unfortunately, it seems to be everyone else's favorite bar in San Francisco, given the crush of people here on a weekend night. 

I'll give you a quick rundown, though it's hard to have specifics since the drink menu changes seasonally (which should itself be a big plus). 

- Seriously delicious cocktails, crafted with care, at relatively reasonable prices ($8-12). 
- Fun crowd. I'd say it used to be pretty mixed, but has gotten gayer since Churchill opened up. Once it hits a certain critical mass of gayness, the straight guys feel uncomfortable and the straight ladies follow them. So yeah, pretty gay, at least on Fridays and Saturdays. 
- Decor is cool. 
- Great bartenders with off-menu drinks. I regularly order a rye old fashioned, and they do a bang-up job of it. 
- Sometimes the bartenders have a bit of attitude, to be honest. 
- CASH ONLY. Sadly. 
- Very busy on Fridays and Saturdays, though clears out around midnight as people leave for dance-type places. Come early to get a table, or come late to avoid the crowds. 

Love Blackbird.
author: Tom P.

description:
Blackbird is an upscale neighborhood bar that's very popular on the weekends.  Though not so popular that you can't find room to sit/stand and have a drink comfortably.  The crowd kind of ebbs and flows as people bar hop in the Castro or get a bite to eat.  It's a Castro crowd, but being so close to Church St it's more a mix of hipster gay, hip gay, mission hipster, Noe single gal.  The cocktails are pretty good but hit or miss.  I found all the sour cocktails to be very pleasant.

Farmer's Daughter - very nice, sour lemon, not too sweet, refreshing

Ghost Ship - also very nice, green tea flavor, not too sweet

The Temptress - universally panned by the entire group of 6, taste was reminiscent of cough syrup, finished as a shot divided among two people as no one wanted to drink it but didn't want it to go to waste either

The Chieftain - overwhelming taste of smoke, like drinking a camp fire, not balanced out by other flavors

Where There's Smoke There's Fire - a light smoky flavor, not as intense as The Chieftain, followed by medium heat, interesting but not terribly satisfying

Given that I disliked many of the cocktails on the current menu, I'll probably wait for it to change before revisiting.
author: Jean K.

description:
This place used to be great; it did. I hate to be dramatic, but who are they putting behind the bar these days? Had not been there in years and would usually go with a couple of other 30/40 something gay pals and enjoy the warm unpretentious vibe and great drinks. Last night on September 27 at 7PM, it felt like the twilight zone- think more pretentious LA and lets just say more like a  northern neighborhood of SF starting with letter "M" than the middle of the Castro, where everyone is welcome.

First, we sat at a mostly empty bar and the "I am better than you because I am wearing a plaid shirt and I have tattoos" pissed-off looking bartender (..you know the kind of guy I mean) promptly told us to move or we would be blocking the way (blocking whom, one may ask? The bar was almost empty) He then ignored us for whatever time it took for him to feel important...asked us what we wanted to drink and unceremoniously, with absolutely no eye contact, just about threw the drink at us (figuratively speaking, not literally).My friend visiting commented on how aggressive and dismissive his energy was. Maybe LA, maybe NY...but was this San Francisco?

All this could have almost been ingored were it not that a string of young scantily clad ladies and perhaps some of his "homies" came in shortly after for whom the rules of not sitting at a certain spot in the bar suddenly didn't apply and he was all smiles , flirts and welcoming gestures; allmost an exaggerated opposite response he had to me and my friend.  If you are looking for the kind of hyper masculine or maybe just hyper a--hole, exclusive vibe sadly invading San Francisco (and yes, even the Castro), this is the place. Having lived here for 11 years, I actually was saddened and embarassed to bring my guest here...we could have been anywere in the US, certainly not in San Francisco.

I am polite, very well educated, and my momma taught me to say please and thankyou, and never to judge anyone. I dress well and don't have bad breath, but it was clear: I definitely was not welcome here, at least by this guy's rules.  My history teaches me, when I feel unwelcome socially, that's what's actually happening. I could make this about all kinds of discrimination but I wont, maybe this was just a bad bartender. I was not welcome at Blackbird this night.

Blackbird, get a grip
author: Mischa M.

description:
Blackbird was on my "to do" list, and it did it - in moderation. Of course, there was an immense amount of pressure to sample one of their many cocktails, and I chose a bitters-heavy version of an orange crush. Not disappointed in the Grantia, but I'll never order it again...maybe my senses are not refined enough (highly unlikely), but the combination of flavors was a little too heavy for my liking.

Their BEER selection was on point - I experienced the Coney Island Albino Python White Lager and was totally floored....how I never located/experienced this lovely beer back on the East coast, I'm unsure, but it's my new favorite. 

The staff was friendly and patient and the crowd, a late-20's early-30's bunch, all seemed to be enjoying their time. Next go around I'll make it a point to to grab a round of pool at the table in the back.
author: Liz W.

description: Craft cocktails maybe-ish. Had the Improved Japanese cocktail. Nihon whiskey with a lime finish. 3.5/5.  To order again.... Maybe. The group liked their cocktails: an orange citrus cocktail and some piña colada drink in a coconut cup (not so sure what the names of these drinks were). This place was packed earlier in the evening.  Chill location.  Would probably return if we're in the area.
author: Vivial S.

description: One of the cool spots I like to go in Castro. Great vibe, dim lights and moody decor, tasty and unique cocktail menu... Can get a little crowded but it adds up to the atmosphere.
author: Olivia M.

description:
Oh hey, just another fruit fly on the wall, chiming in to say you're fly, BB.

Admittedly, I've only been once, but have been wanting to go back.  Why, you ask?  FOR THE PICKLED CARROTS.  I loved mine in my bloody mary (which was good and reasonably priced)... so much so I went to the bar and asked for more.  WHICH THEY BEQUEATHED ME.  (FTR, I think it was a good looking Black Bird who did this, but I can't be sure.)  No, I know, right?  That's amazing.  (The carrot generosity that is, not my slightly racial undertones.)

The only reason I don't ever end up back here is because Lucky 13 is a stone's throw away (the best kind of throw), and their bloodies are (a) better, (b) cheaper, (c) accompanied by free popcorn and a patio.  Not really a competition.  But regardless, still want to come back here for more carrots.  Every time I get a bloody in a new place in the city, I dream they'll serve it with a carrot, just like BB did way back when.

And if my memory serves me correct(ly?), the ladies bathroom is big enough to do cartwheels in.  Hi, hello.  I love spacious bathrooms.  You should too.
author: Keeks K.

description:
This review is in response to the ass hat bartender who recently made me rethink whether or not I want to continue living in this city or not.
I came in around 8 on a weekday evening and ordered the only "cocktail" I drink; a tequila gimlet.  I'm not into the recent cocktail scene and keep my drink orders simple and minimal.  Anyway, the first bartender made my drink (which I order with a splash of soda) and it was great.  When I ordered my next drink the dickish bartender I spoke of earlier says to me "you mean a margarita" lol....I explained what I wanted again, this time telling him some bartenders use a bit of agave, but no, a tequila gimlet is NOT A MARGARITA. We exchanged words and he finally made me a drink that was not a gimlet but I drank anyways because I didn't want to deal with any more attitude.  This has actually happened to me a couple of other times, and I have recently clarified with bartenders elsewhere. I think the recent cocktail scene has confused people a bit.
Cut it with the attitude....I don't bring it and a bartender certainly shouldn't.
I gave the place 3 stars because I used to like it and the first bartender made a drink any bartender should know how to make and had no problem with me nicely telling her how to make it since this is a common problem I'm having....otherwise it would be 1.
By the way, the only places that aren't confused by me ordering a tequila gimlet are bars that have old school bartenders and patrons that don't need a menu to order a drink!
author: anne o.

description:
smack in the heart of castro this is a gem amongst the surrounding competition. the interior decor is humble yet elegant giving off a very intimate vibe. i like the way the seating is arranged. you can get real comfortable in their plush leather couches. the bartender made me a special spicy watermelon margarita during my last visit. i really appreciated the accommodating efforts. great selection of beers and a good variety of happy hour options. great spot to explore delicious cocktails. don't forget to check out the pool table and photo booth in the back!! i played 4 games on that pool table, great times! :D

CASH ONLY! there's an atm in the back.
author: Hang N.

description:
Love thy neighbor.

Or at least, have a drink with them.

And when your neighbor is Blackbird, a mixed gay-straight crowd just trying to have a good time and not ruffle anyone's feathers with a few attractive blokes slinging behind the bar, you love thy neighbor. Maybe a little too much some times. 

This isn't a one way street either, they do you right. Friendly, even when busy, and making that cocktail perfect. Really. They have dumped and remade drinks for fear something was floating in it (even though it was a shred of a mint leaf, likely) and gave no grief when they misheard the order and made the wrong drink. They corrected it without batting an eye.

Cocktail not your thing? Variety of solid beers and wines as well as bevvies for your sober friends.

Rotating cocktail menu (including a couple cask/barrel-aged options) keeps me coming back. Bring friends. Bring dates. Bring a neighbor. And show some love.
author: Alissa A.

description: The drinks were very tasty. Beware to those who don't have refined taste buds. These are carefully crafted drinks which contains bitters and ingredients not popularly used. I do however wish that they have a better selection of IPAs.
author: Gary I.

description: Had the Diablo and No Sleep til Brooklyn.  Quick service, drinks were slight twists on classics.  Easy to snag seats at the bar at 5 pm on a Friday, but on the way in, saw several placards reserving the larger tables up front, started to get crowded on our way out before 6.  Wouldn't mind coming back to take full advantage of their happy hour specials next time.
author: Audrey L.

description:
A great neighborhood bar. Keep the tourists away!

Mixed crowd of fashionable gay boys, straight women and people from the neighborhood. Their cocktail selection is better than their wine, so try a stiff, old fashioned drink when you're here.

Also has a great pool table and photo booth in the back.

They only take cash, but there is an ATM in the back as well.
author: Spoon G.

description: Best bar in the city hands down!! Every drink is made with unadulterated passion!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
One of my biggest hobbies is mixing high end cocktails in my apartment, and I take it very seriously.  Because of that, I'm VERY skeptical of bartenders that fuck up drinks.

This place passes my test with flying colors!  The bartenders both do a GREAT job.  They did the little things right.  Shook the right drinks, stirred the right drinks.  Added ice etc at the right time.  And the bar has all the right glassware for drinks to be in the proper vessel for them.

Some cool cocktails they've made up, and the "gypsy tears" was my favorite.  I'm normally not a big fan of loud bars, but I would go back to this place in a heartbeat!

Well done!
author: Chris A.

description:
Edit: 02/03/2012

I won't post Shawn Vergara's (Blackbird Proprietor) email publicly, but I do want to say that my "one star" has moved to a "three star" because of it.

This bartender has been suspended "for being overly aggressive" (Shawn's words) and will remain on probation when he returns. He was probably having a bad day, but that's no excuse for the behavior we experienced that night. I do hope his behavior changes; I know his behavior doesn't represent everyone working at Blackbird.

I do believe this was an isolated case. I also believe that Shawn is truly concerned about our experience at Blackbird, and that he has acted to ensure that your experience continues to be good.

I'll give Blackbird another try, and the drinks--at least three more tries!

-----
A respected bar turned sour tonight as a group of people were physically assaulted and kicked out by the bouncer at 1:40 AM on a Sunday morning.

Sounds typical, since most have had a lot to drink by that time. But there's no excuse for treating people this way. I understand how bartenders and bouncers had a hard time all night and simply want to go home. But not at the expense of people they just served.

I witnessed an innocent woman being forced out by some "bouncer," pushed backwards through the doors with both hands at 1:45 AM. That kind of treatment after spending a lot of cash (they don't take CC's) on drinks and tips for these owners and employees. Only to be treated like crap at a time they felt like closing.

I also witnessed a few people with iPhones recording things from the sidewalk, and then the bouncer stepped away from one argument (woman pushed out) to starting another by physically grabbing phones. These are customers, not criminals. All they wanted was last call politely. Not with violence and rudeness.

I won't ever return to Blackbird. Plenty of other bars around the city to try. If this is the way they treat people at the end of the night, what's more in the meantime? There's no way I'll return to this offensive place. No thanks.
author: Kevin D.

description:
Met my cuz here while I was visiting town.
Dark atmosphere with a full stock of every premium alcohol from around to world.
Not a dive but a classy place. CASH ONLY.
I sat up at the bar while waiting for him and was greeted promptly by the bartender. 
I ordered a yummy oatmeal stout even though their choices of well named speciality cocktails looked divine!
Upon his arrival he ordered a drink called The Inlaws and it looked very good. 
After a few minutes of visiting the place filled up!
This place is located at a stop where all Muni lines go. Very convenient walk up maybe a block and your there!
It's gets VERY loud in here around 10pm and we were there on a Thursday night.
They have plenty of back and front area seating but if you sit near the back end up at the bar, be prepared to have drinks quizzing between your conversation :) 
I like this place a lot. If I lived in the area I would be one of their locals.
author: Elizabeth B.

description:
Yes, Home Restaurant in SF is closed...sadly, you can no longer drink at home!

As such, if you're looking for a cool neighborhood bar in the area with artisanal drinks...Blackbird is a great place to hang.  Popped in here for a bit this evening and had the nicest time hanging out and exploring their extensive and most unique cocktail menu.  The bartender was so cool...didn't get his name, but I'm sure i will next time.  Had a gin based drink called the Bayonet with brandied cherries and unlike what the name implies, I didn't get skewered or mortally wounded.  LOL...would have stayed longer, but I knew that there were bars to be hit and drinks to be drunk...yes, my dementia father is driving me up the wall and I needed a brief  escape.

As all my good friends on Yelp know, I love birds...how could I not love a place to imbibe with a bird theme called Blackbird? :)  Fantastic place and also just walking distance from Lucky 13 which is within stumbling distance for when you want to explore the darker side of barhopping.  In a crazy way, the two complement each other perfectly.  As always, I am eclectic and refuse to change.
author: Roy N.

description:
Still my favorite bar in the area. Beginners should start with a Slurpee. It's not on the menu, but it tastes like a slurpee and comes with a special straw. Some of the specialty drinks are a little too fancy for my tastes, but I enjoy trying a new concoction every time.

Quality drinks. Chill crowd. Two thumbs up.
author: James T.

description: Drinks are good here, selection of both beer and whiskey looks decent, and they have a nice little pool table in the back. The interior is nice, and it looks like a place I'd go to spend lots of money on alki. But it's cash-only, which severely limited me (2 rounds of drinks with 2 other friends); drinks are around $6-7 for beers and $9-10 for liquor, so remember to bring enough cash.
author: Ryan D.

description:
pretty doucey, no real hipsters would be caught dead there.  Lame staff

overall, crappy.

hugz n stuff,

P
author: Pammy S.

description:
