Blackbird is definitely a cool bar but I'm surprised that it has 4.5 stars. 4.5 is hard to achieve!

I came in here with my brother and some other guys. A lot of the guys in the bar seemed to be gay which is fun and totally makes sense for the Castro. I loved the cool, cartoony artwork on the walls so much that I asked the bartender if they were for sale. They were but for well over $1000!

My brother picked out his favorite kind of alcohol (it's something I can't remember the name of, fruit flavored and yummy!) and the bartender created a delicious concoction with it. I later had a good well beer (great selection!).

The bar has a pretty classy interior with nice furniture to sit on. I'm not usually in this area but might drop back in sometime!
author: Meghan P.

description: Good spot for a drink, if you get there early. Getting the barkeep's attention can be difficult, as many of their drinks are labor intensive.
author: Jess W.

description:
Had cocktails here last night and was really impressed. The house created cocktail list is very creative and has some unique ingredients. The assortment of flavors and occasional use of spices is surprising and delicious. Many of the drinks my group tried we're refreshing. The thing that surprised me the most was the unique combination of flavors. I had the Fortunato. 
The atmosphere is really great, low lit room with a good amount of space and creative use of booth seats. The art on display right now is beautiful, my favorite was this immense San Fran skyline that alone is worth the stop. 
The drink times are a bit slow but for me this is a positive. The type of drinks they're crafting take time to make properly. Each drink has the individual attention of the bartender. It may take a few extra minutes to get your drink out but it's well worth the wait. 
A few other positives: amazing selection of spirits, good location to public transit, and a photo booth.
author: Silas F.

description:
Blackbird is my favorite bar in San Francisco. I spent New Year's here with my sister and her boyfriend and trust me, there's no better place to ring in 2013 than in the dimly lit and raucous atmosphere here. It's definitely a good mix of gays and straights here so no one is too left out. 

Yes, its cash only, so make sure to plan accordingly. But those cocktails...oof so strong and of such a great quality. I make sure to tip a little more here because you can just tell there's a lot of effort and care put in these drinks that you can't really get anywhere else.
author: Tony H.

description: God bless Blackbird, the proprietor Shawn, and the entire staff. I threw my husband's surprise birthday party here on Friday night, and couldn't have asked for a better experience. Shawn was super accommodating and easy to work with, and the staff took fantastic care of us - set out beers, picked up empties, didn't get annoyed when our group kept blocking the staff door, etc. It became crowded later in the evening but even then, we barely had to wait to get drinks. The bartenders must be magicians. And good crowd, everyone was friendly and easygoing. I can't say enough good things. Thank you Blackbird!
author: Shauna B.

description:
Damn, this place ROCKS.

My friend and I are on a mission to find the best negroni in the city. I'm pretty sure we hit the best right off the bat! The bartender was amazing (man... I wish I wasn't so flighty on names...) and let us know about all the best ingredients. Gin, Campari and vermouth with a little orange zest.... simple right? Not really.... Apparently, he's a fan of the negroni, too so he filled us in on what he thinks makes the best negroni which I found to be very educational. Which led us to trying several different types of negroni to determine which we liked best... and we did find a winner.

Beyond the awesome negroni and bartender, this place is really nicely decorated inside with red leather seats, white walls, and cool art on the walls. I really enjoyed being there. It was open enough (tall ceilings!) that even with a bunch of people, it didn't feel stuffy which is important if you're like me and hate crowds.

On thing I can say is that I will be back to try the Apple Cart (Applejack, rose vermouth, cassis, lemon and lavendar) because that just sounds A-MAZING but didn't sound like it went too well with the negroni feast we were having! Returning is a necessity!
author: Amy B.

description:
*fancy fun drinks with a fun atmosphere*
#oldfashionedcherry

I enjoyed this place for the drink it had. They had a unique twist on an old fashioned with a muddled cherry as opposed to a sugar cube. It was tasty, lively atmosphere with a nice pool table in the back with good seating all around. Will be sure to check out some other drinks when I'm in the area. 

CASH ONLY!
author: Kevin T.

description:
I like Blackbird for all kinds of reasons: It's queer - like, really, super queer. That's awesome. The set-up inside has all kinds of seating and standing options. They have a pool table (I don't watch the hot dapper people of San Francisco take shots, I have no idea what you're talking about). Awesome riding distance from my house. 

It's also sometimes difficult being at Blackbird: The awesomeness makes it sometimes very crowded - like, elbow nudging crowded. Their cocktails can be really sweet and a bit pricy. I like serious, old school style where I can taste what's in the drink. They have a touch of that style, too. San Francisco bars are typically really good at this (yet another reason I heart this city hardcore). The crowded makes for hard hearing when socializing. The pool table's nice to look at, but good luck ever getting to it, because, ya know, there's one. 

Weekday neighborhood bar?! YES! Thursday-Sunday or sometimes just later at night? OOF. Roll in with a crew or roll in early. And then, let's drink something tasty!
author: Shannon F.

description: Really excellent cocktails. The space is large enough to accommodate groups but still intimate. Will definitely be back.
author: Hana T.

description:
For me, one of my most favourite things to do is to walk up to a bartender and say, "I like gin and citrus." When their eyes sparkle and they start to muddle, I know I'm going to have myself a fantastic cocktail experience. Okay, so maybe I knew that just based on their cocktail program, the bitters on the bar and the "mists" of scotch just waiting to adorn a tall glass.  

The space is dark, long and narrow with enough background noise to feel like a bar, but not so much that you have to guess what someone next to you is talking about. And if you station yourself near the door, you're bound to meet a new friend or two as they leave their drinks to step outside for smokes. 

In case you're wondering what my drink creation was... it was "The Last Word" and it was deliciously balanced. End stop. 

6/30: 30 Day Challenge
author: Crystal H.

description: Good beer menu, unique cocktail menu, good happy hour, dim, dark and classy joint. Pool table in the back.
author: Will D.

description: Very nice decor, this place has a really down to earth feel with an awesome feel, met great people, bar tenders sexy as well mix bomb drinks!
author: Dannie F.

description:
Probably my favorite bar in SF. Great bloody mary's and original cocktails. Not too crowded during the happy hour and very nice atmosphere.
There even is a pool table and a photo booth in the back.

The happy hour has $3 well drinks and a great choice of beers on tap that are pretty cheap.

Cash only (but there is an ATM in the back).
author: Nathan B.

description:
I got to try Blackbird with my French Group recently and I had the best time.  The drinks are delicious and the atmosphere is nice.  I really enjoyed the cocktails their bar masters whipped up for us.

Cons: The bar was rather slow at getting the drinks out and it was VERY crowded.  Also, they were out of some of the food I wanted to order which I thought was odd at 7 PM on a Tuesday.
author: Amy P.

description:
This place is cute inside and very hip. However, I hate crowds so take my review with that into account, I didn't like how packed this place was. It was almost as worse as Q-bar. I hate establishments that ignore fire code. haha.

Anyway, the drinks are good and the guys who come here are particularly hot. So, I might come back for the eye candy.  (c;
author: Rylan C.

description:
I was here for a happy hour event on Thursday. The warm wood paneling and windows add to the street.  I loved the decor of the bar. I loved the long row couch that lines the wall in front of the bar. The offer a great selection on tap and an eclectic full bar. 

 I like the amount of people at this event . The bar wasn't too rushed. One could move and not spill a drink.  I imagine the pool table can be moved and that space would be the dance floor.  

The proximity to Church street station MUNI is an added bonus.  I can see myself back here.
author: Infodiva B.

description: delicious bar bites (smoked trout, olives, bourbon onion), solid drinks, and always a great mix if people. happy hours are a great deal for the area (especially the $5 sours, 5-6 vino). tricky with a group larger than 4 unless you get there at 5 p.m. but not impossible.
author: Mike V.

description: Drinks are overrated here.
author: Jess C.

description: Drinks worth trying here are their tiger's tale, Bayonet, and bloody mary. YUM. The tiger's tale has ginger beer in it so it's definitely sweeter, but the Bayonet is a mixture of sweet, fruity, and bitter. SOOOO good. Super complex. Definitely a quality cocktail. Their bloody mary is spicy and served with a huge stalk of celery, olives, and a pearl onion. It's like eating a savory meal and it's kind of filling like one too.  The first drink I had here was actually the hopscotch, and I didn't care for it. Another MUST try is their leather-bound book which isn't on their menu. I don't know if it is a secret cocktail or what not, but I told the bartender I've only had one good old fashion in my life and so he whipped me up a leatherbound book and sent me off. This drink was super smooth, super balanced, and it will eff you up!
author: Alesia T.

description: My second time at this bar, had more than one hour to enjoy their atmosphere. This time there were more than one other couple here. We enjoyed their Pimms cup, had more than two each, our second round, Nathan - amazing bartender by the way, recommended we try a fresh mix of the drink rather than their mix on tap. Amazing idea, he was incredibly attentive and personable. Really great guy honestly. The bar had an amazing atmosphere even though it seemed a darker, more sulkier bar in the Castro it has this sort of close feeling to it. Anyhow, I've loved this bar and will absolutely be coming back to try more of their crazy concoctions!
author: Timmey E.

description: Walking down this long and narrow bar, you will find yourself rewarded by a pool table and restrooms in the back. It's a nice table too, not your standard green felt. The decor is nice as well, very contemporary, but integrating wooden panel ceilings and wooden stumps as coffee tables. The bad thing is that those textured stumps are not the best thing to put your drinks down on. The menu is posted big and high on the wall next to the bar so you are clear about their offerings, though maybe they can whip up what you want too. There's a bunch of house cocktails and some wines. There is a good number of beers on tap, but all pretty standard fare and they do not rotate. There is one abbey ale that I haven't tried, the Brother Thelonious. I liked it fine. Prices are decent.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
A very cool bar that I definitely will be going back to.

The décor and vibe were great - a perfect spot for socializing.  Unlike most of the other places in the area, some thought actually went into the design and they did a great job.

I think I found a new favorite!
author: Ken G.

description:
"This cocktail is delicious!"
"What!?!"
"I said, 'This cocktail is delicious!""
"Oh, yes, the decor is very beautiful!"
"What!?!"
"I agree, this is a beautiful space!"
"Are you saying you want to go someplace else!?!"
"What did you say!?!"
"If you want to stay, that's fine.  The cocktails *are* delicious!"
"I can't hear you!"
"What!?!"
"Never mind;  I'm going to get more pretzels!"
author: Eric L.

description: Always a good spot for a good drink.  They open up at 3, but happy hour doesn't start till 5pm, so plan accordingly.
author: Dilly M.

description: Amaaaaaazing cocktails and has a nice, casual ambiance.  This is a good place to take a first/2nd date if you actually want to talk to them and hear them.  They have some pretty awesome drink names.  I had the Hanami and my date had the Rye N Gosling... dawwwww.
author: Terry K.

description: Great bartenders, great recommendations, great drinks, cool venue setup. What more can you ask for in a bar? Just know they don't take credit cards or that could be a detriment.
author: Kyle D.

description:
Great place for imbibers with adventurous palates.  This bar feels slightly upscale compared to most of  the bars in the Castro.  From its old tyme print of a formally dressed blackbird to a bar design that hearkens back to the last century this bar is calling us back to a time before mixed drinks were simply fruit juice and vodka not that there is anything wrong with that but there is so much more to explore.

The bartenders seasonal drinks are sometimes challenging but they show a willingness to use exotic bitters, spirits and mixing ingredients.  From flips and fizzes to more standard martini like drinks.  The bartenders are very friendly and knowledgable.  It's worth showing up on a slow night to chat mixology with them.  They can continually come up with great concoctions and mix classic cocktails with deftness.

One of my favorite bars in San Francisco, a city lousy with first rate bars.
author: Don P.

description: I love love love this place whenever I'm in the Castro this is usually the place I hit up.  They change their drink list ever so often but it's never a miss.  Always love their specialty cocktails, I should come back soon...
author: Darren N.

description: If your looking to a relaxing night with a good crowd of people lookno further than Blackbird. They have amazing drink menu that never seems to disappointment me and it isn't too pricey. It can get fairly crowded so if you scored yourself a seat or a stool better not get up as they are a hot commodity here. Of your in the neighborhood check it out I promise it will not disappoint.
author: Matthew L.

description:
A whole mess of unique cocktails, painstakingly mixed at the bar.
Several nice beers on draught.
$3 Happy Hour.
Went on an early weeknight.  Nice crowd:  lively but not boisterous.  Good mix all around, with tendency toward younger gay professional.
author: Ken B.

description: I've always had good experiences here.  The bartenders work fast to deliver the requested drink(s).  Drinks can be a little pricey, but it's a better experience overall.  The bar is cool, the crowd is good looking, and they usually play cool music too.  It seems to be a gay bar, but straights can come here too and feel comfortable b/c there's usually a fair amount of women here.  They have a pool table in back, but I don't use it.  It's really not the place to play pool.
author: Shaun W.

description:
Do you love handmade drinks that are all sorts of yummy? Like, melt-in-your-mouth tastiness that is tested and perfected for your taste bud pleasures? Then, if you've not done so yet, you should check out Blackbird. There drinks are always top notch quality, and you'll enjoy sampling each and every one. They even have the drink menus change, so you can always try something new. 

It could easily be a 5-star place, but there are only a few problems that I've always run into. 

Now, everyone knows that when something is good, everyone will eventually find out about it and overwhelm it. Unfortunately, that's the case with this bar. The first is that this place is crazy busy all the time. 9 times out of 10, you'll find yourself waiting in line to get in. Sometimes it can be pretty fast, but you should be prepared to wait about 5 of 10 minutes. Once you get inside, you'll see that the place is packed and that you'll be waiting in line again for your drink. If you find something on the menu that sounds yummy, there's a definite chance that the wait will be worth it. Just be sure to watch those around you. You'll most likely run into people who will maybe jump in front of you. Just keep those elbows ready to push them back. :)

The second issue is that, every now-and-then, I run into a rude bartender. It seems that they have a bad day, or just don't completely understand good customer service. They either help everyone else around you without even glancing at you, or they help you but with a bad attitude.

I'd suggest visiting them, and perhaps trying it out a little early in the night to avoid the crazy mob scene.
author: Nicolas H.

description:
A real favorite soured by a bad bartender.

This place is great and makes fantastic drinks, but stay away from Diane the bartender. She'll steal your money. 

She shortchanged me and my friends on more than one occasion. I called her out on it and literally made her count my change, and sure enough, it was short. She pockets your cash, assuming you're some dumb drunk who isn't going to count their change. Call me cheap, but I do. I asked to speak to a manager about it, and another employee told me there was no manager - "they're all managers together." Which sounded like he was just covering his friend's behind.

Anyway, this place used to be a fave, but not anymore. Good ambiance and great cocktails, but watch your wallet!
author: Cee D.

description:
First time at this week and a half old bar and I was wowed! Aside from the fact that it was a pool table, it's perfect for me.

Location: The best of locations, right on Church and Market and accessible to anyone and everyone using any means of transportation. And most importantly, walking distance for me.

Space: Beautiful, hip decor. I like the fact that they hide the pool table, because, seriously, pool tables at bars are unsightly. There's newspaper wallpaper, exposed lightbulbs, a beautiful bar, and red accents all throughout to illuminate the otherwise dark bar. I love the seating styles and the front of the bar, from the outside, looks pretty nice.

Ambiance: A good, diverse crowd. Everyone was friendly enough. There were a good amount of homos, lesbos, people of color, white folk, men, women, young, old (I'm not kidding) and specially, beautiful people--almost as if it were planned. I don't remember the music though...

Service: Great service! Specially Nancy, she was great. Attentive, fair with prices, took suggestions gracefully and knew her stuff. She made some great suggestions that worked out splendidly.

Food/Drink: Great drinks! Sure, specially because I know exactly how I live my cocktails and the bartenders followed my instructions quite diligently and put some great insight and suggestions of their own. We had a Manhattan, a Cosmopolitan and a Vesper. They have Lillet Blanc and actually use Cointreau for the cosmos! You can't ask for much more. And most importantly, it's cheap!

Overall: After a tragic experience at my favorite bar, Amber, this is probably heading to be my new favorite bar. Great service, great ambience, beautiful and well thought-out space and, most importantly, great drinks.
author: SF N.

description:
this place is amazing. like most of the mission, castro, and duboce area, it is now overrun by folks who would not have been in these areas 5 or even 3 years ago. 

if you go in on a 'regulars' night, you can get quick and delish drinks, have your choice of comfy spots, and enjoy the environs.
author: Simi J.

description:
This place is good for scenery but the drinks are junk. You have to give a place credit for experimenting and they surely do. The last two seasons, the drinks always taste like cherry cough syrup with turpentine or cherry cough syrup and whisky or any other combination. They're gross. At a moderate price, I would like my 9 dollars to get something I enjoy.  Since this is a local watering hole of a crowd I like, I hope things improve when the menu changes next season.

They might be up to your tastes or order a standard cocktail and be treated to "handy" work from the bartender and fresh juices.  Obviously they care and I've got to give a place credit for that.  You can't go wrong with their beer selection.
author: Sean H.

description:
I travel a ton for work and appreciate finding a great cocktail bar.  This was the place for me.  Warm interior vibe mixed with a fantastic beverage.  I'm a classic cocktail fan and they mixed me up a wonderful Sazerac.  Both bartenders, I believe on was Chris made me a drink and they were both amazing.   

I suggest this for anyone who knows good drinks and understands what it is to be a liquor liker!
author: Brian B.

description:
I'm rating Blackbird strictly on their cocktails (the hipster/gay scene isn't my scene in particular but it's in the Castro...so, I expected the same). We didn't wait long for the bartenders to notice us even though I would view the place as crowded. I ordered Pimm's Cup and my fiance the Bullfight. Mine was okay, though there was an excess of ice. The Bullfighter was okay as well, but it really did not require a salted rim. 
(*That's what she said*)
author: Cat S.

description:
I like this bar.
It is one of those new bars where it's sort of hipster-classy with that rustic wood interior and very large drink menu that is handwritten onto a huge piece of meat-wrap-type paper, hanging on the wall. 

They know their drinks and, unlike other hipster(ish) bars, they have good customer service that is fair to all standing, waiting to order. 

As a bourbon drinker, i was pleased that they use Four Roses as their primary bourbon. The variety of drinks is great and it is always appreciated when you get good cocktails sans snobbiness.
author: Min M.

description:
I'll make it short.
If you're a 20 something and love loud bars with interesting drinks, check it out.
They have an interesting menu that changes, with twists on classics as well.
I have been a mixologist and on the mat for 10 years. 
I've never met such arrogant, haughty tenders in my career ; to the point where I will probably not return.
If you are actually interested in cocktails, their history, origins and their stories, or at least the differences or evolution - go somewhere else - the attitude is worse than the noise.

If you're the owner / time for some house-cleaning.

"in the beginners mind, there are a myriad of possibilities, in the experts mind there are few"
-Suzuki Roshi
author: John J.

description:
I've been meaning to write a review about Blackbird for some time now.  Having been there many times (and having always had positive experiences), I opted to plan a birthday party there for several friends last month.  The owner was exceptionally friendly and helpful in planning it, blocked off a section of the bar for us (even though it was a busy Friday night), and even made the effort to come check with us during the event that everyone was happy.  I was very pleasantly surprised by how friendly and helpful he was.   

Of course, what people most care about when they go to a bar like this is that the cocktails are well made, the ingredients are of a high quality, and that they are served without serious attitude.  Blackbird passes all these tests and more. Fantastic drinks, friendly bartenders, nice atmosphere, and just all an around nice, mixed crowd.  This has easily become one of my favorite places for cocktails this year.
author: SL N.

description: My favorite bar. Stiff, well-made drinks in a boozily low-lit space. Grown-up and casual. The bartenders know their stuff, and treat people right. I'm always satisfied with my Old Fashioneds. Only downside for me: Cash only.
author: Kent L.

description:
I came here with Mointhe415 on a Sunday evening for a quick beer. We were going to meet at Lucky13 but this place looked very inviting. I asked for an Anchor and she had the Bloody Mary.

This is a great bar with a wonderful vibe. The bartender was a really nice guy and made us feel very welcome. I know that next time I'm in this part of town I'll be back. I do feel that I was over dressed though and will keep that in mind next time I'm thinking of dropping in but I'm not going to make this a destination location. I did by default order an Anchor and was saddened to see a bottle in front of me a second later. I have to deduct a star for any bar that doesn't have anchor on tap, I mean really. The Chipotle Bloody Mary was freaking incredible. I'll be back for the Bloody.

An extra star for the amazing bloody and minus one star for no anchor on tap.
author: Justin S.

description:
Great space. The drinks are really good. And, you cannot beat the $3 well drinks until 8pm. 

I will for sure go back to this spot.
author: Gina H.

description:
A true Castro staple, even if it's a bit off the beaten path!

Probably one of the most upscale, swank places in the Castro for sure, with creative mixed drinks that are priced pretty well. My two favorites are their Mint Julep, and their Rosemary's Fix (which I continuously miss-name Rosemary's Baby when I explain to friends and at the bar). Both drinks could be gone as their drink menu seems to change a bit over the year. 

They have a good pooltable in the back with booths where you can relax with groups of friends. The clientele is mid-20s up to 40s, mostly well-dressed. It's not only men, and I would say this place (on non-weekend nights) has a pretty good mixed crowd.

It's easily my go to place if I'm looking for a Castro bar without all of the hooplah of a rowdy night.
author: Mark T.

description:
Blackbird was amazing. The kind of bar you can always rely on to be decent. 
More of a sophisticated gay crowd than a typical night in Castro.

Vintage decor, sweet bartenders, great crowd.
author: JJ C.

description: I'm a big fan of Churchill around the corner, but thought I should try a new scene, and I'm glad I did! Blackbird was a quiet scene in the early afternoon when I was there, but I could see it easily packed on the weekend. The bartender knew everybody there, it seemed, and gave helpful advice on pairings to anyone he didn't. He recommended the Early Bird, which I was a fan of. I could see it being really easy to lose a whole afternoon in this place!
author: Kevin B.

description:
I'll be back.

Came in here for the sole purpose of trying their barrel-aged cocktails--yes, you read that correctly.

Barrel-aged Cocktail: a single serving of a large batch of a pre-mixed cocktail has been aged in a oak barrel for 5-6 weeks.  

We ordered both the Vieux Carré (Rye, Cognac, Sweet Vermouth, Benedictine and bitters) and the Rhum Negroni (Rhum JM Agricole, Campari, and Cocchi Americano).

The Vieux was incredibly drinkable, but as a barrel-aged cocktail virgin, the Rhum Negroni was simply eye-opening: silky, rounded,  with a tempered bitterness from the Campari.  Neither really tasted like cocktails as much as they did like delicious and mysterious nectars from the heavens.
author: Michael C.

description:
Blackbird has become the gold standard for happy hour drinks for me and the boi. In fact, we've taken to dropping in there early on Tuesday evenings for a seat at the bar and front row tickets to watching the bartenders shaking and stirring their hearts out. The boi takes full advantage of the $4 happy hour sours, and I have been slowly making my way through the bar menu and picking the brains of the very knowledgeable and approachable bartenders, who are always happy to concoct the cocktail of my dreams of the moment.

While it's much too crowded and loud for me later in the evenings and on weekend nights, it's downright cozy just as happy hour begins. 

Added bonuses are a pool table and a photo booth.
author: Alana D.

description:
Been here a couple times and they have amazing tasty drinks!  I would suggest coming here on a Thursday night instead of Friday since its not overly crowded.  Unless you don't mind bumping up to a few handsome men.

My favorite drink there so far is The Drifter which has white rye, aperol, maple syrup, lemon and egg white.  I'm not even sure what half those things are but together, its damn tasty.  The bartender was shaking the mixer like a Moroccan dancer.  So fun!
author: Nho C.

description: Found this gem while walking around he area and so glad we did. Cute little space with great cocktails and a pool table. It's more of a relaxed atmosphere than the other bars around and I love that.
author: Jamie L.

description: I agree with other reviewers, they make quality drinks and are very friendly!! I tried to make a reservation for New Year's Eve on line and they politely called a day or 2 before to inform me that they will not be able to take my reservations that night. I respect there honesty I can see they value their clients. FYI they didn't have a cover charge on NYE.. Who does that? Any bar jumps to the opportunity to take people's money especially on a holiday like NYE.  Great management!
author: Julieta C.

description:
I loved the ambiance of this place, but their drink menu has some really peculiar options.

Namely, the pressure drop... My friend accurately described it as, "It tastes like a band-aid!"  No way, I thought to myself... So I adventurously took a sip, and sure enough... it really did taste like a band-aid!

I will say the uber cool, and incredibly tense bartender who originally made this for us was great about swapping it out for the Rosemary fix which was so much better.  The Apple Cart was ok, but reminded me that I probably shouldn't be so adventurous with alcohol if I don' t know half the ingredients.  So the next drink , he made a great libation out of rum for me... no idea what was in it, but it was really tasty!

So A for ambiance, B- for drink menu, A for super intense but talented bartender, and A+ for being a group of cute girls in a gay bar where you don't get harassed by Creepy McCreepsters!
author: Regina B.

description: Cool vibe and sexy decor. One pool table in the back. Plenty of small tables, not comfortable to stand around so definitely try to get a table. Sour beer yum land.
author: Sonya Z.

description:
I had a very bad experience. I ordered a drink and when I paid I got the wrong change back. I know I am 100% sure because I only had $20 bills.
I asked the waitress to give me the rest of the change back and she denied. After a couple of sentences she told me that she would give me half of the change from her tips and she left without even looking at me.
We finished the drink with my friends and when we left she "ironically" said a "have a good night, guys", that was intended to make fun of the situation. 
I know I was right and she only agreed to pay me half of what I know she owned me. 
Talking to my friends, they've also told me they've had bad experiences.
I thought I needed to share.
I will not go there anymore.
author: Jordi S.

description:
A wonderful gourmet bar. The drinks are like recipes and cost a little extra, BUT they also have a great affordable happy hour for normal drinks. The crowd is mixed and gets PACKED so go early unless you like crowds. It is the place to be right now, but not pretentious.

The only thing is it takes FOREVER to get a crink when they are packed because the special drinks take a long time to make and they always seem under staffed.

So go early and grab a seat by the window and treat yourself to a special drink; they all rotate and I suggest being adventurous.

Another great thing about this bar is that now the Pilsner is often empty if you feel like going there and sitting outside :)
author: Aaron W.

description: My friend, who lives in San Fanciso, took me and two of my other friends here, one night. We sat at one of the tables to the left, when you walk in. My friend happens to know the owner, a nice guy. The place isn't large and it wasn't obnoxiously loud. I had the best drink ever, 'Nice Melons'... in fact, I ended up drinking 3 or 4 of them! So good. Loved the atmosphere!
author: Tiffiny H.

description:
I'd like this place more if it wasn't so damned crowded all the times.  I usually pass by this place when I'm wandering around the neighborhood at night.  The crowd is usually so big that I end up passing it by for Lucky 13 just down the street.

There's certainly a lot to like about this place though,  it's a great spot to play pool on a Sunday afternoon.  Friendly wait staff, cool interior, and great cocktails.
author: Bill H.

description:
When i wanna get a lil fancier than my dives.

Final Word when im drinking pinky up.  Black Butte Porter when im rockin the flannel.  (they have an amazing list of specialty cocktails and beers, im just a creature of habit)

True mixologists.
author: Juv C.

description:
After dinner at Catch, we decided to grab a drink at Blackbird. 7x7 frequently runs advertisements and short reviews about the place- so we figured why not.

I love the interior of Blackbird. There's just something about the way it feels that appeals to me. Upscale bar meets speakeasy meets dive. It's a great mesh of feelings.

I don't dig that the place is cash only. I mean, really? Who carries cash these days? They do have an ATM machine in the back- which charges $2.50 for withdrawal. 

Boyfriend ordered whiskey & coke- and I asked the bartender to surprise me with a tequilia-based drink. (I love me my tequila!) I'm not a huge fan of sweet, and told him so. I think he took that and ran with it- because the only thing I really ended up tasting in my drink was bitters. I had about two sips before I decided to give up on it.

The crowd is eclectic- but primarily gays and hipsters. I dug being out of my comfort zone and we met some great people at the table next to us.

I don't dig the height level of the tables- our knees were knocking in to them the whole time. It's kinda awkward seating.
author: Annalise F.

description: Yum! I loved this place! Great scene, fabulous drinks, awesome scene... I was entertained for hours by the people watching alone! The ambiance is pretty chill - quite hipster, if you will. Great music. Drinks were tasty and creative - delicious. Would definitely come back here... wish they took credit card though!
author: Christie M.

description:
So I write this review in disappointment.  I had been here one evening while waiting on some friends before dinner. The cocktail I had was excellent and service was friendly and polite. However I am writing this review as I feel like I have been ignored several times during a busy night. I've done everything in the bar etiquette book in hopes of ordering a drink without being an annoyance to the bartender. I was right on the bar between two seated patrons.  I waited a solid 30 minutes without even a look while the area in front of  him was getting served like crazy.  I had already tried earlier in the night with the same bartender but I was behind someone for about 15 minutes before he gave up so I gave up too.  Yet strangely my friend who was dressed slightly nicer than me walked up and was able to order our drinks with no issues.  He didn't wave money or yell the guy just noticed him.   The bottom line was I liked this bar at one time but this second adventure put a bad taste in my mouth enough to write this review.  I was disappointed because I really wanted to try his drinks and enjoy them because I liked the care he put into everyone.  But it's just hard to enjoy anything when one feels ignored.

As a follow up I was written to and received a very sincere apology regarding my experience.  I am always impressed by this and look forward to giving Blackbird another try.
author: Joco F.

description:
Great place to have a birthday party!!!!!!

Yep.  That's how much I adore Blackbird.  This bar can do no wrong.  In fact, it's *everything* that makes for a perfect cocktail lounge in my book.  If I lived in San Francisco, I'd be here every day of the week.  

me and my partner celebrate our birthday over there and it was perfect!!
great place to invite your friends, plenty of space also.  
if you do need to save a table just talk to Shawn, really a nice guy.

thanks for a great night 
I am sure we will be back soon.

David and Jonas
author: David M.

description: BIG fan.  This place is a great little spot.  Drinks were really well-crafted and well-priced (great value).  I thought that the bartenters were really friendly and the crowd was a nice, diverse neighborhood mix.  I tried to go back my second night (a Thursday), but it was so damn crowded that you couldn't get to the bar.  So, I left.  Too bad.  I had another couple of drinks that I would love to have tried.
author: Stephen S.

description:
Good drink selection
+ Chill vibe
+ No cover *cough*Bruno's*cough*
+ Places to sit
+ CLEAN BATHROOMS!
+ Non-obnoxious people
= A good time Saturday night

BUT...
All of the above
- awful vodka-cran that made me sick the next morning (not hangover sick, but "this is not agreeing with my stomach sick")
= A horrible Sunday morning

Good job for the most part, Blackbird.  I'll just steer clear of your vodka next time.
author: Tori S.

description:
As someone who prefers to drink at restaurant and hotel bars,  I have to say Blackbird is my favorite social spot in SF, and not just because it's a most welcome haven in greater Castro where one can get an actual cocktail (and not just a mixed drink).  The second time I came in, there were gaggles of people at the  bar, but Brent not only remembered my drink of choice (at the time it was a Blood and Sand), but what type of scotch I take.  Since then I've started roosting there 2-3 times a week, often before flying south for dinner in the Mission.

What makes this bar unique is that it's a natural habitat for two very different species: those who want to grab a bottle of Miller High Life and shoot pool with their buddies, as well as those who prefer to discuss French symbolist poetry over a Death in the Afternoon.  In a town where birds of a feather tend to flock together, this is a refreshing change of scene.

A few things you should know about the aviary before you alight upon a stool:

- The crow bar is not a gay establishment.  Sure there's a fair share of coxcombs preening in the window on any given night, but it's not exactly La cage aux folles either.  The crowd is always mixed, and it's actually not a bad place to meet people.

- Right now the bar is CASH ONLY but there is an ATM available.

- The discerning ornithologist should know that if you don't ask for spirits by brand, they are going to pour WELL liquor, even in their specialty cocktails (and it's not the kind of place that has Bluecoat and Bulleit in their well, either).   I made that mistake my first time in the bar, then quoth this raven "Nevermore!"

- Take a gander at the menu, and you'll notice that just about everything is on the sweet side.   Even their version of the Negroni (generally a bitter drink) borders on cloying.  This is not to fault the bartenders in any way, since the clientele seem to like their drinks that way.  However, if you prefer your cocktails on the dry side, just ask.  You won't ruffle anyone's feathers.  And nothing says you have to order from the menu.  Most of the bartenders are happy to wing it if you tell them what you like.

- When it's busy, don't even think about ordering anything "up" unless you plan to perch at the long shelf adjacent to the front door.  Otherwise you will end up wearing most of your $10 Paloma cocktail. 

- After a long day of work, TIffany is a regular Florence Nightingale, both for her barside manner and her uncanny ability to concoct potent elixirs to ease your every ill.

A welcome addition to the neighborhood, and a strong 4 and a half stars.  A little more variety on the menu (add one or two clean, balanced cocktails) and a better wine list (although, seriously... who comes for the wine?) would make it five.
author: Sven E.

description:
I am only adding to the good reviews of this place but I like to give credit when deserved! We stumbled in here on a rainy evening after dinner and it was exactly what the doctor ordered... 

- Creatively delicious mixed drinks, TONS of beer/wine/whiskey options

- Well laid out space - plenty of room for groups and minglers - tables, seats, bars, upright tables... 

- Friendly and hepful service - even at a crowded bar full of customers, the bartender was more than willing to provide his advice for drinks

- Diverse crowd - being in the Castro, we assumed it might be dominated by gay men, but surprisingly this place had a wide swath of people! 

All in all, this is now officially one of my fav bars in the area. Somewhat similar to Churchill but you could easily hit both in one night since they're close!
author: Elizabeth B.

description:
This is what i call the straight gay bar. Technically in the Castro, it's still pretty straight. It took until my 6th or 7th time going here to realize they had a cocktail menu, which, while nice, none of the drinks are really my cup of tea.

I like it because i can come here and have a few beers, play pool in the back (i love the fact that there's a change machine right next to the ATM), and hang out for a couple hours. It seems like a lot of people use this as a starter bar, because around 12:30 it starts to clear out and you're not fighting for a spot at the bar and you can find a seat more easily.

Anytime someone suggests meeting at a bar in the Castro, this is the one i prefer.
author: Phuong M.

description: Gays, strays and stiff drinks. A place to mingle, mix and enjoy some  COCKtails. I had the Earl Grey Black Currant Vodka infused concoction and I may have been a wee bit to big for my britches ordering it. While good, is was intense in flavor and very stong, very Earl Grey-y. I love Earl Grey in tea form w/ some milk and sugar, but once the flavor is intensified and added to alcohol, woo-wee, hang on tight my dears. Oh, and cash only, my drink was $10 so thank goodness I had an extra $1 for tip in my pocket or I may have had to drink quickly and skeddale (for fear of being slighted by the bar staff, you know what I mean).
author: Shira O.

description: Super chill and hip ambiance. Relaxing music and yummy drinks. The mezcal sour was delicious. Only con is that the wait time is a bit long - but totally worth it!!!
author: Blanca P.

description:
The pours have gotten better, but they really need sound reduction materials on their ceiling (like Chow has.)  

I get some custom mix lemon drink that they have on their mixology list.  It was TERRIBLE.  It tasted like lemonade when lemonade is being vomited up.  (Lemonade + bile in one combined bitter flavor.)
author: Robert S.

description:
Went on a Tuesday night and there was a perfect amount of people to make it a great scene. Everyone is super friendly, specially the bartender Paul who recommended the Drifter and it was really really good. 

Great ambiance and decor. 

Only bummer is that is cash only so be prepared. There is a ATM in the back.
author: Lidia Z.

description:
I visited for the first time on Saturday night (actually, Sunday morning) around 12:30.  It was still busy enough that we had to stand, but not so busy that it was annoying.  We were still able to get a spot at the bar to order and easily stand and have our drinks and talk.

I didn't research what they had in depth, but I did notice they had about 10 beers on tap.  My friend and I both had the Limonata ($8).  It was basically a vodka/lemon type drink in a tall glass on the rocks, but it also had some vanilla, which was a nice twist.  Very refreshing.

It looks like they have a lot of creative specialty cocktails, so I'll be back to try some of those.  This would be a good location to try before dinner in the Castro or a show at Cafe du Nord.  It's a mix of gay and straight, so everyone would feel comfortable here.
author: Kimberly B.

description: One of the better places at Castro. Great cocktails. Wish the space was bigger though ...
author: Serabh M.

description: I waited for 25 minutes to get drinks for two when we were in the front of the line.  I've never experienced anything like it.  And my "cocktail" was so overflowing with ice it looked more like a snow cone.  I wanted a second drink at some point but since there was an actual line I figured it would be faster wait an hour until we finished then take a cab home and make it myself. And I did.
author: Lindsay B.

description:
Apparently, I "forgot" to write my review of Blackbird.

True, my head was abuzz with fine FINE cocktails, the joy of running into several friends, and the pleasure of charming bartenders.

True, I thought to myself at the time that even though it was very busy on a weekday night, it was still a wel-kept secret from those outside the neighborhood.

True, I have been known to hold onto favorites places for fear of them getting over-reviewed and over-run.

But this time I really forgot. I mean, "forgot".

P.S. It's awesome, go there!
author: Liz S.

description:
Got in the door before it got too crowded.  The bar has a great volume level even though there are many hard surfaces.  

I dont' usually go for the mixed drinks but the rosemary fix sounded amazing.  It includes gin, a rosemary infusion and lemons.  This drink is yummy and so dangerous.  It does not taste like there is an alcohol in it.  That could be a problem if you had to many of them.
author: Megan P.

description: Had a really great crafted cocktail yesterday. It was early and I knew the bartender would have time to give my drink love....a gin gimlet with Hendricks Gin - uber yummy - and he indulged my request for a lovely amarena cherry with my lime slice. It got a little busy and we were headed out for a film at the Castro or I would have had another. Thanks for giving us a great cocktail place on Market!
author: holly B.

description: Very spacious bar for San Francisco, good drinks that are reasonably priced. Really packed on the weekends.
author: John L.

description: Loved the modern saloon feel, the chill vibe, and the unique cocktail menu...all good!
author: Jennifer A.

description: Despite how crowded it can get on weekends or the fact that they don't take plastic like other 21st century establishments, I LOVE Blackbird! It's my favorite bar in the Castro overall. They do Moscow Mule and Dark & Stormy better than anywhere around!
author: Chris W.

description:
The most amazing delicious drinks ever! Highly recommend the "Secret Handshake". Blew my mind. Not the strongest ever, but definitely did the job.

Atmosphere was great. A dark, friendly place to go with friends. Not really great for huge groups if the place is busy, not a ton of seating.

Bartenders were really friendly. Had a GREAT selection of beers along with the house made drink specialties.

Had an amazing time. Would definitely return.
author: Anne H.

description:
Their cocktail by the name of "El Guapo" packs a solid alcoholic punch - me likey! 

ALSO a great way to tell if your friend or date is drunk... have them order the "El Guapo" and going by how badly they mush up the pronunciation when ordering, you'll know how schnokkered they are!
author: Amit S.

description:
Blackbird is one of the best bars in SF right now. Its relatively new ('09 is when it became the blackbird post a remodel and new ownership), and ever since its stock has risen while the Castro has gone kind of toe up in reputation among the younger crowd who wants to avoid badlands-esque joints.

First off, is Market and Church really the Castro? Blackbird goes beyond the typical Castro vibe. Its a neighborhood bar that is just that: a real bar, with real locals, and real drinks (although some are a bit too sugary for my taste). I think deep down we all wish that this 'neighborhood' was our actual lives... because the real bar is really awesome, the real locals are really hot, and the real drinks are really good.

The place feels like a dive bar that somehow caught on and became trendy and hip. The crowd is stylish and put together, but also laid back enough to have that after--venturecapitalist--work vibe.

Pool tables in the back are a nice touch. I love the walls plastered with SF history through newspapers, and the brown butcher drink menu done on paper rolls pulled down off the walls. Another great touch is the actual mild mix of straight guys and the dash of females that find themselves frequenting the spot of the summer. Other positives include a decently regulated door, a huge drink menu, fresh ingredients, friendly bartenders, and the occasional latenight tamale lady. 

Don't know where to go tonight? Go check out Blackbird before everyone else in SF realizes how legit it is. Or they start charging cover. Or someone adds a dancefloor. Or they get rid of the pool tables for a Rupaul competition stage. 

...not that I don't like Rupaul competition stages...
author: Thom S.

description: Great drinks, great ambiance, great people and great bites. I would recommend you try the little pot of spicy cheese spread- soooooo good!!!!
author: Jaclyn T.

description:
This is a great bar! Right off the bat the bouncer was friendly and welcoming. The overall ambiance was casual, but by no means too casual, if you catch my drift. In 3 words, I would say it's an more like an upscale dive bar. 

In terms of their drinks, their beer selection was very impressive, and their cocktails were unique yet classic. Their prices are somewhat on the steep side as an out-of-towner, but probably pretty standard for the area. Coming from the Tucson bar scene, I was very impressed with Blackbird and will be sure to make another visit next time I'm in town.
author: Emily F.

description:
In a city where bars are almost as ubiquitous as air, it's refreshing to discover a unique place like Blackbird. 

Straddling the line between casual and sophisticated, Blackbird is a place where everyone can feel comfortable. And more importantly, enjoy well-crafted cocktails and microbrew beers. 

Much has been said of the specialty cocktails, and with good reason. They are really good! The hand-drawn menu recalls a time of yesteryear, as do some of the exotic ingredients. Who even knew there was such a thing as "tobacco bitters?!" The bartenders are all knowledgeable, friendly, and highly-skilled in the art of mixology. 

The daily happy hour is amazing, and a great introduction to the Blackbird scene, though at times incredibly crowded; something to keep in mind if you're looking for a quiet place to relax after work. 

Another nice touch is the revolving artwork by local artists, which usually incorporates some sort of San Francisco imagery. 

Attractive on multiple levels, Blackbird draws a very mixed crowd, though its proximity to the Castro generally means that the gay crowd is well-represented. But this is almost always balanced by the presence of plenty of other gay-friendly folk, all enjoying the warm, welcoming enclave that is Blackbird.
author: Kevin O.

description:
My new favorite bar.

Best bloody mary's in the city. Step back, Zietgeist.

Pool table. Great drinks. I'm hooked
author: John M.

description: Walked by one afternoon, had the Rye N. Gosling, and also the Smoked Trout Jar Bar.  The drink was delicious with wonderful rye notes, slightly too sweet but completely fine.  I'm not sure where Blackbird gets their Bar Jars, but they're decently good and served with a few pieces of crunchy flatbread.  Pretty good for bar food.
author: Arash K.

description: Here's the trouble with Blackbird: Amazing cocktails here, arguably in my top 5 in the whole Bay. And yet...the most uncomfortable tables and seating ever. So you are drinking these strong, amazing drinks and yet can't wait to leave, because you & your friends are spilling those wonderful drinks on the lame, unevenly-textured slate tables (uneven surfaces on bar tables is a dumb design idea, sorry) and squirming in the horrible chairs. If you haven't already bruised yourself because the tables are knee-height, you can't help but wonder when it's your turn. It makes it REALLY HARD to want to stay for more drinks. Why, Blackbird, why?
author: Veronica J.

description: Good ambiance, fast service and drinks made the right way. I recommend trying the margaritas they are definetly good.
author: David G.

description: I think a Mai Tai is a classic drink. Every bartender should know how to make one. If you can't make it, let me know. A Mai Tai does not come with a float of bitters and a salad of mint.
author: Kevin C.

description:
Two gorgeous gay boys said I was beautiful while I was having drinks during happy hour on Friday.

Five stars.
author: Jay H.

description: cool and creative cocktails, cash only
author: Long C.

description:
BLACKBIRD, BLACKBIRD? How have I only discovered you recently? Listen here, Blackbird is definitely one of the new crown jewels of the CASTRO. The place while small is great and stylishly done compared to other bars around the area. Theres plenty of seating, but not enough for the amount of people that come to the place for their awesome drinks. Photobooth in the back was a great addition, the pool table was a nice touch and there weren't any unsually long waits in the bathroom. Had a very good time sipping some cocktails with my babe here and am definitely looking forward to the next time we return.

Overall, hip and stylish people, friendly bartenders and great ambiance! Liked it so much I might have part of my birthday!
author: Lorénz B.

description:
Great bar! While the drinks aren't inexpensive, they're creative and worth the splurge if you don't come during happy hour. The bartenders are genuinely friendly and have recommendations for you if you don't know which drink to choose. The place feels cool and funky but also like I'm at home. Like any bar, it's never going to be completely noise free, but it's quiet enough that you can hold an actual conversation.

Sophisticated enough to be cool, laid back enough to come as you are. Blackbird, I love you just the way you are.
author: Denise B.

description: Tried this place after seeing a Thrillist article about their Game of Thrones inspired drinks. Cool atmosphere and decent drinks, but some of the worst service I've had in a long time. After sitting at the bar ignored for 10 min, I had to shout repeatedly to a bar tender to order a drink. Way too many amazing bars in San Francisco; no reason to come here.
author: Incognita B.

description:
They have wonderful mixed drinks! Some of the best I've had! I tried the Poached Pear and Pimms Cup. Both delicious!!!!! Those and many more for $8 each!!!!
Poached pear is more tart due to the red wine. & Pimms cup is there to satisfy your sweet tooth! Just watching the bartender crush the strawberry will make you salivate!
With alcohol that tastes like candy better pace yourself or have a barf bag ready in the car!!!
author: Michelle Y.

description: Blackbird has some amazing cocktails.  My favorite is the strawberry cooler.  Strawberries and balsamic...  how can you go wrong?  Blackbird is the spot for good looking guys on a Saturday night.
author: Chrissy M.

description: My hubby and I went in here last Thursday night after work and LOVED it! The bartender was fast-talking awesome and handsome, the snacks were delish (artichoke dip and crackers), and the drinks were out of this world. Strong, unusual, and tasty! I had the Orange is the New Draft(2) and my man had the Mezcal Daisy. Both yummy! We will definitely return and check out that photo booth in the back. They take cards now.
author: Candace K.

description: Amazing hipster mixologist heaven with excellent cocktails. It was a busy, loud Saturday night when I was there, but we all managed to have a good time. I have no recollection what drinks I had. I think I had a mojito and a variation on a sidecar, and both were great.
author: Jonathan K.

description:
Why is it that every time I order a cocktail from a bar I end up with a drink served in a girlie cup? WTF!?!?! At Blackbird I ordered the bitter end. Sounds like a manly drink right? WRONG. It comes in a coupe... google it and tell me you don't think it's for a pinky out kind of drink .

Anyway, it was quite tasty, so I got over my insecurities of holding a girlie cup pretty quick. Happy hour from 5-8? Sold! I'm also intrigued by the awesome beer selection. They have Black Butte on draft which is one of my favs. Come check this place out. It has a great vibe and I can't wait to return. 

Now if I could only do something about my predilection to select drinks served in girlie cups...
author: Brian A.

description: Great cocktails and a nice atmosphere.  They have a later than average happy hour too.
author: jeremy d.

description:
So glad I got to visit here at least once on my trip back to SF. The night was a particularly busy one, but nonetheless, the service was still great, drinks were delicious (Dickens!). This place still served as a great classy spot to hit up before we went and got Kla$$y at the club.

I love that they always have new specialty drinks at the bar. The ingredients can be a bit overwhelming and hard to read in the dim lighting, but you're almost always guaranteed to have something unique and very delicious. Friendly bartenders who are as eccentric as the drinks they make. 

Overall, another great night at Blackbird.
author: Ken T.

description:
How have I never been here?? Love love love it! The drinks are delicious and creative, they actually have Pimms Cups (and made very well at that), and the crowd is somewhat eclectic (something that seems oddly difficult to find in SF bars). 

I also loved the bar's interior design, but as my gay friend said, "You're in the Castro - if there's one thing we know how to do, it's make a place look good."
author: Megan S.

description:
This place is a beautifully lit sit-down bar with a relaxed attitude.  It is a good place to start a bar crawl or maybe meet someone you've been talking to online for the first-time.  It's the bar of firsts, if you well.

This is definitely one of my favorite bars in San Francisco.  Their mixed drinks are spectacular.  The bartenders won't rush and just throw your drink together because there are other people waiting.  They make sure that every drink is made perfectly - It's definitely quality over anything else. 

This bar is always worth my time and my money.  Did someone say "Blackbird at 5?"  I am there! 

Cheers :)
author: Emmanuel F.

description:
I may not believe in true love or jesus, but I do believe in a stiff drink with the girls after a long and trying workday. When my patience has been tested and my faith in humanity is all but lost, a good glass of malbec or a Macallan 25 is a quick passageway to salvation.  No, I may not beleive in Santa Clause, but I am a firm beleiver in Grey Goose and Belvedere.  I also believe in bar hopping and public transit. 

Enter Blackbird. Blackbird is smack in between Lucky 13 and The Residence, just down the block from Du Nord and The Mint, and a stone's throw from the muni underground, J Church, F train, and 22 Fillmore. Blackbird is also discreet, minimalistic, and well-appointed, with seating a-plenty and super friendly bar staff. Did I mention that above all else, I believe in hot men and happy hour specials? Well, that too. And there are plenty of both at Blackbird. The Speakeasy Tallulah Blonde is just $2 and the house wines are $5 during happy hour, 5-8 p.m. daily. 

I also believe in day drinking. Blackbird opens at 12 on weekends and 3 on weekdays. I never have to be sober again. Score! My belief in hot men is strengthened when the hot men in question can't get me in trouble. Since the crowd is largely gay at Blackbird, I am safe AND I have eye candy. Double score! Blackbird is a true neighborhood bar, smack in the middle of Market Street. Down to earth, easy to swallow, and no attitude whatsoever. This is something I can get behind.
author: Autumn K.

description:
Stopped by Blackbird on Saturday night around 8:30pm for a few pre-dinner cocktails and the place was packed! The bartenders did a great job of slinging drinks, smiling the entire time. I love the overall vibe of the bar - lots of room to sit, a pool table in the back, mixed crowd of straight, gay, not quite sure.

Specialty drinks will run you 8 bucks, a pretty good deal considering the quality ingredients and amount of time that goes into making each cocktail. Can't afford an $8 drink? PBR is only $2.50. Plus I hear they have a great happy hour. One major drawback - cash only. Plan accordingly!
author: phil h.

description:
Do - Dress well
People come here dress to impress. Even the minimalists pull off the fashion so well. I'd say check out 80s Purple for some fashion tips, but overall, be a little adventurous. Best thing I saw? REALLY cool argyle underwear. Hot.

Don't - Dress Marina
Go to Trigger for that.

Do - People watch
One of the best places in the city for people watching. On a given Friday and Saturday night, hundreds of fashion conscious gay's come through this rectangular joint and take note. Find a good people watching seat with a friend or two and enjoy! The topic of conversation will be noticeably different than other people watching places like Zeitgeist. Here, you'll talk about fashion and hot asses. At Zeitgeist, you'll talk about how weird and drunk people are (equally as amazing though).

Don't - Get too drunk here
You'll run into far too many people you know, make an ass of yourself, and not remember what happened. I think I need a tattoo of that statement......

Do - Compliment Sean on the great bar he's help create. He's cute and super cool.

Don't - Think everyone who works here is gay. Let's just say some mistakes have been made on our end with that.

Blackbird DESPERATELY needs a really good jukebox (perhaps with the playlist they have at Phone Booth). It would put it over the top.
author: Robert P.

description: Excellent music! Very artsy atmosphere! Fun place to play a round of pool and have some shots!
author: Jillian R.

description:
It is my favorite gay bar in San Francisco, hands down. Artisan cocktails, which change seasonally, are expertly poured and moderately priced between $8-10. I really appreciate the thoughtful beer-on-tap menu, which includes such favorites as Black Butte Porter and Moose Drool. The happy hour includes free pretzels, $2 beers on tap, and $4 whiskey sours. It does get crowded and noisy with 30-something professionals on Fridays, so if that bothers you I'd suggest coming on a different weeknight.

Bring cash and drink slowly.
author: Randy M.

description:
We wanted to grab a couple of drinks so we headed to Blackbird! The place was really crowded, had low lighting, pool table in the back, bar on the right side, seats and tables on the left side. The atmosphere was very chill.

I ordered the Blackbird Cobbler = "Graham's 10 Year Tawny Port, Graham's Frangelico, orange juice, and apple butter finished with orange zest served over crushed ice." It was sweet and tasty :). The bartenders don't slack off in making drinks.
author: Laura F.

description:
A bar that serves thoughtful, artisan cocktails... in the Castro? 

Yes, it's true! You CAN get a good drink in the Castro! Something more than well liquor slung with some nondescript mixer with a lime thrown in. 

Blackbird's specialty cocktail menu is short a simple, and I hope that's the way it stays. We visited last night (a very busy Tuesday!) and sampled almost one of everything on the menu. All of them were good, but the aged bourbon drinks were a tad strong. 

Everything was carefully crafted, tested and consistent.

And the prices are very, very reasonable. $8 for most cocktails, $10 for the aged bourbon ones. Mixed drinks are a reasonable size, but not as substantial as you might expect. (Think "sipping drinks" that you should imbibe slowly and as thoughtfully as they were created.) 

Beer ran from $5 on up. This may sound expensive, but considering the quality of the drinks, it's really not. If you're looking to get toasted on cheap liquor, head somewhere else. 

Along side Cantina, this may be my new favorite "fancy cocktail" bar in San Francisco!

Also note: Clean bathrooms, an eclectic mix of seemingly nice people, a charming and tastefully decorated space with plenty of places to sit, stand, lean and hang out. The crowd leans a little more toward hipster than I like, but it's still fairly mixed and friendly. 

Be aware: They have electronic cash registers, but are cash only. There's an ATM in the back.
author: Jeff Z.

description:
Went in on a busy Friday after hearing great things. Had to leave due to extreme frustration! So disappointing. 

Upon entering, things looked promising. Lively, pretty mixed hipster-type crowd, interesting space, might be a little loud for some but good energy overall. Also looked like they offered some delicious (sounding) libations along with a good selection of beer. 

When we attempted to pony up to the bar, that's when things went south. There were throngs of customers trying to get some refreshment in a somewhat chaotic fashion. Nothing really different from many other bars that serve the same ratio of patrons with not too many problems. At Blackbird, however, I saw 3, struggling and stressed-looking bartenders trying mightily to fill out the orders as fast as they could - they were certainly working hard for their tips. But in order to make the complicated drinks Blackbird features, their system seemed to be off - waaay off! After waiting about 20 minutes in line and getting sadder and sadder looking at the poor staff being overwhelmed by their task, I was finally number 2 in line. I thought, at last, I'll get my tasty brew and all will be fine in the universe again. Wrong. Just then, the guy in front began to order about 10 of those "fine" drinks for himself and his friends; a task that would probably take another 10 minutes, and that's when I realized: no, this just isn't meant to be. I didn't blame the guy in front of me, he had waited the same amount of time and why not order for his party once there. But not only was I depressed about the poor souls trying as hard as they could to make their drinks, I was also not wanting to add to the drama by getting annoyed or adding any more anxiety to the situation. No, Blackbird and I just did not click, not on this evening anyway, and probably not on any other evening to come. We left to  find another watering hole that was simply less stressful! 

So sad for the heroic staff there, but, really Blackbird, please tweak your system - your purpose in life is to bring some comfort to the world, not add to its anxiety. Alas, poor Blackbird, I hardly knew ye! 

Sincerely, 
HumbleReviewer101
author: Rick O.

description:
I give this three stars because my experiences differ depending on when I go.

Sunday and happy hour Monday through Wednesday get five stars. The crowd is thin enough that you can have actual conversations without yelling. Also, the bartenders are knowledgeable and you can learn *all* sorts of things from them.


Thursday, Friday and Saturday nights are to be avoided. It gets crowded with annoying hipsters, and people staring at their iphones. At those times, the bartenders are overworked and (understandably) not as friendly.
author: Sue C.

description:
Came here because our regular joint Cafe Flore was packed and not ready to handle us. Whatevs, because Blackbird rocks. 

First of all, there are windows. And light! And it's really clean!

Pool table in the back. A lot of bar seating. A lot of little wooden tables for small groups along the wall. The bar is pretty and the decor creates a nice ambiance.

We all got drinks off of the cocktail menu. I loved my Pimm's Cup (Pimm's, vodka, cucumber, strawberry, ginger ale). It was very refreshing and just the right strength for a Saturday afternoon. 

The My Clementine was very elegant and not too sweet.

I forget the names of the other ones we got... the coconutty one with fresh nutmeg is really creamy and sweet. The one with pineapple and espresso liqueur is unique and worth a try if you like novelty drinks.

Blackbird is such a gem and I'm very happy we found it. 

My one gripe is the shaky wooden tables. The uneven surfaces are very precarious, causing drinks to teeter and sometimes splash.
author: Lydia W.

description:
My company hosted our anniversary party here recently and I was really impressed by this bar. The drinks were great, carefully crafted and not overly trendy. The bartenders were approachable and easily recommended drinks that I hadn't tried yet but matched my taste. I'm sure the service was great partly because we bought out the place but the real win here are the cocktails. I must say the Birds & the Bees is the best cocktail I've had in a long time and at $8 each it's worth it for what you get.

Cash only people!
author: Allison B.
Drue C.

description: A great place to catch up and get your drink on. Order the Early Bird, it's off the menu. Its lemony goodness that leads only to good decisions. It's a cash only place.
author: Eve C.

description:
They know their drinks at Blackbird! There were so many delicious sounding drinks on the menu it was hard to decide which to try! so...I tried many :-)

Poached Pear, Bull Fighter and the good old Pimm's Cup! The beer list is really great too - and only $2 during happy hour.

A super-cute crowd too!!
author: David S.

description:
I obviously need to go to Blackbird more often 'cuz apparently this is where all the civilized ppl hang out. While ordering my drink at the bar, I turned around to ask my friend a question and was instead met by a mini sea of patient, well-behaved patrons, which all made me pause. Uhh.. this is kinda weird. I'm used to ppl shoving their way up front, drunkenly spouting off about god knows what or being just plain obnoxious. Hmm, I could get used to this chill scene...

To make matters better, the bartender chick w/ specs was super friendly and took care of everyone who posted up at the bar. She even made me an off the menu drink that was pretty damn delicious. I also ordered up the La Flama Blanca (Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur, Pineapple Juice, Cinnamon Syrup, Del MaGuey Vida Mezcal, Boston Chamomile Bittahs, all topped w/ fresh ground nutmeg) which was like a Red Hots themed cocktail. When it came time to snag one last drink, I finished off the night w/ a most delicious Bitter End (Rum, Ruby Red Grapefruit Juice, Lemon Juice, Maple Syrup, Swizzle Bitters & Egg White w/ a mint leaf garnish). Drinks are obviously their strength here.

Decor is modern & stylish, while still rockin' the down-to-earth vibe. The crowd also couldn't have been nicer... maybe that's just the fag hag in me talking, but hittin' up this gay bar was definitely fun.

TIPS:
+Bring cash, cuz this is a cash-only bar. ATM is in the back in case you forget.
+Be prepared for a short wait. I was surprised to find there was a bit of a line when I got there.
author: Tiffany M.

description:
I really writing this review so I can close out my mental Blackbird category (see the review I just wrote previously to understand).

This is a pretty nice bar, and although it can get crowded on a saturday night, that's no reason to avoid. 

note to self: don't drink champagne before dinner anymore, so you can better enjoy the bar after dinner.

I really like the sign with the 'plague doctor' blackbird - very striking visual design there!

I'll be back!
author: neil c.

description:
I was supposed to meet a friend at the Residence around the corner.  When I walked in at 6:30 it was EMPTY and it smelled like feet that had been playing soccer sockless and then had been walking in a compost pail...ie: like sweaty death.  Blech!

So, I tiptoe'd out luckily to find Blackbird.  Great space.  NOT STINKY...a very good trait for a bar.  I like their beer selection on tap...not the typical stuff...the bartender recommended the Napa Smith Pale and it was yummm.  I'm also a sucker for any bar with a menu on a chalkboard and a gay softball team celebrating!

Good times!
author: Susan L.

description: I had the "my lucky penny" and "grape drink."  Both were killer cocktails!  The ingredients were made fresh at the bar! The mixologist actually crushed the grapes to make grape juice.  I would've gave this place 4 stars for the drinks alone, but the bearded bartender/mixologist complained profoundly about a guy leaving a $1 tip and said he doesn't make vodka tonics. I totally agree with him on that aspect. If you order 3 drinks, and the guy is busting his balls, $1 tip is not right. I just didn't like the awkward moment when he was bitching to us at the bar.  Seemed a little unprofessional.   I would come back for the drinks if I ever ended up again in the area.  Also, if you are not used to gay guys making out, be prepared to see it left and right.
author: Raymund S.

description:
I've found my new favorite bar in the Castro. I went for the first time the other day and I absolutely loved it : ) They seemed to have a good collection of beer on tap and in bottles.  I wish I could have tried something from their cocktail menu but I was on a beer kick. 

The atmosphere was very modern with great music and good looking people. We went on a Wednesday evening and it was pretty loud and a little crowded but I don't mind, I still love the bar. Will definitely be coming here again soon!
author: Ezequiel R.

description:
Great place to chill with friends.  The bartenders take their time crafting amazing cocktails (great if you're looking for something special; not so much when you just want a simple vodka soda and the line moves at a snail's place).  The beer selection is pretty good as well.  

Prefer to come either for happy hour or earlier in the evenings as later on, it gets jam-packed and you're literally shoving your way inside.  But in any case, it's an easygoing, laidback, diverse crowd.  Definitely one of the better places in the hood.
author: F. P.

description: Amazing atmosphere! Patrons and bartenders are all super friendly. The drinks are great, and they make fabulous mocktails for us non-drinkers!
author: Jo W.

description:
I've always been intrigued by this bar, only knowing of it from its newspaper ads featuring a top-hatted, Dickensian-looking, large-beaked bird with black, soulless eyes. Though I knew from its Castro location that it would not live up to the standards implied by its logo, Lady Pestlebottom and I happened to be wandering by and decided to stop in for a drink. It's not often we're in the Castro, you know. For good reason - the crushing and overwhelming modernity of it all. 

It was not as terribly obnoxious as most Castro watering holes, but I found the decor uninspiring, the patrons bland and without style or character, and the overall atmosphere loud and busy, yet boring. The last time I had patronized this particular space was when it was somewhat of a sports-oriented dive (albeit a clean sort of dive). The place is completely unrecognizable now. It's terribly, horrifyingly "hip," as many here have pointed out. 

The beer selection consisted mostly of craft beers which I've never heard of (so hip!), so I decided to be adventurous and try the one named after moving-picture actress Tallulah Bankhead. It was adequate. Lady Pestlebottom ordered some overpriced, fruity libation which she enjoyed, which she now conspires to make at home (just as I did with the delicious and even more overpriced cocktail at the even more nauseatingly hip Bourbon & Branch). 

The barmaid was very nice, so that's something. It was an alright place to stop in for one drink, but we do not feel compelled to return.
author: Mortimer P.

description:
Love this place if you're planning on avoiding belligerent hot tranny and trashy messes. 

The crowd here is great, goes from gay, to hipster and straight. 

Their drinks and bartenders are both up to part. Barista that helped me last time recomended this great beer I really enjoyed... 

Ambiance is hip and cool while being elegant and classy featuring plenty of seating and even pool tales!

This is a great place if you're on a date or simply looking to have a drink with a group of friends, chilling in the back red couch sipping on your cocktail.

Great place to hit on those rainy weekdays!
author: NC B.

description: Hot Toddy with rye: 4-5 stars, especially on a chilly night.  Upscale décor and well-dressed clientele : 5 stars.  Almost getting donkey punched by a pool cue while sitting normally around the booth in the back: 2 stars.  Slightly overzealous dude trying to horn (as in horny) in to our party and a female in our group: 3 stars, expected behavior.  All in all, 4 stars, but I bet this is a 5 star place when it's slightly less busy. (we went on a Thursday night with a group of friends)
author: Joe B.

description: I love Blackbird because its a cool place without the pretentiousness. People are clean and cool and seem to be good company. The decor is warm and dim, but comfortable. An overall great place for a drink in the neighborhood.
author: NickJess S.

description: This place is what I've been told is the perfecf gay/straight fusion bar.  I don't know about that but excellent drinks, nice atmosphere, I'm a fan!
author: Suzanne V.

description:
I've been here a couple of times... DooOOOODE... and DOOOODettes... jus go.  Bring 2 or more other people with U and enjoy the atmosphere... the good-looking eclectic mix of people, the art on the wall, and some of the best drinks  (try a different one everytime u go) I've had in a GRIP or is it GRIPP (inside joke attempt).

5 stars because the homie who I last met here for some drinks made me reailze I may need a neighborhood bar...  lol... take that as you may folks but... jus sayin! 

Enjoy!
author: roderick h.

description:
I really do like the thought of this bar. The Castro really needs more places like this to mix things up a bit. It's interior is very cool and modern, the clientele is pretty, the bartenders are great (a few from the Transfer, which used to be my ultimate fav before it was taken over by the gross BOC), there's a photo booth and pool table which are both necessary bar things, in my opinion...yet there's something about this place that makes me never want to go there. 

I can hardly ever hear the music it's so low, the table between the benches is too big so you can never hear the people sitting in the chairs across from you, it's a little pricey for happy hour, although I realize it's hard to compete with Castro insanity prices, and even though I enjoy the cool, sometimes the people there are just too cool for me.

It's possible this place just might not be the bar for me because I go to bars to 1. talk to my friends, 2. listen to music, and 3. relax. It's also possible I need a hearing aid and shouldn't go here expecting it to fulfill my dive-y needs. Blackbird to me is like Indian food, I really love it once in a while but unlike a cheeseburger, I just can't have it every day.
author: Allister F.

description:
I have mixed feelings about this place. I was here on new years and I had a great time because I was surrounded by people I love; however, the bartender had me angry from my first order. 
in the top 5 pet peeves--asking for a tip.
