I will hit the bar probably every 20 minutes; no I am not going to tip every single time, but I will tip you every couple of visits. However I hate when bar tenders feel entitled to a tip. The first drink I had was not great at all, and as I was walking to my table to set the drink down the bartender says kind of rudely..."DON'T FORGET TO TIP THE BARTENDER LADIES". umm, excuse me? you get $1 and can shove it because the drink you made was garbage. But then I went to another bartender who made me a long island THAT WAS AMAZING! & I wish I still had the dollar i gave the other bartender so i could give this bartender more. There is only one stall in the ladies room, 1 stall and 2 urinals in the dudes. Overall this wouldn't be my first choice of places to go, but if everyone was adamant about coming here I would not fight the crowd. Oh, and they also have a pool table. So I guess, other than than one bartender who makes sucky drinks its a decent bar. 
Also, there is no DJ or anything like that, but there is music playing in the background and this place does have a nice ambiance.
author: TiYanna L.

description: Bit more expensive than I'd like to pay for drinks but well worth it. These bartenders are real bartenders, nothing like those half baked ones that make crap for drinks in clubs. Only place I want to go when I enter the Castro.
author: Joji V.

description:
I really enjoy the laid back atmosphere at Blackbird. Along with a great selection of beers, including some rather fine craft ales, and some very interesting and potent cocktails, this makes for a good place to start and end a night, and fill the time in between too if you're so inclined.

Friendly bar staff, good amounts of seating and never too crowded, it's the ideal place to head when you're done with the Fri/Sat night crush elsewhere in the city.
author: Rich N.

description: Black Bird, you're cool, hip, tasty, friendly and cozy, we like you... but if you're closed on xmas night, put that on your website or on yelp! so that we dont have to end up in Lucky 13 (which is alright but nothing like BB)
author: melissa n.

description:
I'm PREEETY sure this used to be the scuzzy bar where I got my wallet stolen while watching the Tigers lose the World Series in 2006. Can't remember the name.

All the really pretty, inventive decor at Blackbird couldn't keep me from recognizing the overall layout... From being drawn to where I'd been sitting at the bar, with my rally cap on (stupid rally cap -- didn't work)...

But the makeover here is pretty remarkable, still. It was just THAT traumatic of an evening for me, back in 2006, that they couldn't pull a fast one over on me. I do have to say I'm impressed, though -- very cool place. 

To look at. Not to drink in. 

Crowded with obnoxious people, and my fancy cocktail was just so-so. And so, so expensive. 

I COULD have ordered a PBR -- in a can, of course -- but why on earth would you do that, in a bar like this? That's just so retardedly hip, I can't condone it. 

Come on, people. PBR in a can is for scuzzy bars where I run the risk of getting my wallet stolen. Or for my mom's house.
author: Lisa T.

description:
Hey there castro!
All in all a good cocktail. The leatherback book is pretty astounding. Tres chic interior and even a pool table in the back.

not really my crowd, but definitely will stop back by to try other drinks.
author: Nate R.

description:
Nice bar, great drinks, good looking folks, but terribly loud. 

Great place to have a good cocktail and "chat" with friends you see often. If you're planning on meeting someone you haven't seen in a while or someone you have lots of catching up to do, save Blackbird for another time.
author: Art A.

description:
Sometimes you just want a bar where you can wear a black wife-beater and tight jeans, grease up your bulging arms (and bulging bulge) and dance your pretty little heart out. 

I never want those bars. And this is certainly not one of those bars. And this is why Blackbird and I are about to embark on a beautiful relationship. One where we might occasionally make out after a few drinks (but I won't go any further, I swear!). 

This is a great cross between being divey/chill and trendy/fun. It's a very long and narrow bar with lots of seats and tables (made out of bark?) all down the left-hand side. There are some old school red diner booths in the back that sandwich an old pool table. Some of the walls have old school SF Inquirer front pages (and by "old-school," I mean JFK and WWII style). Other walls have paintings and funky lights. 

I hear it can get crowded depending on the time of night, so either come here in the early evening or as your final spot.
author: Jared S.

description:
My grandfather introduced me to Manhattans when I was just a wee granddaughter. When it was appropriate for me to drink my own (and not take a sip of his when my mother wasn't looking), we would sit together on his back porch, drink Manhattans, and shoot the bull. 

He passed away earlier this month and, in memorium, I felt the need to drink a Manhattan. Based on location/time constraints, Yelp indicated that this would be the best Manhattan I could acquire on the night that I needed one the most. It was a good 'un. Not as good as Grampa's, but I think he would have approved with the care which the bartender took and the results that care yielded. Though he probably would not have been so crazy about all the noisy young people everywhere.
author: Will R.

description:
This place features fantastic cocktails (although a tad pricey), great beers on draft, beautiful people and nice decor. Almost could maybe might be my new favorite bar, but the acoustics are absolutely fucking horrible. Other than that, Blackbird is fantastic.

I had the pleasure of enjoying the cocktail appropriately dubbed 'the leather-bound book', and it definitely lives up to its name. Ron Burgundy would be proud!
author: Jono K.

description:
Things I love: well made cocktails, sassy gay men. 

Put generous helpings of both of those within stumbling distance of public transit, at reasonably not break-your-wallet prices, and you've made a fan of me!

Seriously though, what a great bar! There is nothing middling on the menu whatsoever -- only cool things. Cool beers, cool cocktails -- and a cool crowd to go with. Sure, it gets crowded -- but hey, that's why god gave us elbows. Another cocktail, please!
author: Meena V.

description:
Is Blackbird the hot new bar in SF?  I went last night and have to say "yes". The bar was packed by 5:30 pm.  It's location at Church and Market guarantees a hearty bleed of Mission hipsters and sassy gay men.

Lots of specialty cocktails on the menu, including blended Pina Coladas! The bartenders were super cool and nice, the type that wait for you to take the first sip so they can slip you the overflow (of your beverage--get your mind out of the gutter!)

On this occasion we hung out with two Sisters of PI and a candidate for a hairy chest calendar. Pool table, photo booth and big orange booths...what's not to love?
author: Lisa R.

description: Blackbird makes some killer cocktails for the adventurous, and combines them with a cool environment and great people-watching.  I recommend the Early Bird, which is a little less exotic than many of the other menu items, but still enjoyable.
author: Dan W.

description:
I really like this place. They have some great cocktails and a good happy hour - pretzels baby!

The decor makes it appear like the left side of the bar is a different place than the right side of the bar.

And finally, to get the photobooth working you insert the money under the seat - now that deserves a +1 useful.
author: Matt C.

description:
Blackbird is the sort of bar that every city should have.  Clean, cool-enough looking inside with well thought out cocktails, good beers, and a selection of wine that is better than you'd ordinarily find in a bar.

But don't get the $10 barrel aged cocktails.  There's a reason nobody else makes them.  They tend to be gin and vermouth-based cocktails that spend 6 weeks in a bourbon barrel.  The result is a mess: gin that tastes a little like oak with stale vermouth.
author: Suo L.

description: Really cool space and great cocktails. Perfect neighborhood spot - well designed but no pretention. Their winter menu is "winter is coming" themed (aka Game of Thrones themed). Try the Red Wedding, it's the best!
author: Sandra S.

description:
Consistently my favorite bar in the city.  $2 beers on tap during happy hour and amazing cocktails, which are a combination of fresh ingredients, well-chosen spirits.  What I love about this place is that their posted cocktail menu changes from time to time and it shows they're constantly trying to introduce new flavors to their customers.  My current drink of choice is the my clementine.

You won't have too much of a problem finding a seat on the weekdays, but a fair warning: weekends can get fairly packed with the Castro crowd (yours truly included).  A good mix of people show up here and there's always lots of eye candy.
author: Ben T.

description: This was my first time at Blackbird. It's a pretty bar with pool tables in the back. The bar tenders are friendly and accommodating.
author: Mahta P.

description:
This is definitley, my new favorite go-to spot! 
Fanstastic drink menu, plenty of open space- comfortable and clean. 
Love the location!
author: Katie C.

description:
I've been here 89869018985 times in the past week or so.  It's safe to say that I love Blackbird.

The bartenders are on point and serve up some mean cocktails with a smile.  Love that.

My only requests, and they're small, would be getting Miller Lite available and possibly adding back the jukebox.  I'm a sucker for putting too much money into a jukebox to play a song I've heard a million times.

Otherwise, keep on keeping on you sexy beast.  Xoxoxoxo.
author: Evan L.

description: Why haven't I been here before? It's a cute little bar with potent, delicious cocktails. Not just tasty, but also interesting...I definitely want to come back and try more. So far, The Tourniquet, was the one we tried last night and it was very very good....my friend- the cocktail expert, said it was the best drink she'd had in a long time!
author: Sonya D.

description: Great place. Great atmosphere, cool furniture/lighting, good drinks and not super expensive. Very attractive men too which is always a plus.
author: James F.

description:
And a jay- song was on.
AND A JAY-Z SONG WAS ONNNNNN

Oh, Miley.

Anyways. This bar is very to the point, so I'll be to the point.

Staff: Friendly as can be, and super cute in a non-modeleque kind of way, but cute nonetheless.
Drinks: Tasty and priced correctly. Yes, correctly.
People: Imagine all your friends in one place. Yep, they're there.
Location: 20 feet from Church Street Station and about 15 bus stops. Couldn't be better.

Blackbird is where business happens.
author: Richard T.

description:
Pretty sweet atmosphere. 
A little bit on the pricier side -but hell. I'm a broke student. Tried the bullfighter and the showdown (? I think)... they were pretty darn good. Especially that last one. The decor's pretty sweet. Except... the low tables are crappy. They've got ridges on the surface, which is pretty quite uneven. It's dumb when NOT trying to spill drink. One would've thought they'd fix it...
I wanna go back. I recommend it. Chill spot.
author: Tania C.

description: I got nothing but LOVE for this place!  The whole bar has a great vibe and a good mix of people.  It's totally chill and very comfy.  I also love the fact that we showed up on a Sunday and still found the place popping!  =)
author: Lisa R.

description: Best bunch of bartenders in all SF. My friend and I are regulars there because of the awesome service and friendly attitude Marcus, Sean K., and Sean R (among others) give us. Will always be my favorite bar because of them. Keep up the awesome work!
author: Michaelyn S.

description:
Nice bar but relatively expensive, so come here for happy hour and get $2 beers! Cash only though (but they have an ATM in the back).

Cute place with newspapers lining the walls and decent bathroom (always important in any bar).

Tables are kind of awkward because they are the same height as the chair seats... someone forgot that most people have legs.

Overall nice place for conversation, great ambience!
author: Melissa H.

description:
blackbird is known for their awesome cocktail. and indeed their cocktail is awesome. the social situation in here though is confusing. blackbird is gay and straight. the one guy across the room who was making eye contact with me for while looked very scared when i went to say hi to him. probably straight and being a bit secure about his sexuality.  
i went on a weekday once and you could see a gay couple making out at the corner and straight couple getting on it on the pool table. what a scene. 
i prefer dropping by on a weekday after a long dinner with friends. they get a little crazy crowded on weekends.
author: Te R.

description:
When my friend invited me to join her and her friends at Blackbird for drinks last Friday night, I wasn't quite sure what and where she was talking about. But she did mention drinks so what the heck! While it took a little while to find this place (look for the bird wearing a top hat) as well as parking (look for anything), we finally made our way into the bar. 

It was relatively crowded, but not overly so - there was still room to move around without bumping and grinding into your fellow patrons. The place was well lit and clean. In terms of the customers, there was a good mix of the typical San Francisco demographics. The drink menu was written on butcher paper and taped up behind the bar. The noise level was decent - and I had no trouble hearing my friends. After taking in the sights and sounds for a moment, I headed off to order drinks. 

On the plus side, the bartenders was very friendly. The wait at the bar wasn't too long. I was surprised to find they had Sudwerks beer on tap since that's more of a Davis/Sacramento thing. The dirty martini and the Manhattan I ordered was mixed relatively well. No complaints from my friends - other than they didn't serve Grey Goose. 

On the down side, I was surprised that a place that wasn't trying to be a dive bar didn't take plastic. Given the prices for drinks weren't on the cheap side, you'd think they'd let you swipe. Let's face it, we all end up drinking more than we intend to but we usually only bring enough cash to pay for what we intended to drink. 

One interesting feature of this bar is the newspaper "wallpaper" they have up. While it looks good aesthetically, native San Franciscans (like yours truly) might find the headlines an interesting read. Some of them bring back memories of local events from years past. 

Anyway, the drinks were fine and a good time was had by all so I would definitely go back.
author: Ed W.

description: Best cocktail bar in the Castro, not super cheap but worth it (also love the $5 fosters)
author: Jonathon O.

description: Shout out to Shaun (sorry if I misspelled)  and Charlie! thanks for setting the friendly vibes with your smiles and charm despite the rush. Charlie, thanks for helping me select a tasty beer and letting me taste it beforehand. It was a great experience, great work guys!
author: Leelee E.

description: Blackbird is a great spot! Classy, fun, great drinks, wonderful people. I reserved the back booth areas for an engagement celebration and it was perfect. The staff were super friendly and helpful and the space was great. Everyone had a great time imbibing delicious cocktails and mingling with all of the friendly people. Thanks so much and we will definitely see you again!
author: Max A.

description:
Friendly bartenders? Check.
Delicious drinks? Check.
Good crowd? Check.
Same paint color that I want to use in my imaginary second bathroom? Check.

The only downside is that after 7 p.m., it got to be too loud to hear myself think.  But I'm not going to lie, "hearing myself think" often consists of a lot of awkward silences, so it's not that huge of a loss.
author: Jess T.

description: Blackbird is a classy, laid-back bar that is nice for socializing in small groups. The drink menu is impressive, with a wide variety of drinks and some hard-to-find beers. Some of the seating is a bit awkward and uncomfortable due to low and uneven heights, leaving a large portion of the bar undesirable, in my opinion. If you manage to snag a table near the front, however, it's definitely worth checking out.
author: Brett B.

description: I like this place. Crowded and different type of crowd here. More mature than the usual Castro crowd.  I would say that it is a beer and cocktails bar than wine bar. All the red wines I had here were not that great.   So the next time, I will just stick to beer, as the tap is a plentiful. My friend said that the cocktails were good, but small. So either they were really good that he drank them well or just in small glasses.
author: Marck N.

description:
Very nice spot with ample seating, which is so necessary for a good bar. The bartender was really nice and remembered what I was drinking, which was totally impressive since it was a pretty packed Saturday night. This could be because I was one of like eight women in the entire bar, but it could also be because she's awesome like that.

CASH ONLY, though, so be prepared to empty your wallet on some tasty cocktails.
author: Vandana M.

description:
I came here for the first time last night, and must say I really enjoyed myself when the place wasn't packed to the brim.

I walked in, and loved the rustic, sea breeze warn decor.  The lighting was soft and inviting to the eye.  The petrified wood tables added a nice touch to the seemingly sailor jaunt the place could have been back in the 1800s.  The layout is long and narrow: bar on the right, seating on the left--seemingly reminiscent of similar bars in NYC.

The drinks here are good, especially taking into consideration of the fresh ingredients they have available for the drinks.  I did notice that the bartender was able to make my drinks, and if he didn't know he quickly found out from another bartender (my Kentucky mint julep for example), and learned my shot later, buffalo sweat, was bourbon and Tabasco.  I will say the bartender was rude at one point, and is part of the reason why knocking them a star.  If you start out asking me what I'm ordering, and then immediately turn to the person next to me and flirt with her before coming back and asking me what my drink is again, I'm not going to be a happy camper.

The other point I didn't really care for was when the place got packed.  It was really hard to move throughout the bar, and it took a fair amount of time to get through the crowd to actually get another drink.

The crowd here is mixed, yet is certainly well-balanced from what I could tell.  For this seemingly being a straight/gay bar, it seemed to lean slightly more towards gay scene.  In any regard, a few guys certainly caught my eye.

All-in-all, another great bar to hit up when it isn't packed.  I would certainly check it out even though it is a few blocks away from Castro.
author: Brent A.

description:
There's going to be a good drunken story to come out of here.

A new venue for the Castro, and truly when they say they are a dive bar - that they are. It's really different from what the Metro was, however, for being a dive--it comes with a great ambiance, style, and a nice retro feel to the place.

The photo booth is a good place to document those drunken stories.

We entered it three times, that night.

It's a nice crowd, some trying too hard--but some, who looked like they'd be well equipped to try a few things... on you.

Blackbird, I will be back.
author: Kim D.

description: Fantastic cocktails. Great decor & design. Comfortable space.
author: Ell A.

description:
Finally made it down here last Friday night.  The place was packed, but the layout is well thought out, so it didn't actually feel all that cramped.  The bartenders work fast, so despite the crowd we never waited long for our drinks.  

They had real solid cocktail menu.  Huge fan of the Rusty Rob and the Leather Bound Book.  They also had a great greyhound, and a nice selection of beers on tap.  The drinks are also very reasonably priced!
author: John S.

description: This watering hole is very laid back and casual. No attitude kind of atmosphere but it gets really crowded on the weekends. Not a dive bar and not really upscale, but somewhere in the middle. I really like the energy of this place. The age of the crowd is 20-ish to 40-ish. Drink specials are listed on a chalk board on the side of the bar. I'm sure they can make you frufru drinks but it looks more like a beer and wine kind of place. Bartenders are very cool, although I left my drink outside to go to the bathroom and when I came back it was cleared away.
author: Kenson K.

description:
After a tiring day at the office, i was both hungry and thirsty.  I made the late rush hour trek across the bridge in to SF.  After a decent meal with a friend, i was one for one.  To solve my thirst needs, we headed to Blackbird.

A dark and warm environment greets as you walk in the door.  There is a clash of moder, industrial and old that works very well.  The staff is friendly, the bar is well stocked, price is fair, though not necessarily cheap  and there are plenty of seats for a bar of this size.  However, Blackbird's popularity make it a crowded environment on busier nights.  And as some reviewers have previously wrote, it can get prohibitively crowded.  I've left on previous nights having been unsuccessful in reaching the bar.  But not this night.

Jameson and ginger ale in hand, we found a corner table away from the noise.  The acoustics at Blackbird are terrible.  Even on slower nights, the small crowd reverberates off the wall as if a crowd three times its size.  Places like this need to recognize what they want to be.  They are a bar, where one can tolerate a moderate amount of noise but ultimately chose this over a club for more relaxing reasons.

Nevertheless, after my second beverage (3rd of the night) i was much relaxed and briefly confused my Monday for a Thursday; the night you recognize you have work the next day but increasingly care less with each drink.  Thank you Blackbird.
author: Reuben D.

description:
Easily top 3 inventive cocktail bar in SF.

My go to spot for tasty beverages.  Menu refreshes a few times a year.  

Expect it to be PACKED with typical castro crowd on fri and sat.
author: E. R.

description:
I came in here once after a wedding and walked right back out -- I was clearly way too drunk for such a nice-looking place, and my friends and I tottered our way back up the street to Lime.  We should have stayed at Blackbird! 

I was here in the evening the other day,  and I loved the ambiance here, especially the old newspaper on the walls. 

   I agree with what other people have said about the shaky small tables that have the uneven surfaces -- seems funny to put ridged tables where people want to set down their tiny, preciously mixed drinks.  The low tables and chairs also made me feel like I was at an elementary school parent-teacher conference, but it made it easy to have a good relaxing conversation with my drinking companions.  

I guess I just am not sure about $6.50 for a  Dogfish IPA; seems a bit on the high side for a bar. I go out in the neighborhood all the time and feel like I don't pay more than $5 for a microbrew.  Maybe I do. And, as soon as I typed that, I realized that I'm personifying the cheap dyke stereotype, and that maybe it's okay for Blackbird not to be as cheap as, say, the Mix or the Lexington!
author: Ivy S.

description: Disappointing. Nice space, not too noisy to carry a conversation. But the cocktails are less interesting than they sound (we had a Rosa Rita and a vodka-cuke-thyme thing) and they make them a bit weak. I may try it again but first visit was underwhelming.
author: tw s.

description:
What a great new addition to the neighborhood! 

It looks kind of swanky, but it's filled with a friendly mix of locals. It features crafty cocktails and high-end beers, yet you can still grab a $3 can of Tecate. It's gay-friendly, but not a gay bar. It's straight-friendly but not a straight bar. It's stylish, but not intimidating. It's poppin' at night, but is perfect for happy hour...

Blackbird's got it juuuuuuuuuust right.

(21st Amendment Watermelon Wheat, FTW!)
author: Stephanie P.

description:
A great addition to the Castro Renaissance.
I think one of the owners is a long time Castro bartender who I think took to reading the years of bitching on yelp from miserable gays like me and decided to do something about.

First of all the design is creative and inviting. The lighting is respectful like its shaded  but you can actually see people and enjoy looking at them.

But what's best is the bar, its so elegant and it contains really great alcohol and drinks. Finally a Castro bar focuses on the drink making and not just that.  They have a great selection of wines.  Wines are notoriously bad at gay bars in my accomplished experience. 

However, here they are actually promoted and the selection is admirable and thoughtful written out charmingly on butcher block paper twice hanging in two different ends of the bar.

I now look forward to going to a bar in the Castro to just meet and talk with folks.  Blackbird makes that happen.
author: Sean S.

description: Really great cocktails and a good vibe.  This little place in the Castro has a pool table in the back, and to be honest, it's a little to bright in this area.  Other than that, I really like this spot.  It's been packed the few times I've been here, but the cocktails are worth it!
author: Taylor L.

description:
Now this is my kind of bar. I wish it could be a bit more gay, but there's nothing I can do to control that.

Part of me wants to give this place low ratings, so it'll keep the douche bags (that go to Trigger) away, but that would be too selfish.

Friendly staff, cheap drinks, cold pint glasses for beer and delicious cocktails. 

Now if they could only start taking credit cards!
author: Keau K.

description: I love this bar. Great spot to pop in and have a few drinks in peace. People don't bother you, you can play pool, and if you're lucky, the photo booth is working and you'll have a few pics to remember the night by. Since the drinks are so good, you'll probably need a reminder.
author: Jenny M.

description:
Love, love, Looove.

Happy hour is awesome, $3 well drinks and a few bucks off of beers. It's such a great place to meet people, no matter where you live it's always easy to get to church.

Only suggestion is for them to get the credit cards going - but they're on it...
author: Chelsea D.

description:
In a word, FINALLY. This is the modern, hip-but-not-tacky, friendly, neighborhood bar many of us in this neighborhood have been waiting for. 

I've been more than once now and the experience was consistently fun, relaxed, and happily just down the street from where I live. For a new bar, Blackbird offers very reasonable prices and decent pours from bartenders dedicated to making sure you have a nice time. Extra kudos for ample seating, decent music, and lighting that hits you and the decor in all the right places. 

Not just a hit, a home run. Hope they'll take card soon so I can do some real drinking there.
author: Aaron L.

description: what an adorable neighborhood joint. I came here to meet an old grad school buddy for a few happy hour drinks, to my delight they had a pimms cup on their cocktail menu (cucumber garnish and all!) I had been staying in the mission and working in SOMA so i was quite surprised at how safe my backpack with every apple product known to man was left unattended on our chairs. the folks next to us were chatty and friendly. A bit crowded when you first walk in, but make your way to the back and theres def room to stretch. I will be honest, coming from SOMA it was a real bitch to get out here...even getting OFF the MUNI proved to be difficult. I hate that train. DEATH TO THE MUNI. LONG LIVE BLACKBIRD!
author: Kate R.

description:
I love Blackbird.  Caveat: I have never been to Blackbird on a weekend so am only speaking from a weekday, my local neighborhood go-to, happy-hour perspective.
 
They have a great happy hour ( a great $4 Whisky Sour), service and ambiance is pleasant and laid-back, and you can always find a seat (or, I've never had any issues anyway, and I frequent blackbird about once per work-week).  The scene is comfortable - not overly hipster or pretentious (as many places can be in the Mission/Castro).  It's my neighborhood go-to for a drink after work.
author: Kristen N.

description:
Blackbird was eh. 

I'm kind of a cocktail snob, so I was super excited to see, on their giant butcher-paper drink menu, that the bar uses Laird's Applejack in one of their signature cocktails. Laird's can be tough to find (or, at least, it was in Boston. I'm a newbie to SF, so maybe that's not the case here?).

My favorite drink in the world, a "vintage" cocktail called the Jack Rose, is also made with Applejack, so I asked the bartender for one. 

She didn't know how to make it. Which is absolutely fine. I don't expect that every bartender know how to make relatively obscure cocktails. But she was totally bitchy about it, and acted like it was either something I'd made up in college, or some chain restaurant cocktail that doesn't exist in "real" bars. 

So that sucked and made me feel stupid. 

I could have just told her how to make it, but I ended up ordering whatever cocktail it was that had the Laird's in it, and it was pretty good. Very autumnal. So, three stars for the drink. No stars for the bartender's shitty attitude.
author: Sara A.

description:
They kept the gorgeous woodwork, one of the pool tables and the friendly drink prices! 

The exterior got a face lift; while the interior got hip new booths for seating, modular tables and a fancy ceiling. 

The seasonal drink menu looks sexy, though I didn't try anything. My drinks were made well and actually served out of glass, as opposed to plastic.

I'll definitely be back. A lot.
author: Justin V.

description:
I hardly ever get to the Castro, so I'm no expert on the 'hood, but I can't see how Blackbird could possibly be anything but a fantastic addition. 

I could not stop looking around--they did such a great job on the interior (I can't figure out what was in this space before. A little help?). My companion commented that it has the "outside, inside" feel, like Blue Bayou restaurant at Disneyland. I cannot affirm or deny this  claim as I've (gasp!) never been, but I nonetheless agree. The suspended ceiling of uneven planks and rough-hewn stone tables make one side of the space feel sort of like being at the beach, while the gorgeous wood bar on the opposite side is evocative of a classy old saloon circa Gold Rush era SF. As DID as that may sound, it all works together really nicely, and comfortably. Oh, and I dug the current paintings, as well.

All I can say about the drinks (as I didn't try any of their signatures), is that their well selection is completely acceptable, and they were served with care. I hear the happy hour is worthwhile, too. 

Great place to impress someone and I like the writing on the website. Extra points for that. Cheers!
author: Sara W.

description:
Great place to have an adult beverage....Great Bartenders, seasonal drink menu,   cool atmosphere....and just removed enough from the castro..

Nice crowd and no bridge and tunnel fork for the most part.
author: Patrick G.

description:
Before I turned 21 this year, I had numerous friends telling me that I would really like this bar.

Boy were they right!

This has become my go to place for a (not so quick) drink if I am strolling in the area. The bartenders are pretty damn friendly. If you have the chance to be served by Sean, ask him to make 'his' Sazerac. It will blow you away!
author: Devin H.

description: Blackbird is a great bar for a post-work cocktail with friends.  I've only been on weekdays, when it has been easy to get a drink order filled at the bar and a seat (so I can't comment on how busy it is on the weekends).  The cocktails are unique and well done, the bartenders seem interested in what they're doing and are attentive to the patrons.  The crowd is fun and it is a very easy atmosphere.
author: Brian M.

description:
Blackbird offers an interesting and ever-changing menu of really outstanding cocktails.  Spiritous cocktails are lovingly stirred, not shaken, while citrus-y drinks get the living daylights shaken out of them.  Also don't miss their barrel-aged cocktails.

I've only ever been in the late afternoon, early evening, when the bar is satisfyingly chill and uncrowded.  A big plus: no TVs, which is depressingly uncommon even in cocktail-oriented bars.
author: John D.

description:
Hubby and I are not big bar people.  We seldom intentionally go out somewhere just to have a beverage.  Neither of us are big on loud spaces where it's impossible to converse.

Enter Blackbird.  Nice, clean, non-pretentious space with an outstanding liquor and cocktail menu and several staff knowledgable about their product to the core.  My cocktails were delicious and very fairly priced given the handmade to order, fresh ingredient manifesto they operate. 

We don't cocktail often, but when we do this establishment will be top of the list.  Big props to the owner for envisioning this vibe.  They hit the groove.
author: Russell D.

description: Hands down the best bar in the Castro. If you're looking for a place that has great drinks, a beautiful interior, and isn't divey and full of creepers, then this is the place for you. Blackbird is my go-to place when I want to sit around and chat with friends, have people visiting from out of town, or if I'm going out to the bars and want to start off the evening in a dignified way.
author: Jerome C.

description:
In my book there used to be no such thing as a stumbling block to Lucky 13, the unanimous choice for my roommates and I to get hammered.

But then this place transformed from creepy poophole to kind of awesome bar but don't get me wrong, I'm not completely won over.

I'm not super huge on the crowd.  It was a bit too dressed up and showy for my tastes.  Additionally it seemed like everyone was having a birthday party here but this was an easy thing to get past.  The best part about this place easily is their diverse selection of beer and the great bartenders.  Shaun (probably misspelling your name) is an asset to this venue in terms of his knowledge of beer and ability to recommend something good.  I had Mama's Little Pils on draft and was very pleased with the choice.  Add this to selection of ambers and interesting domestics they have on draft on this place soon becomes a decent spot to come have some beer.

The space is good, it's roomy and there's a pool table that wasn't too tough to get in line for.  The wall paper scheme they have going is kind of awesome too.

Don't misunderstand, you're still my love Lucky 13, but this place isn't bad.
author: Steven R.

description:
And the winner for Extreme Makeover: Bar Edition goes to ... Blackbird! 

It's nice to see a new Castro bar open with an original design sensibility. I loved the newspaper wall, the gray-painted wooden panels and the neat, low tabletops. It looks nothing like its predecessors, the run-down Expansion or the blah Metro. Plus there was a great mix of folks and some slammin' tunes!
author: Marcus C.

description:
I remember this place when it used to be the Expansion Bar, which later became the Metro Bar.  Back then, it was basically a dive bar.  

Last night, while walking out of Home Restaurant, I noticed it had reopened.  It's definitely not a dive anymore.  It's decor is probably best described as modern take on a juke joint.  The rope light bulbs along the bar, the old newspaper covering the backroom, to the cool use of wooden planks as ceiling fixer with hidden speakers and recessed lights all work really well together.  There's even a bar style door at the entrance. The only slight problem I see is the bench along the far side of the bar as you first walk it.  It doesn't seem practical.  I saw a lot of people having to hold their drinks while sitting there.

This place looks like it has a lot of potential.  And the music, and crowd makes this place a really hip and awesome addition to the Castro.  A great place to go and hang out.  Finally, a lounge where the music compliments the conversation instead of drowning it.
author: Shiun H.

description: Went on a Wednesday night thinking it would not be to crowded. It was. But, it was great and in the end we got a bank of seats along the wall. Seriously well crafted drinks in a good range of prices. I had a drink not on the menu after asking the bar tender for a recommendation based on my alcohol choice. He came back at me with the best bourbon drink in the city, hands down. And, no attitude, despite the fact that he was slammed. It's one of my favorite cocktail bars in the city and I can't wait to go back.
author: Uda W.

description: At 37 I managed to get kicked out a bar. Kind of sad but kind of awesome. In this case for making out-whatever. It was probably my subconcious screaming for an exit from this place. I'm sure its nice but I found it rather sterile and made for more conservative types than myself. Ah well, 3 stars for mediocrity, 1 for kicking my tush out.
author: Smelly S.

description: Stopped here with my GF after brunching and strolling in the Castro last Sunday. Several friends recommended the place as they have a better than average selection of beers. They were right. I was happy to see Little Sumpin' Ale on tap and was quick to have a few. We were the only people in there for about an hour or so, but the service was impeccable. Guys behind the bar know a thing or two about beer. Though a gay bar (didn't know that when we went LOL), this is the kind of place I could hang out in.
author: Scott L.

description: This is a great bar that fills a need in SF for classy/trendy-without-pretentious and laid back without completely-hipster/divey. Amazing, delcious cocktails, bloody Marys a must have. Good beer on tap, pool table, comfy couches. Also deserves a shout out for being a bar that refuses to be pigeon holed...being near Castro it's got a good gay scene but there are all sorts of people there as well. Nice to have a place that all of my friends can enjoy and find something they like. I wish there were more bars in SF like Blackbird!
author: Virginia W.

description: Strong drinks amidst sexy professional men. Too bad they're all gay!! Ah well. Get a drink (recommended: the farmers daughter) and have fun people watching!
author: Sam W.

description:
I spy with my little eye... hipsters and h-mos and yuppies - oh my!

My number one gay brought me to Blackbird for an after-work cocktail on our way to the Cafe re-launch event and I'm sold.  It's filled with people from all of the surrounding neighborhoods, and I love a mixed crowd.

Bar staff was talkative, attentive and made sure that our pretzel cup was never empty. And they weren't shy with their whiskey either.

Now, if only they served some nom-my nibbles I'd REALLY be hook-line-and-sinkered.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Best bar in SF... Mixed crowd which is a huge plus... and Nancy the bartender is not only a hot little item..she is the SH%$.... So nice and took time to introduce herself... Making of a TRUE mixologist!  

As for one of the reviews below... Just because its not in your GAY neighborhood and isn't GAY enough for you doesn't mean its a bad bar.... If you have issues with labels take it up with a therapist and stay off Yelp.
author: johnny D.

description:
Drinks were great!

I had:
Rember The Maine
-Solid rye drink with an absinthe rinse, reminds me of many of the drinks at The Alembic.

Root of All Evil
-Highly Cinnamon-y drink over ice.  Flavor was like a root beer with a gingerbread man crushed up in it.  I could have done with a little less cinnamon & sweetness.

The Birds & The Bees
-Sweet, but not too sweet, honey & rum martini, served with an orchid bloom.  This was the best drink I had.

El Guapo
-I wasn't impressed with this drink, but I'm not a huge fan of Mezcal.  I'm guessing I only ordered it because I was loosened up from the first 3 (strong) drinks.

Crowd seemed about 70/30 gay/straight on a late Saturday afternoon, and the place was very roomy & clean  (the exact opposite of Toronado where we were earlier).

Staff was friendly, but on the slow side, so this is why I'm only giving it 4 stars.
author: Sally L.

description:
I am of the strong opinion that San Francisco's gayborhood needs more class. Compared to others of similar repute, too many of the Castro's bars are ho-hum, if not downright dingy...this place is a breath of fresh air.

Blackbird is visually refined, yet comfortable. It brings the style in spades, but doesn't do it in a minmod steel-and-strobe lights way. The plank lumber drop ceiling over slate tables compliments dangling oversize light bulbs hanging over the bar; the bathrooms and pool table in the back hold their own.

Once you're in and have taken in the surround, the drinks are reasonable and the clientele is friendly. WIN! Castro bar of the year '09!
author: Jay A.

description: This is a fantastic little gem! Excellent staff, phenomenal cocktails, interesting and diverse crowd, pleasant atmosphere with the music at the exact right volume to carry on conversations, and just a few feet from Muni. My new favorite bar!
author: Bob I.

description: What a cool bar. I grabbed a few cocktail here with some friends. Great atmosphere!! Will be back! Give them a try!!
author: Daniel G.

description:
I just went to the opening this weekend and thought the place looked really, really great! It's got a great decor inside and the color schemes are nice! The bartenders are really nice and the doorman is super cool!

Michael M--you need to cut back on your alcohol, cuz you just reviewed the WRONG bar--the Expansion is a different bar!!!!!

The owner was totally working it too! He's way cool!
I'd def be going back more often and the it's a nice touch to the Upper Market Area!
author: Alvin M.

description:
Hmmm, I am torn on this review. I have heard rave reviews about this place since it opened. While it is a welcome addition to the Castro, it feels more SOMA-ish to me. Kind of like Wish on Folsom. 
The decor is cool, lots of mixed seating options, a strategically placed (thank you!) pool table at the back, long bar and cool dropped ceiling. But the vibe felt off to me, almost confused? And whoa, I have never been in a noisier bar. What is going on with the accoustics in there?
The bartenders were attentive and friendly. I like the big scroll drink menus :) I will more than likely find myself in there again, but I found it just A-ok...
author: Shannon K.

description:
I was so stoked to walk into this place and find that it wasn't the crusty bar it used to be, It was all new and queer friendly and had amazing drinks!!!!
A lil on the pricey side for bevies but, i would go here for happyhour  for sure!
author: Tricia G.

description:
On my whirlwind trip to San Fran I was trying to take in the many fantastic neighborhoods the city has to offer. I figured my trip would not be complete with out a night in the Castro. I choose the Blackbird after a bit of research and I really wasn't disappointed. 

The drinks were a great blend of classic and modern and I went through a few interspersed with an Anchor Steam or ten. The bar itself has a great fit out with a speakeasy steps into 2010 type feel. Old newspaper clippings adorned the walls and the pool table didn't make the place look tacky at all. 

The venue is long and somewhat narrow and was pretty crowded at the front. A very cool crowd who seemed happy to be there with a drink in hand. The bar staff were friendly and pretty efficient and there were even a few smiles on their faces. 

We met some cool fashion kids here and ended up partying back at their store into the early hours. I couldn't have asked for a better night in the Castro.
author: Alex D.

description: If you want a beautifully mixed cocktail prepared with some great ingredients, this is your place! Delicious and very well attended! Come and enjoy something yummy!
author: Joaquin G.

description: Relaxed and fun-- bartenders were really friendly and nice. Had the Pim's cup as I am a sucker for anything cucumber flavored; seems to be the new trend taking over. Pool table and photo booth are available for any buzzed shenanigans as you feel inspired. Not sure if it would have the same charm if it were packed, but definitely mellow on a nice lazy Tuesday afternoon. Worth a return visit.
author: John P.

description:
After 3ish years of living a block from Lucky 13, it's nice to have a new option.  Not that I don't love Lucky 13 for what it is, but Blackbird is EXACTLY what our neighborhood needs!  

Reasonably priced expansive drink menu.  Nice, attentive bartenders.  Okay there's no popcorn but I sampled the pretzels and turns out they do the trick just fine.
author: Abby M.

description:
I really like this bar. I came in on Friday with a large group of friends and immediately felt comfortable. There is more than adequate seating, reasonably priced drinks, friendly patrons, and gracious bartenders. What more can a girl want, right? Well I guess everything else was a plus. Everything else being, awesome set up, warm inclusive environment (a nicer, more stylish neighborhood bar without much too cool for schooling), great music, my favorite location, a photobooth...there's more, really, you should check it out though for yourself. Most importantly Blackbird just puts you in a great mood. It seemed like everyone there, myself included, just happened to be wearing smiles and this (all of this) is why jumping on the muni after work, heading to Market and Church to get back to Blackbird so I can meet up with a friend for happy hour tonight...this and their 'grape drink'...mmmmm!

PS. At the beginning of this post I said I liked this bar but I confess I was playing coy. Truth is, although things could always change in the future, at this moment I truly feel "Yay! I'm a fan."
author: kristen s.

description: I'd like to start this review like Jake W. did , in theory I want to love this bar. The drink menu is awesome, those specialties dare I say look beautiful. Did I try any of them?NO. And you know why because when you wait close to 20 minute just to order, with really rude and equally miffed patrons with their elbows crammed into your spinal cord when you finally get waited on 1) I personally felt like an asshole asking a severely overwhelmed bartender to make me some intense specialty cocktail 2) that drink probably would tack on another 5-9 minutes to the equation. I know cause while waiting I took great interest in watching various drinks being made with care, and with no bullshit , they looked AMAZING. I hate words like mixology and foodies , but the people who work here are totally talented I could see. And I blame them not for this hellhole . I should have known starting with a line at the door, for a bar, on Market Street, a cartwheel away from Lucky 13? REALLY? The space is realllllly dimly lit. Maybe too dimly lit I have horrible eyesight and I'm aged. Some chick was screaming multiple times about doing meth /being on meth /offering people meth. I was not aware meth is the new social drug but apparently I'm wrong . I'm so out of touch at 32. You can't hear anything when you are trying to talk. The whole thing is just a NO, I won't be back. BUT shouts out to the bartender, brunette guy , tattoos , beard, not sure if you are team Penis or team Vagina but it was an absolute honor to salivate over your hotness for 25 minutes. When you furiously shook things to create alcoholic magic it touched me in an absolutely sacred place. I will dream about you ...forever. But goodbye Blackbird, fare thee well, peace in the middle east y'all
author: Lauren V.

description: I originally wrote a rather scathing review.  In my defense, I did have a horrible experience my first visit.  Since then, I have been back on a number of occasions.  I have had a a rather good time each visit.  Cute crowd.  The thing I like most about this place are their mixologists.  They create drinks that I thought I liked and now love.  I had a Sidecar tonight.  I've had many (and I mean many) Sidecars previously and none have tasted quite as good/sweet/tasty as tonight's.  Thanks Blackbird for changing my point of view.  Cheers!
author: Ryan B.

description:
Sort of like a gay version of Bloodhound, but without the antlers.

This is my kinda place, finally. it has, dare i say, an SF vibe. Not some copy-cat-LA-valley-pornstar vibe. Bartender had a thoughtful conversation with me about the best way to construct a margarita. And he delivered a lovely well-tuned drink. Nice mix of nerdy cute guys, out-of-place derelicts ("whoa, where'd my bar go?"), hipsters, and gay intelligentsia.

i'm there.
author: Sean M.

description:
BLACKBIRD ROCKS! 

This is my first review on Yelp. I am doing it because I LOVE Blackbird and I had such a fantastic experience there. It's really refreshing to see a new Castro bar with such an amazing style. The interior design of the bar is modern and industrial -- I love the ambient lighting, the newspaper wallpaper, and the gray washed wood panels. The place looks really upscale but it's not intimidating. The crowd is friendly and mixed, not sleazy at all. There are gays, straights, and everyone seems to be having a good time. The bartenders were extremely nice and talented. I was surprised to find out the special cocktails were $8 and under. I had the Aviation and it was super tasty.

It is by far my favorite bar in San Francisco. There is no way it gets less than 5 stars. I'd recommend Blackbird to anyone that is visiting or a local looking to have a great evening out.
author: Cathy L.

description:
I was at Blackbird on a Saturday night. There were twice as many people there as the occupancy limit.  No credit cards accepted. No lock on the bathroom door. 

I'll pass.
author: Justin A.

description:
What a great new neighborhood bar. The newspaper wall is AMAZING, excellent job on the renovation. Good wine, beer and cocktail list and kudos on the prices!!!! 

I'm coming back tonight with friends! 

This place puts all other bars to shame!
author: Bryan H.

description:
Excellent bar! Finally something to fill the gap between utter dive (not that there's anything wrong with a dive) and the new trend of the cheesy LA-esque, velvet rope poser bars that are popping up everywhere. 

Blackbird is incredible!
author: Wyatt H.

description:
I met up with some friends here for a cocktail before heading to the Swedish American Hall and it did not disappoint.  

Having gone there when it was the Expansion, I was amazed to see the transformation.  I have nothing against the dive it was before, I love dives, but this new bar was a little lighter, a little bigger (hey must have knocked out a back room or something), and a lot less dreary.  

I also find that a bartender can really make or break a place, and the guys here made it.  They were extremely nice, patient and made a mean cocktail (and reasonably priced ones at that).  And the dark wood bar against the light wall was striking.  I also liked that although it was a Saturday night, we all got a seat.  And it had a nice friendly vibe and so close to my house.  I'd definitely go back there again.
author: Suzanne A.

description:
I'm always in search of perfect Manhattan.  I three top favs and Blackbird has it's Market Street Manhattan which is better than cashmere on winter night.  It's warm, smooth and tastes like a bit of heaven.  I feel very comfortable there a good mix of folks, not a pick up scene, just fun and friendly.  

a good people watching place.
author: Princess P.

description:
Decent atmosphere but can get somewhat noisy, then again, it's a bar.  Offers some pricy drinks considering that almost most bars around the area offer discounted drinks or 2for1 specials during happy hours. I usually stick to Coronas and they're never part of any specials or happy hours at any place.  Almost $6-8(including tip) for a Corona is not acceptable. So I guess I have to downgrade to domestic beer if I want to stick to a budget.

I have been to this place a few times during Happy Hours and saw no signs advertising their Happy Hours or their specials, I didn't notice any signs but a big blackboard menu listing well & fancy drinks, although some of them very tasty; I've ordered a few of them.

I would go to this place maybe a few times a year.  With $12 I can have 4 beers at Toad Hall, Badlands, or Midnight Sun and see just as many cute guys, besides, I do need the variety or would get bored if I always frequented the same place.

I only found out last night that they do offer Happy Hour Specials, only by asking, otherwise it's promoted and most people don't know about it.

Here's some quote:

"We do offer well cocktails with 1 liquor and 1 mixer=soda or fresh squeezed juice for $3.  We also offer for  Sours $4 made from scratch.  Tap Beers range from $3-4.50 depending on what you order.  House White $4 or Red $5.  Bud/Bud L $2."

I think you should definitely try this place for yourself and I think you'll like it.
author: Marc N.

description:
My new favorite bar. It looks amazeballs after the remodel. So thank you blackbird for contributing and encouraging my alcoholism. 

And it is one of the few bars (shockingly) in sf that might actually be mixed.
author: Kai T.

description: Blackbird is a awesome spot to grab a few drinks and mingle with the buddies.  They have plenty of beers I've never even heard of to try out and they can whip out a mean bloody mary.  I can't wait to go back.
author: Lisa Z.

description: Great drinks, great service, great atmosphere (if you don't like the typical club scene), and usually a good crowd.
author: Ryan S.

description:
hip Gay/Straight bar, cool drinks, beautiful crowd, lousy service

Love the scene and the drinks once they're actually served.  I usually go mid-week and it's busy but not too crowded.  The bar service is PAINFULLY slow and inattentive however I keep coming back for the great crowd and cool aesthetics.
author: Jory S.

description:
I was quite impressed by this bar after visiting it. First, although the place is loud (very "live" acoustics) you don't have to compete with music blasting, so it's a good sit down and talk bar as opposed to a dance club.

The interior is tasteful and modern, but the main reason I'm giving this place 5 stars is because the cocktail I was served ("bols and sand" I think it was called) was absolutely delicious and very reasonably priced at $8.
author: Eric v.

description:
Awesome happy hour!  

Greyhounds with fresh grapefruit cool bar staff, and a chipotle bloody mary that rocks.
author: Lisa Denise V.

description: I love Blackbird and come here almost every time I am in SF. I love the innovative cocktail list, which is reasonably priced (last time I was there I spent a total of $14 for two drinks, a martini and a rum cocktail). I've always found it to have a good vibe with an eclectic mix of people and never too crowded.
author: Anais R.

description: Went to Blackbird last night for an after dinner drink, I'd been before and wasn't swayed one way or the other. I ordered a mint julep, and goodness gracious was it amazing. Served over crushed Ice, in a silver mixing tin, topped with confectioner's sugar. My friend, Chris L. ordered an equally amazing cocktail " Where there's heat there's fire" which was the most gorgeous colored cocktail i'd ever seen. The bartender took his time to craft each, and it was well worth the wait.
author: Bobby B.

description:
when you go to as many bars as i do, it's easy to get disenchanted with prohibition-era decor and cocktails with ingredients i can't pronounce. what makes Blackbird stand out is the kindness of the bartenders, because i was that annoying girl who walked up to them and asked "what's good here?" i'd just gotten off work and couldn't make a decision to save my life. enter, sean, a man with a beard and a plan. 

he made a great drink, engaged in banter, and left me laughing. it didn't hurt that hall and oates were playing in the background.  BB has it all: location, pool table, good drinks, and a better soundtrack.
author: Marie A.

description:
Okay, I've only been to this bar twice and I like it already. 

I love the crowd at this bar, I honestly thought I was in a different city. None of the people looked familiar, and believe me you see the same faces in every bar in SF. I like the ambience, love the lighting, ample seats and decent drinks. This bar introduces a whole new "middle end" scene, and is a great hang out on the weekends. 

On the downside, it does get super crowded, but hey that's a part of the fun, right?
author: Matin N.

description:
I am so happy to see a cocktail bar in the hood that is middle of the road.  Not Elixr. Not Cafe Du Nord.  Not Lucky 13.  Not a crappy dive bar.   Nice enough, but my friend made a comment that the crowd was a bit fag-haggy, which is fine and fun, but I like bars that are a bit more mixed crowd and I think this place is still so new it might still be defining itself. 

My friend specifically wanted to go to happy hour, for happy hour prices, but the bartender charged full on non happy hour prices to her, which kind of makes me feel like they're not that on-point.
author: Best M.

description:
Better make sure it is happy hour.  If not, the prices increase exponentially.  Much too expensive to be on your list of regular bars. 

I've seen some complaints about the noise.  I won't knock points off for that.  C'mon, people.  It is a bar.  What do you expect?
author: Matthew D.

description: This is my new favorite bar in SF. The space is beautiful, the staff is friendly and knowledgeable, the drinks are unique and the patrons are a perfect blend of personalities and styles. There's a pool table in the back but to my surprise, on a Friday night no one was playing. I can't wait to bring my friends here! Don't forget to bring cash, no credit cards accepted.
author: Caitlin C.

description: ok place, really crowded on Thursday after 5pm and hard to get a seat.
author: ipod t.

description:
Cute modern rustic country design.  Stop in to just check that out.  Great vibe whether it's pretty empty or full.

Lots of wines by the glass and cheap bottles (like $24).  Cool how they list all their wines, beers, and cocktails on big ol pieces of butcher paper.

They also have a pool table kind of hidden from view.  Super nice staff.  Fave new place in the Castro!
author: Melanie C.

description:
This place was HOT.

Hot, like.. I had to step outside cause I was sweating so much from the temperature inside!
Hot, like.. hot guys everywhere.  Seriously well dressed and good looking crowd.
Hot, like.. super crowded!  this place is popular!

I don't know if I am hot enough to come back here but if they let me in once, maybe they will again. :P
author: Jeanie C.

description: Best cocktails in the Castro.  The most expensive possibly, but also the best.  There is one of these "hand made" cocktail places in almost every hood now.  Blackbird is the one for the sTro.
author: Corey V.

description:
What a gorgeous bar! Good wines and nice atmosphere. 
I went here for a friend's art opening so I'm not sure if it's usually that busy.
author: Alexandra D.

description: This bar was packed on Saturday night. It was hot and stuffy inside, however, I liked the crowd. I will be sure to try this place again...when I am not wearing a sweater and sweating like a mad man.
author: Kellie N.

description:
Perhaps he says it to everyone, but when the bartender told me that a vodka-soda is supposed to be with lemon, not lime (just the way I like it) and gives me an extra large lemon to garnish my drink, I knew I liked this place.

I fell in love when, after playfully complaining that my second lemon was far smaller than its predecessor, he gave me a large squeeze of fresh lemon juice.

Blackbird is definitely a great "new" bar. The renovation of Metro to Blackbird has transformed the ambiance into a great place to grab a drink post-work or pre-night-out.

The bar does not take credit cards, but should be soon. I think the bar is suffering from "post-remodeling popularity" so the space is loud and full, even on a Tuesday night.
author: Bryan B.

description:
Lots of dudes. Dudes that like to stare, ogle, drool and snicker. 

Pool table is a nice touch especially if you wanna bend over and offer your ass to the crowd. The photo booth is also useful to take a picture of your trophy or disgrace. 

I'm giving it 4 starts because they offer tannat and malbec by the glass. Only place in the U.S. that I've ever seen that even offers tannat. The wine prices weren't outrageous so I can't really complain.
author: Roger H.

description: Decent cocktails and everything is hand made, classic old style cocktail menu with a modern twist. Packed on Saturday with a hipster crowd, the bartenders though act like they are making you a big favor and it's really slow so probably my second choice.
author: Aga K.

description: It's pretty inside. The drinks are unique and provide material for conversation so that your time with your friends, or your date, or whoever, is slightly less awkward than it could be, but still somewhat awkward. You start at a long crowded bar and then you move to uncomfortable but attractive bench seating that leaves you hunched over . . . are those tables tree stumps? Is this a gay bar or a bunch of breeders who love a good cocktail? It's 1 a.m., Saturday night, time to go home.
author: Mandy H.

description: Really really REALLY tasty drinks!!! A bit priced, but sooo good. The bartenders are also extremely friendly and enthusiastic. Too bad it's nearly impossible for a girl to hustle herself a drink here (unless you bring your ballin' sig fig).
author: Jennifer N.

description: Relaxed atmosphere, and some delicious cocktails. Last Word is my favorite so far. The bartenders are friendly. It can get crowded during the weekend, so go early to get a seat, or go on a weekday. Cash only, so be prepared.
author: Julia W.

description:
A lil' bit of everything for everyone: 

Pool table? Check.
Photo booth? Check.
Ample seating in various forms? Check.
Historic literature plastered on the walls? Cool artwork to look at? Double check.
Great beer? Cocktails? Cordials? Wine? YES. 

On the beer side,I love that they have Sudwerk! As a UCDavis grad, that makes me proud.  Booze-wise, they have chartreuse and a nice little drinky called  the Early Bird - really light yet flavorful drink mixed with Elderflower liqueur, Vodka, and soda water.

Good happy hour, great vibe.
author: Gabrielle J.

description:
I've been to this bar twice and have enjoyed my time here. It's been super packed...almost unbearable, but what bar in the Castro is not on a weekend night? 

The drinks were good and the staff was friendly. I like the little photo booth in the back. The decor is interesting. It reminds me of something from Chicago or New York - almost like a loft feel. 

Definitely worth checking out!

Enjoy!
author: Zeke A.

description: I really like this place. It's kinda small, but I went on a Wednesday night so didn't have any trouble getting seats. It's a really good looking bar, too. If this bar was a person it would be a crazy attractive male model. Unfortunately not being a male model myself, I had to wait until a couple of cute gay boys were served by both of the bartenders before me (yep two bartenders serving one set of customers). But hey, can't blame them for trying. Anyway when I got served shortly after that the drinks were amazing and the bartender was so fast I literally looked down, saw my drinks and change and wondered whether he had superpowers. Good bar.
author: Nina M.

description:
best drinks ever!

at first when i saw the bartenders preparing the drinks (which at times can be painstakingly slow) i rolled my eyes thinking how pretentious this place must be. But after my first drink, named Leather Bound Book, i must say i was a mega douche for thinking that the slow work of the bartenders was due to anything but sheer brilliance!

ok, i might be overly excited right now for some reason, but i really like all of their drinks. It gets pretty busy at night, so you might be standing around a lot so get there early to grab a seat at the bar, or booths that line the back walls.
author: Moot P.

description:
i ventured away from my standard whiskeys, and indulged in martinis with the girls.  the bartenders know their stuff, and do up their mix drinks proper. 

i love the old newspapers wall papered on the walls.
author: Sheri N.

description: Great food and drinks! Their Truffle Gnocchi is awesome. I have never been disappointed by a meal here and desert is always a wonderful surprise.
author: Elizabeth L.

description: Great cocktail fantastic selection of whikeys and bitters, hand crafted old school cocktails! yeah im a fan!
author: Robert B.

description: If you are hunting for good drinks and a great location then you should probably head to Blackbird. I've been a few times and each time the place is crowded, but not so much so that you can't move around or get a drink. (And yes, there is something to be said for a bar that attracts a good crowd on a Monday night!). They have speciality cocktails and are downright delicious and constantly rotating so even if you've been its worth coming back to see what they have mixed up this week... Great spot for drinks.
author: Shanna T.

description: Great beer. Great bartenders. The bouncer was a power-hungry jerk.. Won't be back. To many places in SF to be subjected to macho BS.  4/21/12
author: Bill S.

description: Blackbird has another new menu up and it's their best one to date.  The Shakedown is really good, their applejack cask aged cocktail is also pretty awesome, but the standout here is (for a first, a tequila mix) the Bull Fighter. The jist of it is tequila, citrus, and a syrah reduction with black pepper. It's as good a drink as I've had just about anywhere.  Someone give them some kind of award.
author: Luke M.

description:
bar tenders know how to make a good Manhattan.
Great job with the interior - modern but not pretentious.  Great mix of patrons - i've consistently had a great time here
author: Nick G.

description:
This place is awesome. I came out with the boys for a few drinks last night, and don't have enough awesome things to say about Blackbird. Cute bartender, fun music, friendly atmosphere, and the drinks were to die for. 

I'm a Manhattan connoisseur and last night I was served the best Manhattan I've ever had, hands-down. My friends tried many different specialty cocktails from the menu, each as tasty and interesting as the last. The thing about these cocktails is that they're not just good drinks - they're strong, they taste good, and they have texture to the flavor - it's not just two or three things thrown together in a glass, it's a tapestry of liquor and juice and YUM. 

Highly recommend this place!
author: Kare C.

description:
Was here for a friend's birthday recently.  Was initially concerned as there was one not incredibly fast person behind the bar.  However, as soon as the crowd was picking up, it seemed like three people magically appeared to help quench our thirst!  Great drinks, fun  mixed crowd.

Cool spot; the renovations did wonders and it is a well designed comfortable bar.  Love the exposed 'beams' that were installed - makes what would otherwise be a warehousey feeling spot very warm. Perfectly situated to grab a bite a Home after.
author: Danielle R.

description: This is a great spot with a diverse crowd (for the Castro anyway). Nice cocktails. Generally very good bartenders. The seating is a bit weird because the table height is too low except in the initial entry area. Decent neighborhood bar overall and they always have changing art, which I love.
author: Jenny K.

description: Nuance. That is what makes the cocktails here spectacular. Every drink is a series of hints. A hint of cinnamon, a hint of rye, a hint of camomile, a hint of cacao. They manage to do this even though their drinks are basically 100% booze. Color me impressed.
author: Jordan M.

description: We had a large party and they were awesome enough to accomodate our party as well as let us bring food into the bar! WOW.. You won me over right there. The next one.. Their drinks are simply amazing! OMFG.. Their Poached Peach was awesome, but it's PIMM'S CUP FTMFW! Strawberries and cucumbers?? 'nuff said! I need a few glasses of Pimm's Cup right NOW!
author: Anne T.

description: Get one of the specialty drinks. Great for a mixed crowd.
author: Stacy W.

description:
My favorite g-bar in the city. Reminds me a lot of places in the East Village NYC, both in design, the overall vibe and the way people dress.

The layout is definitely suboptimal - a lot of wasted space from the bar, backward toward the pool table area. Probably not something they can help, though. 

Drinks are surprisingly well priced & taste good, though they have trouble making a couple non-traditional drinks (a french 75??).
author: Ryan H.

description: Very chill place with a mature, diverse crowd and excellent service. Great bartenders who take their craft seriously. I tip my hat to Chris who made two fantastic cocktails called Prospect Park and The Orchid. The only downside is that they are cash only but they do have an ATM in the bar.
author: Jennifer W.

description: Thoughtfully complex drinks, handsome crowd.  Great place to de-stress after work, and hang-out before dinner, but don't come here alone.
author: Paul M.

description: If you're looking for a place with a relaxed atmosphere and a mixed crowd to just hang out and enjoy a cocktail or two with friends, this is the place. Blackbird has become somewhat of my "go to" hangout. The staff is friendly and the crowd is great...a nice mix of professionals--gay and lesbian friendly without being a pick-up joint. Whenever I go there, I seriously feel like it's one of the coolest places in the city. Definitely worth checking out.
author: Jerome I.

description: Great happy hour specials ($4 vodka sours! if you don't like whiskey...), delicious drinks, plenty of seating, AWESOME decor... I'm a fan. Cash only, yo.
author: Richa A.

description: Great drinks and artwork!  Wood trim on ceiling is super cool and love the photo booth.  Will be back for sure.
author: J J.

description:
We stumbled past this place while trying to remember where Lucky 13 was. Probably not fair to compare those two places (apples, meet oranges), but we're glad we found Blackbird.

Nice decor, friendly crowd and bartenders, interesting beer selection, music at just the right volume.

Could have done without the hipsters playing quarters (hipsters play quarters?) on the metal table, and the bathroom door could benefit from a lock. Maybe both of those are fixable.

Very happy to have found this place by accident.
author: andy d.

description: i've noticed during the times that i go here... every bartender would give you a different type of glass but with the same drink. HMMMMM... am i the only one who notices the difference? :P
author: Marc K.

description: LOVED this place!  The bartenders were wonderful and the cocktails were so creative and enticing.  I can't remember the name of the cocktail I got but it was the one with tequila and bell pepper, it was amazing!  But the thing that will have me driving two hours to come back?  Their infused vodka.  It was amazing!  My husband got the grapefruit and I got the orange on the rocks.  Literally, to die for!  When the bartender pulled the vodka out you could see how it was crammed full of orange rind and grapefruit rind.  I'm not a regular drinker at all, but if I had this at my disposal on a regular basis...I'd have to start going to AA.
author: Gina C.

description: Blackbird is a classy gay bar.  It's comfortable and shiny inside with a nice lighting situation that works well for conversation of any sort (from intimate to pleasantries).  Have a great Heff on tap and I imagine their other drinks are just as nice.  But really all I need to say is that Blackbird is a classy gay bar.
author: Jeremy G.

description: Among the best cocktails I've had. The bartenders are friendly and the atmosphere is great. Tip well!
author: Jorge H.

description: Great bar with lots of seating, a modern vibe and tasty ass cocktails. I wanted to try everything on the menu.
author: Shyam P.

description:
Service=Wicked hot bartender chick  than had an excellent personality and great smile... 

Atmoshere= The back half of the bar is wallpapered with old newspapers and colorful artwork.  The lowered false ceiling, red half circle booth seating and wooden stumps for cocktail tables really create a comfortable but stylish place to hang out and play pool or have cocktails.  The celing fans kept the place well ventilated.  I loved the lighting fixtures that hang above the bar. ...raw round hand blown balls that hang randomly from black wire.  

Homo factor= 70% gay and 30% straight.... everyone seemed comfortable 

Price= $ average

Parking= normal castro parking... if you can take the train you should... besides you shouldn't be drinking and driving :)

Bathrooms= very clean.
author: Annmarie K.

description: As most have said before me, this place is really great!! Casual but truly loud....so be prepared....but it's not horrible at all.  The bartenders are really great and fast....attentive too. I had a farmers daughter - loved it....yum and one of the barrel fermented drinks...really great. Awesome drinks mixology is superb.  Cash only.
author: Melissa B.

description:
This is one of the best remodels I have ever seen -- really great that they kept the vintage bar! When I was in there it was pretty crowded, and I thing the staff are still getting the hang of how the new digs "flow". 

Not the old dive bar that it was, but a nice addition to the Church and Market hood.
author: Kevin M.

description:
Success! Everything about this place was cool. My brother and I went there and got pretty sloshy off just two of their drinks. My brother knows how he likes his drinks and directed the bartender as such. Our bartender Nancy was amazing. She mixed it perfectly and had a great hand shake. She was patient and chill. And to be very honest, I've never enjoyed a Manhattan more than Nancy's. 

Black bird was very enjoyable, because all around me, there was something cool to look at. People were doing their own thing, Tom Edison style bulbs lit the mahogany bar, a simple menu written on parchment, and warm red accents added to an overall encompassing environment. Very nicely done. 

Don't taint this place or I'll cut you. Only reason I am dropping down a star is because of the clientele; there were some drunk a holes. Not totally Blackbird's fault but I would have cut them off sooner.  Still, amazing.
author: Yvannia P.

description:
Out of the ashes of the old dive bar The Expansion, briefly reincarnated as The Metro, comes another new spot in the Castro's refreshening nightlife: Blackbird. The decor is deliberately rustic chic, which could easily have looked like a stodgy bar my Grandfather would have gone to without the elegant touches that makes this probably the best decor of any Castro gay bar (even beating Trigger in some respects). 

I went once on a Monday evening, when it was pretty busy (on a Monday, no less!), and again on a Friday when it was jam packed. As other reviewers have mentioned, if you push past the knot of people in the front, there's a bit more space farther inside. It's a nice place to meet friends and visit, but also surprisingly easy to mingle despite the long bench and rows of chairs. Another excellent addition to the Castro.
author: Kevin G.

description: Great drink menu, friendly bartenders, cool layout, attractive crowd. Mostly gay but diverse enough to be welcoming to all.
author: Jax R.

description: It's ok, and some of the beers are very nice.  It was just so loud that it was hard to hear what anyone said.  It's much better if you can get a seat.
author: Jennifer M.

description: Very knowledgeable bartenders, amazing space and vibe! Love the barrel aged cocktails, but "The Drifter" is one of my favorite cocktails in the city! Will be back again and again and again....
author: Don M.

description: If you are like me it makes you very unhappy to go out and spend $7.50 or more on a well liquor and a sloppy poured terrible tasting drink.  If you feel that way too, this is your solution.  Well crafted and blended cocktails.  Great space and talented bar tenders.  Can get pretty packed and is on the smaller size space wise like many places in SF, but worth the limited space around you for the good cocktails.  I guess people don't know a cocktail can be enjoyable or are out to just get drunk on cheap booze and have terrible pain the next day if they do not look for something better like you will find here!
author: Joseph F.

description: I'm usually more of a dive bar type of gal, but I did like this place.  The drinks were strong, the cocktails were high quality, the bartenders were really nice (at least to me..hehehe), and the ambiance was nice without being pretentious.  It's a truly mixed crowd - we saw some hipsters, some yuppie types, even an old man with a dog collar (seriously).  I recommend the Dutch Courage - it was my favorite cocktail there.
author: Preethi C.

description:
Thank god for this place. Clearly, the owners of this joint get the picture that the Church and Market junction is the place for loung-ish kinds of venues. No, new BOC, we don't want to come into your shiny interior to get put in a trance by your flashy disco lights. 

And to the person who wants it to be more gay, I love that I can take my straight friends here without having to hear them whine about going to the Castro once again. Blackbird is simply a place where everyone can go to have fun. I even took my mom there. 

Good job Blackbird. Only suggestion: get a cover for that pool table, stat!
author: Natalie P.

description:
Went to the bar at around 3:00pm on a Sunday and it was still pretty busy considering the time.  The place was a little hard to spot if you don't know what you're looking for, but i hear they will be putting up a bit more signage to make the place easier to find.  

-Decor:  Warm and inviting, I think it strikes a good balance between being friendly and trendy.  Love the artwork, petrified tables, and SF newspaper wallpaper.

-Staff:  I must say nothing like service with a smile.  Never waiting long for my drinks and always willing to accommodate.

-Crowd:  One of the best things about this place is its diverse crowd.  Everyone was friendly and just having a good time.  What more can ask for?

All in all a great bar, amazing job by the staff, you can't go wrong at this local watering hole.
author: Ed V.
