description: 2nd time here and I officially love this place.  Cool environment, good music, decent crowd (not too Marina-ish, not too Mission hipster-ish).  Good strong drinks.  Only flaw was that the bartender was kinda an a-hole, but that's not going to deter me from coming back.  Oh, and bonus points for the pool table!
author: Toby C.

description: Good place with made-from-scratch cocktails. Prices are clearly posted, though not the happy hour specials, which bring them from steep down to excellent - $3 wells, $2-4 beer, etc.. Seating and pool table were nice. It does get pretty crowded and noisy though.
author: Bill B.

description: This place was SUCH a relief from the Lucky 13, which I hated. Fast and friendly service, strong drinks, cute decor.
author: Derya A.

description:
this bar was very cool. pretty fancy looking crowd and a welcomed change from my norm. drink selections were numerous and equally thirst satisfying. the fellas sitting next to us formed a critique line and assessed the shoes of all the women who walked through the door. entertainment to say the least.

be forewarned that  you should do about a 100 sit ups before coming into this part of town.
author: Jonny Bobby G.

description:
We fell in LOVE with Blackbird last night. Were gonna hit our neighborhood spots Martuni's or Zeitgeist, but decided to walk a few blocks and finally check out Blackbird. 
A female bartender made our drinks, and she was very eager to answer any questions about the many fascinating ingredients used in their signature cocktails. I had the Blackbird Cobbler (Tawny Port, Frangelico, OJ, Apple Butter, with an orange zest) which I proceeded to make love to. It was devilishly delicious and SO complex...the layers just kept going and going! Next I had the Bitter End, which was so beautiful we had to take a photo. The egg white froth was perfect - what a sexy looking drink. And the flavor - whoa...once again, great layers, refreshing on the front and slightly bitter and tannic on the end. So so pleasant.
My companion had the Northern Star which was really well balanced and layered, and something else with overproof Bourbon that he described as a "man's drink" - quite liquor driven but delicious.
Atmosphere was great, not too hipster-y, but filled with 20-30 somethings drinking micro brew beers and well-made cocktails. And there's a pool table in the back if you wanna do more than just drink. 
Only cons were we wished the lights were lower - it could be even sexier than it already is, and one of the bartenders (maybe a barback?) was absolutely hammered drunk and being kind of obnoxious...really unprofessional. Luckily his female coworker made up for it.
New menu comes out in April - can't wait to go back and try the new round!!
author: Tanya K.

description: Love love love this place! It's fast becoming my go-to bar for after work drinks with friends. Super convenient location, cheap drinks (i.e. 2-3$ beers), happy hour til 8 every night, pool table, clean and nice decor but totally unpretentious... what more can you ask for?
author: Jen H.

description:
Blackbird wins the best imitation of a Hell's Kitchen (New York) bar award.  Very cool vibe, and if I were in my mid-20s to mid-30s, it would be perfect.  Didn't try the cocktails, but I did get very quick service from the bartender.  The place is loud, but it's definitely the place to come with a group of friends; snag one of the booths in the back, and drink and chill.  I'll go back during the afternoon to try some cocktails, and might update the review then.  

And, if you're waiting for your lame friends, you can literally spend hours reviewing 20th century San Francisco history as attested to by the newspapers pasted to the wall in the back, including long-lost papers such as the Call-Bulletin (my grandpa's favorite).
author: halli p.

description: Delicious, inventive cocktails, but couldn't believe how packed it was on a Thursday night!! I can understand jostling and standing on a Friday or Saturday, but a three person deep line on a Thursday? Other than that, it seems like a classy joint and the prices are slightly less than you'd assume from the atmosphere.
author: Whitney R.

description: Very charming atmosphere, boasts revolving signature cocktails. The acoustics are terrible, though, and it gets incredibly loud once it starts filling up. I didn't have any of the specialty drinks, but my cocktail was decent enough, if on the small side. I'd go back.
author: Catherine T.

description: Best time is happy hour the drinks our cheap and the place if full. The bartender is friendly and the customer our having fun  (It A Live) have fun
author: Kopa J.

description: very cool/trendy lounge. came here with a couple of friends for HH one afternoon and was definitely impressed. wasnt too crowded and this is a kind of bar/lounge where you can actually sit down and have a conversation (at least for HH, might be diff at night). the HH specials are pretty decent. wine is $5-6 and well drinks are about the same but beer is a bit cheaper. PBR goes for a whopping $2.50 haha. all in all a fun hang out spot in the castro.
author: Kristin B.

description: Daddy likes. It's a little swanky for a place that insists it's still just a neighborhood bar, but they have a GREAT wine selection and very friendly folks 'tending. I was a little aghast to see they actually painted the beautiful wood on the bar that's been there since way back when it was the Expansion, but I suppose that's better than having removed it. It can get a little douchey in here, but weekend afternoons are still delightful for chatting and clinking.
author: Gregor G.

description:
i love this place!  the cocktails are tasty and interesting.  the bartenders are really nice and know their stuff.  whether you need a place to chill post-work or a good starter place for a long night on the weekend, this is the place to do that.
it can get a teensy bit crowded on the weekends, but i rarely mind that since everybody's pretty chill there.
author: Diane D.

description:
I suggested Blackbird for a friend's birthday because we wanted to try this new place that looked smart, wasnt exactly on the fruit loop but was easy to get to from that loop.

It is really nice looking inside, the designers have done a great job of giving it an individual feel. 

I had read previous yelp reviews before going and was forewarned about the cocktails but hoped the owners might have read them too. Unfortunately in our party of eight only two people said theirs were strong enough - and neither the margarita nor the long island iced tea were part of the bar's own menu.

The men's toilet is just bizarre. An unlockable door opens from the seating area into a very smart room where nevertheless the sit-down toilet is totally open to everyone else. You could literally see someone wiping their butt from your seat in the bar if you're unlucky.

One of the bartenders withheld change from our party to take her tip, which is totally not ok. We were all of course going to tip the bartenders, but the tradition is - you give us the change, we tip you, not you keep the change and spare us the bother of deciding whether you earned one.

Despite all that I really want this bar to succeed as it's a smart addition to the area. I hope the owners are reading yelp and that they do something about these points.
author: jake o.

description: I went the evening of Memorial Day.  Hands down the best Midori Sour I've had in the city, or anywhere actually.  The bartender didn't use sweet and sour mix and instead used actual lemon and something else.  It was really good, just the right amount of tart.  It was loud in the bar and surprisingly crowded for being a Monday evening but we were able to snag a small table in the very front.
author: Marie B.

description: Blackbird is the perfect little bar in the Castro. I love the My Clementine cocktail, leather bound book, and the bitter end. All of their cocktails are great. It's a great meet up spot with friends since it's right in the center of the city and near lots of public transportation. It feels safe because you're in the Castro. Acoustics are a little bit loud but there are lots of little tables and places to sit and get cozy with your pals. This is probably one of my fave bars. Good music, nice people, just cute all around.
author: Kristy H.

description: The manager apologized for the Kelly Clarkson incident. I am impressed.
author: Tom M.

description: I've been here a couple of times and the last time was on a Monday evening and I really enjoyed myself. It was quiet enough to enjoy a conversation with friends. The place gets pretty packed towards the end of the week however. Tried a Brazilian cocktail called a Batida and it was so delicious! It reminded me of a spiked eggnog yummy.. I noticed they change their drink menu which is a plus since I'm always on the hunt for new beers to try.
author: Ericka A.

description: Nice ambiance and selection of drinks. If you are looking for an interesting specialty drink, this is the place to go. Some of their drinks are really elaborate. My favorite.....the leather bound book. Deeeeelish!
author: Jonathan J.

description:
this bar is great. the decor captures that rustic reclaimed restoration hardware vibe. drink selections are plentiful and there's plenty of room to sit, stand, or lounge.

plus to the pool table in the back, though i didn't play.
author: Ameer N.

description: Love, love, love this place!!  This was one of the first spots I went to when I moved up to the city and I immediately fell in love.  Everything about the place: the ambiance, the crowd, the drinks.  The drink menu changes seasonally which I find amazing.  They have a pool table in the back and a fun little photo booth.  It does get quite crowded on the weekends - this is clearly the spot if you're looking for a gay bar that's not so "Castro."
author: Henry R.

description: Great bar to lounge and hang out with friends.  Drinks are goood.  There's a pool table to get your competitiveness on.  The crowd is always cool.  LOVE!
author: Julia H.

description: Chill little bar/lounge where you can hang with your crew and unwind. Tasty drinks. Pool table in the back. Sit back and have fun! By the way, when we went here, it was busy on a Monday!
author: Mel P.

description: Great cocktails, good neighborhood vibe, good looking crowd, and probably the best place ever... if you're a hot, gay professional dude in your mid-30s. Very friendly and very nice bar with a photobooth!
author: Y K.

description: Loved this bar! I don't go out in this hood very often but I found this place to be a breath of fresh air. Busy but not too crowded, a nice mix of people, chill atmosphere where you can actually hear your friends talk. Good vibe overall.  If I lived closer, I'd be back regularly!
author: Priya N.

description: Great bar with a mixed crowd, a good vibe and some of the best gin-based cocktails in the city. Try the "Early Bird" when you're there. Also, I'd advise you to go during the week, since it can get ridiculously packed on weekends.
author: Christian O.

description: I'm really enjoying BB. It's far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Castro to give you a down home neighborhood feel with a terrific drink menu, and great beers on tap. One of my favorite new places for happy hour, and a super diverse crowed for Castro. It's a refreshing addition to the neighborhood for sure! A great local hang out spot. It's crowed and often, but it's a small place so it's not too hard to fill up, but worth it.
author: Ryan B.

description: This part of the city really needed a nice cocktail bar like Blackbird, which pulls off a quality bar without an ounce of pretension.  Blackbird has a relaxed but stylish interior, with a pleasant and skilled staff, and high quality liquor and beer.  What more do you need?  I was a fan of the Bull Fighter cocktail, which uses peppercorn and Cynar, the artichoke liqueur, to add some complexity to a drink that might be otherwise too sweet.   They could maybe use a couple more dry (and non-gin) drinks on the menu, but that is my only quibble.
author: Aaron S.

description: Came into the bar tonight expecting pretty poor service as the bar is very crowded on a Friday night. Our bartender was Matt and he made us feel like we were the only ones in the joint- it seemed like every time we ran out of a drink he was there to give us a new one. Even Managed to have friendly conversation while juggling multiple customers. Great bartender, great bar. Will definitely be back.
author: Cynthia W.

description:
After turning 21 I went bar hopping and among the places i went to was Blackbird. Very nice place. I'd call it artistic for the style they had going on and the lovely paintings they featured on their walls. Being close to castro it is mostly lgbtq crowd.

The drinks are interesting. I can't recall what i got, but it was alright. they're on the bitter side of things taste wise. i prefer sweeter drinks, hehe.

Only real downside to this place is that it's more of a group place, kind of small/narrow, and can get crowded rather quickly ergo... very loud.

friendly bartenders and the people who were there were also pretty friendly over all.
author: John S.

description: Love this place.  Great space, great crowd.  A welcomed addition and alternative in the Castro.
author: Craig V.

description: Just went here for the first time. Loved the atmosphere and the special drink the bartender made for me called "The Farmer's Daughter". I told him I want egg whites and gin and to have his way with my drink. It was amazing. They need to add this drink to the menu.
author: Ashley T.

description: Yelp describes 3 stars as "A-OK," but my reaction to Blackbird is really more of the 2-star "meh."  My Bullfighter was okay, but really with the salted rim? This drink isn't a margarita with a need to offset a tart flavor, so the salt really threw me for the wrong kind of loop.  Bartenders were nice and quick, though, and despite winning the ice jackpot, my fianceé's Pimm's Cup was decent-tasting.  I'd go back, but no rush.
author: P D.

description: I've been back to this bar lots of times since my first review and it's still a great place to hang out. I usually steer clear on Fri and Sat nights (too crowded for my tastes), but non-happy hour times are still a good bet. The cocktails are delicious as always and the bartenders are a lot less snooty than the ones at Orbit Room down the street. And it's closer than the Alembic. So, automatic win-win situation in my book!
author: Jenna H.

description: Yay for this quaint place for having Big Daddy IPA & a photobooth!
author: Letty D.

description: Good cocktails, diverse crowd, and nice space... Too bad about the music
author: Java Z.

description: This bar is amazing. I thank my lucky stars that I live on the same block so now I have a great place to get my drink on.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
the best joint for a stiff cocktail and friendly faces! the bartenders are
 always on game.when i want to grab a drink with friends this is always our go to.  we love this gray bar!!!!!!!
author: James B.

description: Great neighborhood bar with a variety of beers to select from on tap. Unsure of which one to have? Just ask the bar tender to taste them and you can choose the one to your liking. The setting is very friendly to promote conversation. The pictures alternate. The drinks are priced about right. If you are looking for a great place just to come hang out with friends and have a great conversation with people, this is a great place to come check out.
author: Pierce B.

description: Great happy hour.  Always super crowded- fairly diverse crowd, a little to busy/noisy for my tastes.  Serious competitions for a table... as soon as one opened up people were diving for it.  But $3 for a greyhound made with odwalla grapefruit juice!  Not super strong happy hour drinks, but cheap enough to make it worth while.  The cocktail list was strong, it looked interesting- $8 a pop for chipoltle bloody mary or other delicious sounding drinks.  I'd be down to check it out again, preferably when it's a little less busy.
author: Jett S.

description: This has become my bar of choice. Perhaps it's the mixed crowd. Perhaps it's the ambiance. Perhaps it's because Tiffany and Nancy make AMAZING drinks and treat me really really well. In fact all the bartenders are really great. It can get incredibly packed at times and deafeningly loud but I'd rather deal with that than go to any other bar in the Castro. At least I'd be in great company. They're good people here.
author: Jerry R.

description: Amazing cocktails!  The bartenders there are what a classic bartender should be.  They know their craft and seem like they enjoy being thrown curveballs.  Tell them what kind of liquor you like and be nice, they might make you an amazing custom made drink, or try one out on you.
author: Kasey B.

description: Blackbird was recommended to me by a friend who lives in San Francisco.  They have a great draft beer selection. I also tried one of their speciality drinks, the Blackbird Negroni.  The bartender was patient enough to explain the ingredients. It was an amazingly good drink, that also knocked me on my ass a bit.  The atmosphere is very comfortable as well.  There was a decent crowd for a Monday evening in late August.
author: Matt F.

description: This place has a much different feel than any other bars in the Castro (they don't blast GaGa, it isn't crowded with daddies, etc.) I'm not usually one who enjoys hanging out in a lounge, but I did enjoy meeting my friends here for a drink. I would say it's a great place to start the night if you have friends in town, because there isn't anywhere else in Castro that you can have a conversation without having to talk over loud music.
author: Steven M.

description:
Stopped in by complete unplanned coincidence today for happy hour at this bar which I had been hearing a pretty good amount of buzz in the last few months and had been recommended by a few reliable friends in the restaurant industry, as well as close colleagues who are every bit about a good happy hour as I am .
Some friends and I were going to Home for an early dinner and had 20 minutes to kill before they opened at 5, so we ended up walking a few paces and by serendipity ended up walking into a bar I had been hearing about and meaning to try for months .
Before even taking our stools at the bar , we were greeted very graciously by the  bartender and made to feel right at home .
The feel of the place and the decor seemed to be between a modern lounge and a saloon style bar, which actually balanced out nicely giving it a kind of 2 in 1 deal you felt you could come out of the rain and warm to at once - which was just the case on this rainy dark afternoon.  
Just like the most interesting man in the DosX commercial  , "I dont always drink beer, but when I do ....."
I am the same way, but I cant say a good selection doesn't turn my eye , especially if there are a good number of taps and they all look interesting and make you feel like there are more than a few you don't recognize .
The beer selection was beautiful as well as the wine list which was surprising , because at the more cocktail-driven bars around town the wine list is usually an afterthought not much balanced out to match the craft cocktails that seem to be the main emphasis , its like there are a few  wines by the glass there JUST IN CASE . 
And that is definetly not the case here.
Cocktail wise there is a serious approach to the craft with a an apparent underlining of appreciation and respect for the whole Pre Prohibition take on things which has swept the SF Cocktail scene strongly in the last few years . The Clementine I had was light , well balanced and made me feel I had found a true weapon of choice I could turn to over and over again .
Also I have found fewer and fewer bars that have a happy hour that goes on till 8 , which is a godsend and for me totally justifies the going up market from Soma- which I am sometimes too lazy to do unfortunately . 
All in all I have to give them 5 stars because for this bar-going happy hour-man they have truly hit the high note on every level making me a fan who will be coming back with a friend or 2 and a good deal of  money to be spent on a tour of the cocktail list.

Cheers !

B
author: bill h.

description:
cool decor with elements of beach house, modern, and old school bar.  A group of us went during Friday happy hour. The environment was fun and buzzing with lots of people.  

They have good HH prices and hours.  The cocktails were very tasty and fresh.  However, the time-consuming cocktail making & the large amount of people coming in made getting drinks after 6 a long process.  Get there early if you can.
author: diana t.

description: I love this bar! The quarterly changes to the cocktail menu keep me coming back for more. I've attended the Thursday wine special night once or twice and it was fun and educational. It becomes very loud when a little crowded, so I prefer to get in and out early (pre-dinner stop). The bartenders are considerate and attentive.
author: Sparks B.

description: My 2nd time going there will be tonight. 1st time there was nice, crazy crowded but I like the set up, good but expensive drinks. Cool photo booth in the back.
author: Karen T.

description:
Gotta say - this place is spot on.  Randomly went in with a friend who I was meeting at Church and Market, and was glad we did.  While it definitely has that "brand new" smell, they've done a great job with it, and the vibe and decor are suitably mellow and eclectic.  They have an awesome selection of beers and wines, and the crowd was full and energetic without being overwhelming (this was on a Friday night).  Highly Recommended.

By the way; about 2 hours into our visit it was mentioned to me that the bar "might be" a "gay bar".  Okay - it's near the Castro, so that's just going to be part of the crowd.  If you can't deal, don't go.  That being said, the overall vibe is definitely not that of a "gay bar" at all  - the place is just a stylish, hip spot.  Enjoy.
author: Patrick P.

description: Chill, yet upscale.  Not overly-loud.    Very good castro bar.    Wish they had more seats, though, and wish they took credit cards.
author: Dan P.

description: I love this bar!!!! This place is great!!! Love the ambiance, drinks, photo booth etc. Great crowd throughout the week though a little crowded on Sat. The drinks are awesome especially the Early Bird drink with elderflower. I strongly recommend this place if you are looking for a laid back bar without all the attitude that you tend to find at other bars.
author: Giovanni L.

description: went after work on a Friday. There was plenty of room when we arrived. so took a seat to people watch. I usually stay away from mixed drinks, but I ordered a " Sunset Swizzle' vodak,grapefruit,pachaurd , mint on crushed ice in a nice tall glass.  It was yummy. The bar was nice and roomy and light, NOT a dark bar.  The client mostly white male gay. But who cares.  The bartenders where welcoming and nice ' Sean" was our bartender and cute! They let you bring in food from next door " Home" or at least we saw that they did... will go back good vibe , and good stiff drinks I was tipsy after two " Sunset Swizzles"......... Nice to have a new place to go after work............
author: Susie S.

description: I stumbled upon Blackbird last night with two friends after working out across the street. We had unbelievably good drinks and the bartenders were super talented. The atmosphere is great and my friends and I happened to be sitting next to the owner, Sean and his sister Tiffany. We had great conversation, they were definitely the type of people you want to succeed. It made me like this place even more. I would highly recommend blackbird and I will definitely be going back with friends soon!
author: Elaina L.

description: Hot days, and ice cold Watermelon Wheat Beer .......  Nuff said.
author: Mark B.

description: Blackbird is aiming to open around 8 PMish on Thursday, July 23. The cocktail menu and beer list look good, and they serve wine by the glass. I'm definitely heading by to check it out tonight - review to be updated accordingly!
author: Christina J.

description: Great bar. Went to the opening last night and was really impressed. You walk in and you just feel the warmth of a pleasant neighborhood bar. I love their cocktails...Earlybird is my fave (lemon/vodka/st.germaine). The bartenders were nice and were really fast. And I love the fact the women's bathroom never had a line! Hah
author: Henriette P.

description: Great drinks and great atmosphere - and great for people watching/flirting!  This place can get very crowded so arrive early, especially if you're going to have a group.  I've been on a random Wednesday night and it was standing room only.
author: Vicente G.

description: I went here for my friends going away party and I had a great time We went on a sunday and we took up most of the place. The bar itself is really nice. Old newspaper headlines are used as wallpaper, beautiful bar, pool table in the back, and major plus..PHOTO BOOTH!!! Great place to sit and socialize w/friends. bartenders are very nice and make good drinks. However, be ready to spend money cause drinks are pricey. Nine bucks average for a drink
author: Erica Z.

description: The cocktails here are very tasty, perhaps relying a little too much on being 'unique', and at $10 each they are a little pricey. I would recommend Blackbird as a good place to stop in for one drink before moving on or heading home. This is in part due to the awful seating available. The low tables are exactly at knee height. This means you have to spread your legs far and wide to be able to lean in across the table - that is if you intend to have a conversation over the loud background noise.
author: Kes A.

description: Met a friend for happy hour here the other night.........it was fun. Cheap cocktails for the beginning of an evening. The bartendresses were fantastic - fast, friendly and super-cute. The bar is laid out well - enough space to move freely about the cabin. The bathroom.......definitely not my favorite. I hope they change their minds about the no-lock situation. Unfortunately adults in this situation do not really behave as adults....nuf' said. It's just unnecessarily uncomfortable. I'll be back though.
author: Tom R.

description: fancy dranks are mad good & eye candy behind the bar.
author: Kelly Kate W.

description:
so, it's almost perfect. they make great mixed drinks (i was impressed with the aviation, i believe) and also have some easy drinking beers, like tecate. the bartenders are also very nice! 

now i present the orders:

me: two tecates
they quickly handle it, beaming smile, even though i ordered perhaps the cheapest thing in the house

an hour later i return to the bar,
bartender: two tecates?
me: ha no but awesome that you remember me!
bartender: (winning smile) what'll it be?
me: old fashion
(bartender muddles with pride)
...

the crowd is great too. the roberta flack version of killing me softly came on the speakers and half the bar started singing along. you can too:

http://listen.grooveshark.com/#/song/Killing_Me_Softly/586050

the only downside! noise. the bar was fairly packed, but i've been in super packed bars and had a better chance of hearing people. i wonder if it's something with the acoustics? anyway, given that this bar must be packed every weekend, it's something worth examining on their part, imo
author: omar k.

description:
one of my new favorite bars of 2009!  good atmosphere, convenient neighborhood, and mixed crowd (aka no douchebags yet).

glad to see that the guys from the old Transfer are running this place.  the interior looks warm and comfortable.  i especially like the big metal table in front.  

music's usually fine - sounds like someone's ipod - but good selection.  good selection of beers.
author: kim n.

description: Blackbird is one of the few good bars in the castro.  The scene is not too old, not too young, a little gay (maybe a lot gay on weekends), and a little straight.  The decor is sophisticated and hip (a rarity for the castro).  The drinks are good, especially the citrus cocktails.
author: Jared E.

description: I would rate this place higher except for the fact that their restrooms are foul.  Not visable mess but a smell that blows you over as soon as you open the door.  When I mentioned this to a bartender he blew me off stating the restrooms were clean enough.  WTF!  This is not a cheap bar and I don't think it's too much to ask that they steam clean the restroom once in a while.
author: Kevin V.

description:
great, exciting drink menu! lots of thought, fun, and love put into it. its hipster swank. I'm into it.
I loves me bars, the only thing is : bring cash! no cards...they have an ATM, just giving the heads' up.
author: S B.

description: By far one of the most pleasant places to hang out on a not busy night. A lounge bar with enough space to hang out and enjoy conversation? Definitely hard to find around the Castro. But on a busy night - omg get me out! They make strong drinks which some love, but I personally think their cocktails are overrated. But the mix of ingredients and mixers combined with my shortness means I often leave feeling sticky from people careless spilling the drinks after having enjoyed one too many. The price is a bit higher than I'd normally pay, but when enjoying the space it's worth it.
author: Gadabout N.

description: Come on...Im not even gay and this place gets 5 stars from me.   The crowds seem cool...no rowdiness in sight.  I love the staff here.  Friendly and attentive, especially for how busy this place gets.  The decor and San Franciscan feel is just right.  I like the music volume because I can actually hold a conversation there without losing my voice.  I wish there was a Blackbird in the South bay.  Good times.
author: Jon N.

description: A fun bar. You've got a little bit of everybody inside. Good vibe. The music isn't blaring, so you can actually have a conversation. Bonus star for carrying hangar one vodka. I'll definitely frequent this bar if only it stays this way. You never know . The Badlands "overflow" might make its way over. Sorry for the cheap shot...to each his own.
author: Fil L.

description: Probably my new favorite bar in the Castro. It's far from what you'd expect in the Castro. None pretentious and very low key. Could get pretty packed and loud but it's worth it. The photobooth in the back is a very nice touch too
author: Alan W.

description: Nice owner, creative drinks, pretty crowd.
author: Melony B.

description: Nice cocktails and cool atmosphere, although it gets crazy busy. Try moving towards the back though and there's usually space. People gather near the door for some reason I'll never understand (just like on Muni!) so it looks like there's no room. I've been a few times and have enjoyed everything except the sauvignon blanc. But it's always a gamble with wine by the glass. Mmmm, sidecars.
author: Tamara M.

description: It's a really nice laid back bar that's a little away from all the Castro craziness. They had a bunch of interesting drinks and I had the hot toddy which felt like a warm cozy tea. The bartenders were very friendly and paid a lot of attention to the drink they were making and did not rush anything. I also tried the Manhattan which was a bit too strong for my taste, but for people who love strong drinks, it should be right up their alley.They also have quiet a few non alcoholic options - mocktails/sodas. Also, check out the pool table in the back. The only annoying part was it's cash only, so be ready for that.
author: Sushma Y.

description: It's really classy lookin. When I walked in If I didn't notice all the steamy hot gay men I would have mistaken it for a straight bar. It had some nice drinks and a pool table. I agree
author: Henry Y.

description:
This place is super cute. The drinks are awesome. The one bouncer/server is a complete jerk and should be fired. You know who you are. You favor plaid, have greasy brown hair that you wear in a wannabe Justin bieber style. You aren't that tall. Just, ugh, hipster from some sad Midwestern place who thinks he's cool now. Sorry, go home because I don't need any more idiots invading my state. So the trouble began last Friday.  We were drinking til the bartenders ring the gong announcing last call. We were sitting at a table minding our business when the beiber-haired guy swoops down and without even asking, picks up any and all glasses that my group of friends are not holding in our hands.  At 2am on the dot, I'm still finishing my drink but he says that we have to leave immediately. Ok, so I chug it. A friend heads to the bathroom to use the facilities before we head home. The rest of my party  hangs out near the door but stay inside.  It's a chilly night and a few of us in our party have some heavy bags with us as they had just arrived from the airport.  But the greasy man tells us that we need to leave, and when we say we are just waiting for our friend to finish using the bathroom he says we need to wait outside. Fine. Whatever. It's definitely a dick move, but not  the worst thing ever. Then hipster boy does the worst thing ever. He goes into the bathroom to find my (male) friend as he is using the facilities to tell him he needs to leave. Literally finds him in the bathroom and tells him it's time to go home. 

Now, if we were drunk or obnoxious or causing fights, I would understand. We had had about 2 or three drinks each, and her generally respectable adults in our 30's, the majority of  whom are administrators or professors at the university level, so not exactly your rowdy college aged frat boy. But apparently, the staff at blackbird thinks it is perfectly acceptable to snatch drink glasses from you as you are sitting peacefully and to seek out a patron using the facilities to kick us out of the bar at exactly 2am. 

The ridiculous thing is that I've spent years waiting tables, and last call usually means you will no longer serve more drinks or food, but you still need to wait until the last customers finish up, and you certainly don't go into the bathroom to rudely tell people to get out. Staying at teh restaurant past the posted closing time is part of the job, and if you don't like it, and are going to treat customers poorly if they aren't out exactly at closing time, you may be in the wrong business. Or, maybe I was just working at the wrong kinds of restaurants. 

Whatever the case, following my friend into the bathroom to drag him out of it, irregardless of whether he was at a urinal or in a stall or just washing his hands, is highly inappropriate and management really needs to reprimand this unprofessional idiot. 

If management is reading this, he was working the evening of Friday April 20th. But the bartender who helped me that evening was amazingly kind and gracious and skilled to boot! She rocks! She was working the end of the bar closest to the door. Definitely a keeper. Thanks for an amazing drink!
author: anna M.

description: the couches were pretty nice i must say. it kinda makes you feel like a rock star when you sit in that area. FYI, pretty good grape soda for those non-alkies.
author: Hugo B.

description: Last night was my first time at Blackbird.  What a nice place.  Friendly crowd, easy gois atmosphere and good drinks.  Definitely not your typical gay bar.
author: Ben M.

description: This is one of my favorite hang out bars in San Francisco. This is a really classy place that makes incredible drinks although kinda expensive. Never been dissatisfied. I just love to go here, get a drinks, and chill with friends. The whole scene is fun.
author: Justin T.

description: awesome place to kick it with your buddies for some unique drinks. there's a pool table, and some nice couches to relax on. plus you can actually hold a conversation here.
author: David P.

description: I went for my first time with a friend and was VERY impressed.  I had a couple of very good draft beers that you don't normally run accross and the new remodel is awesome.  It was a bit quiet, but I think it was just the night, but it worked out nicely for talking.
author: Michael H.

description: delicious pimm's cup and nice eye candy!
author: Helen T.

description: The remodel is amazing!  The place looks absolutely fantastic.  They are still working on their specialty cocktails, but I've had a blast there every time I've been since the place has re-opened.
author: Jason M.

description: Why hello my new favorite bar-on-the-cusp-of-the-castro/church-and-market-area.  This space has been transformed into a sleek and stylish new spot that we can only hope the B&T will overlook.  The pool table in the back, old newspaper wallpapering and very trendy hardwood floor/ hanging ceiling things (that's the official term) give the whole place a SoHo vibe.  Staff was nice and the music was a good mix, making this a nuetral spot to meet if you've got friends from different groups meeting up.  I'm happy to see something of this caliber open up in the neighborhood.
author: Laura S.

description: this place ROCKS, fun people, VERY friendly staff, door and behind the bar, WAY OUT THERE interior design, someone has a fantastic and creative talented design mind when pulling this place together....LOVE IT...can't wait to go back. It's my new fave hang out in "Castro East!"....
author: SFCAFOX S.

description: What a pleasant surprise. A flip done well in the 'Stro's lowerside. Was able to check out the place last night for its opening. I must say it looks like Blackbird will become my new go-to watering hole. Many fine and favorite beers on tap. Was able to play some pool on their spanking new table- amazing, forgot what it's like to play with cues that aren't sticky! What a concept...of course over time this will change, so play while their slick and still have their tips. The atmosphere is pleasant and I'll definitely have to check out their specialty cocktails when I go back.
author: Courtney H.

description: Love it. This place is just what the neighborhood ordered. Good beers on tap, good cocktails, and great atmosphere. Only downside - this place is cash only, otherwise I would have given it 5 stars. C'mon, it's 2009 and you don't take credit cards?
author: Tom A.

description: Excellent cocktails, good beer list, and fantastic atmosphere.  I really enjoy coming to Blackbird and bringing out of town friends in for a drink.  It's fun people watching and I don't find it too terribly expensive.  I was a huge fan of their Pimm's Cup over the summer.  This winter, I have been in a beer mood and have found good options on tap and in the bottle.  Good people watching too.
author: Jason S.

description: Yummy drinks, cute boys, good music, and super nice owner!!!
author: Boris J.

description: I have been back to Blackbird many times and the experience has generally been very good since my first visit. Not all the cocktails are a hit but they get an "A" for at least being inventive. However I was there last Friday and it was busy as usual but I was ignored by the bartenders as they proceeded to serve people from a certain ethnicity first. After twenty minutes of waiting I just left the bar in frustration. I probably will not be back.
author: David W.

description: Blackbirds usually build their nests in sensible places like hedges and trees, but on occasions they can create their "des res" in the most unusual places.
author: Greg P.

description: Drinks are always good and the bartenders are friendly. Nice mix of gay/straight Castro, Soma, Hayes Street crowd.
author: BARI P.

description: new menu!!! not to say there was anything wrong with the old one. but the new version is crackalackin!!! love their play on traditional drinks ...they have truly found a way to bypass the stupid laws that prohibit liquor infusion , i think this place is the new wave of bars and mixology . try something special when you go: it ll blow ur mind....also very queer friendly , so if your a homophobe dont come here please.
author: Ruca R.

description: they did a really nice job redoing the old expansion bar, from the interior to the outside sign, but something just doesn't feel right.
author: Pickle R.

description: I love the cocktails here, and the energy is great. The only one thing they need to work on is making the drinks a bit faster. Yes, they're mix-ologist, but they should still speed it up.
author: Fabian M.

description: Relaxed atmosphere, great cocktails, and friendly staff!  I couldn't have asked for a better place to drop in and have a great drink!  I wish we had something like this back home.
author: Brian C.

description: Eight of us girls came in opening weekend and this weekend I brought in my boyz.  All of my friends LOVED Blackbird!  An enjoyable time was had by all, due to the FRIENDLY service, the QUALITY of the drinks,  the stylish DESIGN & good MUSIC & lighting.  We made our way down the Specialty Cocktail menu:  My personal favorite was the Grape Drink (muddled red flame grapes, tequila, peach bitters, agave syrup & sparkling wine.)  I appreciate the agave nectar and not the processed simple syrup that most bars would use for sweetners.  I also tried the Pina Colada, Sidecar & Early Bird which I enjoyed as well.  The Early Bird is very light and refreshing.  If you don't want an alcoholic drink, try a wine soda!  Yummy!  Next time I go, I'll start with the Grape Drink then an Early Bird and finish with a wine soda!  During both of my visits, I appreciated that the music was a mix of genres other than the typical "Techno or Dance" you find at "other" bars.  Also, I liked that there was a nice mix of both friendly male and female bartenders too!  Some of my friends played pool and commented that the pool table was a good one and that it must be new.  There is a photo booth in the back that I will definitely use the next time!  FYI, I didn't notice a sign in the front, so look for lots of windows & large plants on each side of the front door. I look forward to my return!  Thanks Blackbird Peeps!
author: Kai N.

description: Glad to discover a new "good" bar in the Castro, and centrally located at that, within a short walk from the hub at the Church St. transit station.  Came here after a day of exploring the Academy of Sciences with friends from out of town and immediately felt good about my decision to go here (as exemplary of cool SF).  It's a nice bar, meaning well conceived design, with a bent of urbanity, but still very comfortable and friendly bar staff.  Does gay make everything better?  This could be case study number 1,000 concluding: yes!  Their bar snacks come from clean, monitored glass wear, empties are cleared promptly, the specialty drinks cross a gambit of classics re-envisioned (try the Blackbird special, like my fave, the French 75, but with a hint of elderflower), to the tried and true (a Bloody Mary with chipotle and a salad of accoutrements), and a decent wine selection to boot.  I felt like I was drinking a cool aunt's house, if she lived in a Dwell photoshoot, knew how to make contemporary comfortable, and had lots of well groomed friends around.  This place shoots to the top of my list when thirsty and looking to be seen.
author: Kathryn M.

description: Yummy drinks and friendly people! I love the atmosphere and how the drink menu changes. I will come here again for sure!
author: Michelle H.

description: Gave a 4 star rating since I've been a big fan of Blackbird from the day they opened. But think they're loosing their way with the drink menu. Was a true believer in their original concept of updating traditional cocktails. It's sad when I went by tonight and read a list of eight cocktails and none of the new additions were appealing. Actually tried a couple and wasn't swayed. They struck me as gimmicky. Stick to the classics and don't get caught up in the mixologist frenzy.
author: Chuck R.

description: This is my favorite bar in the Castro, by leaps and bounds. The interior is nicely decoroated and has a much classier look than any of the other neighboorhood bars. The drinks are great, and the crowd is typically a lot of fun as well. Not to be missed!
author: Ryan B.

description: I am not a bar person. I don't like bars. i dont really like to drink, and even when i did, i need more stuff to do. Blackbird is a bar's bar. I went there for a couple minutes last Saturday. We were supposed to be going out dancing, which got downgraded to a random bar with music, and that got downgraded to this new bar in castro. I had no idea it existed. It is in the spot where metro used to be, after metro had moved out of the spot Lookout is in now. So, its pretty close to BOC. The door woman was nice. Inside, it's a bar. There was some very low music playing, something countryish or I don't even know... I couldn't hear it. Even though it was Saturday, there was not even a pretense of going for the music. There was a pool table or 2 I think. It's not pretentious or yucky looking, just middle. I don't know how the drinks were. If you like going to drink with friends, and just stand there and talk to your friends and drink, then just stand there and drink some more, go here. It seems very good for that.  I don't like that, so I wont. But if you do, you should. It's a very bar-ry bar.
author: Merredith L.

description: they have a decent happy hour and beautiful decor. they pasted old newspapers on the wall from WWII and the quake of '89. they also have a pool table and photo booth. this place does get really crowded during the evening time, so come early!
author: selma s.

description: This bar is awesome.  Great drinks.  Awesome bartenders.  You would never know that this place used to be The Expansion.
author: arlo h.

description: quite simply, blackbird is a great bar.  cocktail menu is interesting, inventive and tasty.  decor/atmosphere is among the best in SF.  staff is very friendly.  a welcome addition to the greater castro area and to SF
author: Ross L.

description: Add my voice to the growing chorus of approval for this (relatively) new Castro boite (if you accept that "The Castro" goes all the way up to Church Street.)  I finally made my maiden voyage to Blackbird this weekend, and wonder why it took me so long.  This place is great...it's like Bourbon and Branch without the exclusivity.  I'm a big fan of the classic cocktails revival, so seeing drinks like The Last Word and Aviation (properly mixed with Creme de Violette!) listed on the quaint hand-written-on-butcher-paper drinks list made my evening.  I've been to many bars (including those who should know better) whose knowledge of a mixed drink starts and ends with a screwdriver that it's so nice to know someone can do cocktails right at a neighbourhood venue.  And speaking of neighbourhood, the clientele is a nice mix of gay and straight (and probably Bi and TS/G, to cover all bases) which really creates a nice atmosphere.  AND, kudos to the designer who hung those Edison bulbs over the bar.  Really cool!
author: Tom R.
